showerReviews.reviewText: Nice swimming pool, clean and staff are moderately friendly. However, overcrowding is a huge issue on weeknight evenings it seems. Any time after 5pm, there are multiple different classes on and the lanes that are free (can be as little as 2-3) are absolutely packed. Had at least 8 people attempting to swim in each public lane last night. Not good enough when paying over $100p/m for membership m

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am only commenting on the swimming facilities.
After months of closure and  who knows how much money spent, I found the upgrade to the pools disappointing.
I only use the pool facility with my grandson of 3.
The pools are almost entirely unavailable for public use. To pay $7 and have a meagre portion of a half lane available for a child to swim in is a rip off.
I was at the pool with my 3 year old grandson. I want to SWIM with him, so the shallow paddling pool is of no use. The shallow swimming pool was 99% occupied by swim school as was 50% of the larger pool. The other 50% taken up by elderly walkers who scowl at young kids being in the lane. I have attached a picture of the quarter lane available for public use by toddler swimmers.
The outdoor area was not upgraded at all. It is still fully exposed to the elements making it mostly unusable
The showers have no way of  regulating the water temperature, which is too hot for kids.
Very disappointing. Compared to Cockburn Ark that charges half the price, it is dismal.
showerReviews.author: Marie Mal

locations.title: Aqualife Centre
locations.address: 42 Somerset St, East Victoria Park WA 6101

showerReviews.reviewText: A swimming centre located in East Victoria Park. It has indoor pool, outdoor pool, and also pool for swimming lessons. The pool is clean and it also separates for swimmers with slow, medium, and fast speed. They have locker rooms to put your stuff and they are easy to use. Additionally, they also have a hydrotherapy pool and a steam room. For a public entry, the fees exclude the gym. But overall, this is a good place for a swim and worth the price.
showerReviews.author: Sadewa 48

showerReviews.reviewText: Only wish I'd found this place sooner!  On holiday from the UK and used to go to this pool way back in the 70s, so the nostalgia it conjured up swimming outside with the cool breeze and warm water was just blissful.  I paid on the door $8,20 for swimming which includes access to the spa and steam room.  Met some lovely people there, both staff and other guests.  A really good experience and plan to go every day that I am here in WA,
showerReviews.author: Maria Louise Bonheur

locations.title: AQUANAT

showerReviews.reviewText: Anat and her team at Aquanat are incredible. Our 3yo daughter hadn’t been to swimming lessons for a few years and I felt so much guilt about her getting ‘behind’. After committed to 2-3 terms at Aquanat she is bowing incredibly confident, not just in the pool but diving through waves at the beach. It has taken a load off my shoulders, and I am so grateful for the team at Aquanat!
showerReviews.author: Ashlee Crabbe

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic environment for little ones learning to swim. Have put both our toddlers through Aquanat since they were 8 weeks old, and now as a 3 and 1 year old they have an absolute love of the water and are safe and confident swimmers - which we owe to Aquanat! The instructors are highly knowledgeable and adaptable to each child’s needs and swimming stage. The whole team are so friendly and welcoming, and the facilities top notch! We love it here!
showerReviews.author: Thomas Hickmott

showerReviews.reviewText: Anat is a former Olympic swimming trainer and so passionate about teaching bubs to swim in an holistic, therapeutic setting. My daughter was delighted to be able to do classes with me in the pool with her from a toddler until 4 or 5, and learn at her own pace. At seven she graduated a fearless, water-loving mermaid. We will always miss and be so grateful for our lovely Aquanat days.
showerReviews.author: Annabelle Warwick

showerReviews.reviewText:
We love our swimming lessons at AQUANAT!

The venue is calm and quiet as there is only one class at a time, and the class sizes are nice and small. The team are warm and welcoming, and are great at addressing children’s individual needs in the water.

My 3yo is a confident swimmer and loves the water thanks to Anat and the team.

showerReviews.reviewText: We've thoroughly enjoyed our experience over the years at AQUANAT.  Having experienced swimming lessons with two of our little boys in Canada, it highlighted to us how fortunate we were to have Anat when we left Australia in 2021 with only one little boy.  Since returning from overseas, despite a change in location (Mosman Park to Alfred Cove) we are willing to travel for swimming lessons for our now three little boys, based on Anat (& Sharon is fantastic) & their unique approach that fosters a positive learning environment with a wonderful pool space that isn't daunting for the kids!

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is not a 4 star venue.
The gym literally stinks of sweaty smelly equipment that's never washed, there is broken tiles all around the pools inside and out.
The lifeguards are stuck up and rude and none of the workers want to be there
For the price they charge for people to come and swim is disgusting

They had a pool party and sausage sizzle today, was expecting to rock up to something decent but there was nothing.
None of the usual features were on and when asked to turn them on was told they don't work even though I was there yesterday.
The sausage sizzle was more expensive than the Bunnings across the road.
No prizes only had 1 game(giant guess who).
It was a complete disgrace compared to last year.

And to top it off they have a silent disco for kids who are wet and expect them not to jump in the pool.

Do not expect a good time at this place it's just a pool with sad lifeguards.

Or as the locals call it  the Belmont bath.
showerReviews.author: Keith Pritchett

showerReviews.reviewText: Be careful when wanting to cancel or not wanting to continue your pass, they will say it is cancelled but will continue your contract with out your  consent. I attended multiple times to dis continue my gym pass and was told one each occasion it was cancelled, money was taken out of my account without my knowledge. I was refused a refund. A very dodgy place, with broken gym equipment and uncleaned change rooms. I would recommend reconsidering your choice when signing up.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had not been to Beatty Park for about 30 years so it was a fantastic surprise seeing how it has been updated. It is a very user friendly centre with great facilities.
The car park is excellent and we had no issues getting a spot (and shade).
The prices are reasonable and the change rooms and toilets are excellent with individual unisex cubicles, which we really appreciate. My kids and I hate big cattle barn change rooms.
You could easily spend hours at these pools with family or alone.

showerReviews.reviewText: I have travelled extensively, and I’d say this is one of the best leisure/fitness centres I’ve visited. From the quality of the gym equipment, the superlative swimming pools, the diverse choice of classes (which are included in the membership price), through to the very high levels of cleanliness, staff friendliness, and outstanding value for money: this place ticks all the boxes. Sure, this is not a swanky health club/spa, but for those who simply want to train body and mind well, you’ll be hard pushed to find better.
showerReviews.author: David Charles

showerReviews.reviewText: I have travelled extensively, and I’d say this is one of the best leisure/fitness centres I’ve visited. showerReviews.reviewText:
Beatty Park Leisure Centre in North Perth is an outstanding community facility and easily one of the best leisure centres in WA. The pool areas are immaculate, with options for everyone — from heated indoor pools perfect for winter swimming, to outdoor lanes for lap swimmers, to kid-friendly splash zones. The water is always clean, the lifeguards are attentive, and it’s a safe and welcoming place for families.

The gym is excellent too, with modern equipment, plenty of space, and a great atmosphere. I really like the group fitness classes — there’s a huge variety, including yoga, Pilates, cycle, and high-intensity workouts, all led by motivating instructors who know how to keep sessions engaging. The change rooms and facilities are always tidy, and parking is convenient with plenty of spaces close to the entrance.

The staff are what really make Beatty Park Leisure Centre special. They’re friendly, approachable, and always happy to help, whether it’s answering questions about memberships, assisting kids with swimming lessons, or simply offering a smile at reception. You can tell they genuinely care about creating a positive experience for everyone.

If you’re in Perth and looking for a high-quality leisure centre with swimming pools, a gym, group fitness, and family-friendly facilities, I can’t recommend Beatty Park Leisure Centre enough. It’s the perfect place for health, fitness, and fun all in one spot!
showerReviews.author: Top g

showerReviews.reviewText:
I was really disappointed with my recent visit. Almost all of the swimming lanes were reserved, leaving only a few available for people like us who did not make a booking. It felt very limiting and unfair, especially for casual swimmers who just want to enjoy the pool.
On top of that, one of the staff members scolded us while we were using the slow lane (there was no leisure lane that time). We were stopping briefly in the middle because we can’t swim very well, and instead of offering guidance, the staff spoke to us quite harshly. It made us feel uncomfortable and unwelcome.
I hope the management can improve lane availability for non-reserved swimmers and ensure staff communicate respectfully with all visitors, regardless of their skill level. The complex has great facilities, but the experience could be much better with more considerate service.
showerReviews.author: Kinley Yangchen

I love this place but i should tell the true. Monday-Wednesday was lovely pool temperature for 25m pool. Thursday a bit cool but I can accept that. Today It was cooler than Thursday. I was talking with her (duty manager jacket). She said this water already 28 degree. I am so upset because she just said without checking first and I am swimming everyday in Cannington leisureplex. My complain is the manner. Why did she said without check the pool?. This is public service area and she should accept that complain and check that. I was waiting 20 minutes in walking line, but she didn’t check temperature in 25m pool. It should prepare well for pool before the guest is coming.

She should know where she is working for. And Leisureplex have to make checking list before and after operation hours.

I love this place but i should tell the true. Monday-Wednesday was lovely pool temperature for 25m pool. Thursday a bit cool but I can accept that. Today It was cooler than Thursday. I was talking with her (duty manager jacket). She said this water already 28 degree. I am so upset because she just said without checking first and I am swimming everyday in Cannington leisureplex. My complain is the manner. Why did she said without check the pool?. This is public service area and she should accept that complain and check that. I was waiting 20 minutes in walking line, but she didn’t check temperature in 25m pool. It should prepare well for pool before the guest is coming.

She should know where she is working for. And Leisureplex have to make checking list before and after operation hours.
showerReviews.author: Yudhi Irawan

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am writing to formally express my profound dissatisfaction with the recent services at specifically concerning the spa and steam room facilities.

I purchased an annual membership in June ,which includes full access to the gym, swimming pool, steam room, and spa pool. Firstly, I would like to highlight a significant service interruptthe steam room and spa pool were unavailable due to maintenance work conducted by your facility. As a paying customer, I was unable to use these services that I had paid for.

Now that these facilities have finally reopened, I have been following the new rule of exchanging for a wristband at the service desk to access the spa area. However, I have observed a glaring inconsistency in the enforcement of this policy. On a daily basis, I notice that more than half of the users in the spa area are either not wearing a wristband at all or are wearing wristbands of a different color, with no staff members present to manage or question this.

This situation is both frustrating and unfair. It creates a feeling of being penalized for being a rule-abiding member. Why should members like myself, who follow the procedures and have already endured a three-month service blackout, now receive an inferior experience compared to those who disregard the rules?

This lack of management undermines the value of my membership and shows a disregard for loyal customers.
showerReviews.author: Tony

showerReviews.reviewText: Plenty of parking, caters for all ages with toddlers shallow, learners middle depth & full sized pool with diving boards & ramp for disabled people. Seemed very reasonable price & discount if you are not swimming just watching family.& young kids under 5 free.
showerReviews.author: Bronwynn Lusted

showerReviews.reviewText:
We enjoy visiting Bilgoman Aquatic Centre. It's a 50 metre community pool with two wading pools for babies and toddlers.
It also has a slide for the kids at the shallow end, and a separate diving section away from the swimming lanes at the deep end.
The traditional kiosk sells hot pies and sausage rolls, as well as cold drinks, ice creams, and small paper bags filled with lollies. 💓
The big trucks driving down the main road will beep their horns at any of the kids who wave to them through the fence, which I think must be a tradition, as the centre is now fifty years old. 👌
showerReviews.author: Bubbles D

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fabulous facility!
Pools are kept beautifully clean as is the whole facility. The washrooms/changing rooms have had an upgrade since we last visited just 12 months ago and wow what a difference (even though they looked ok before). Hot showers available in the ladies changing rooms.
Couldn't find the family change which was disappointing as with a toddler this is where we normally head.
Lots of shade for byo picnic.
We will definitely be visiting again
showerReviews.author: Rebecca murray

showerReviews.reviewText:
We always swim here. Good facilities. There is a park with sand for the little ones, volleyball, free BBQs, and diving boards. Providing heaps of family fun for the day. (basketball court needs a hoop please) . I sat in the great shaded area admiring all the different ethnicities that swim here. Every one having fun and was such a great day. Our family are very strong swimmers and mindful of our children who are also strong swimmers. On a couple of occasions our 6yo wasn't allowed on the diving board because he's too small (again very strong swimmers and adults around them watching) I however do understand that staff are not to know this and I get that it should be one rule for all. I do wonder if there is a way to prove they're competent? I mean, we paid alot of money for swimming lessons to make sure they are safe in the water. He was upset but again, I do understand it's better to be safe then sorry regardless if our kids are greater swimmers then some adults. How is the staff supposed to know that?
My adult son 24yo was in the deep pool holding our 1yo who also knows how to float and has had swimming lessons and was asked to take her out whilst she was admiring all the kids jumping off the diving boards.
No complaints. The staff are just making sure there is absolutely no room for error and we understand that.
Great pools and very careful staff.
showerReviews.author: Tui Ross

Carly at the front reception desk was lovely, but she was the only thing that was. The pool was segmented up into sections for swimming lessons and there was only a tiny square available for swimming, if you could actually swim in water 0.6m deep. Why would swimming access be sold when there isn't actually anywhere for kids to swim? The pool itself is very small, there is no ventilation so it is humid and smelly.
Would not recommend. Bayswater Waves is 10 mins away, same price, and actually has pools available to swim in.

locations.title: State Sport Centres - MSAC

showerReviews.reviewText:
As a sportsman, one of my favourite places in Melbourne. The facilities are amazing and the price is very very reasonable. I recommend getting the off-peak pass which still covers most of the day (if you can make it work). The gym is huge, with all sorts of equipments and multiple free weight areas.

There are 2x 50m swimming pools (indoors and outdoors), a 25m pool, kids areas and a sauna and spa. The facilities are very clean, well staffed and would happily buy a yearly membership if I was living in Melbourne.
showerReviews.author: Zoltan Kalmar

showerReviews.reviewText:
Arrived at MSAC at 6.30pm. Rather than closing at 10.00pm as advertised, were advised at the front desk that the pool closes at 8.00pm.  When asked if the wave pool was open, we’re advised at the front desk at first that the wave pool closes at 7.00pm, the that’s corrected to 7.30pm.

We go in and and observe that the wave pool is CLOSED and then told by one of the staff pool-side that the wave pool is closed due to holiday hours and that the pool itself will be CLOSING at 7.50pm.

The website then says as different areas of the pool complex may have different hours, some opening later and some closing earlier.

This place (Victoria’s State Swimming and Elite sports complex) is run like a school canteen by people who no know better than kids in charge of a footpath lemonade stall. It’s an absolute JOKE!

Got all our sakes, fix the website and keep it relevant and up to date at all times…..hopeless!!!
showerReviews.author: A B

locations.title: Melbourne City Baths

showerReviews.reviewText:
Melbourne City Baths is a historic and well-maintained facility offering a range of recreational and fitness options. It features modern swimming pools, spa and sauna facilities, and fitness classes, making it suitable for both casual swimmers and serious fitness enthusiasts. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the facility is clean and well-organized. Its central location makes it easily accessible for city residents and visitors.

While it can get busy during peak hours, the overall experience is enjoyable, with a good mix of leisure and exercise options. It’s a great spot for families, individuals, or anyone looking to stay active in a historic yet modern setting.
showerReviews.author: Shanz Shanz

showerReviews.reviewText: Everyone here is pretty nice, except for this young female lifeguard with blonde hair on Saturday evening at just 6 PM(I respected the time) who was quite rude and seemed to target Asians specifically when telling us to leave, saying “get out right now, immediately.” I understand it’s closing time, and though my friend was still in the bathroom/changing room, I respected that and was hurrying to leave. we left before everything was fully shut down. But she showed no patience or respect, insisting I exit instantly. She didn’t say that to any white people, only to Asians, with a tone and reaction that felt discriminatory. I’ve been coming here much longer than she’s likely worked (I’ve rarely seen her), and the rest of the staff is really kind and inclusive, but she comes across as prejudiced and impolite.
showerReviews.author: Mk

showerReviews.reviewText:
The recent price increase is outrageous. In just two years, the entry fee has jumped from $6 to $9, a 50% rise yet the facilities look almost exactly the same. There’s no visible sign of major renovations to the change rooms or outdoor pool. This is a public swimming pool, funded by taxpayers to remain accessible to the community. A $9 entry fee is insane, especially with no discount for local residents.
If you’re a local reading this we should all collectively write to the council to get this lowered!
showerReviews.author: Lydia Young

showerReviews.reviewText: I love the Fitzroy pool but the whole place is in desperate need of some TLC. The gym was recently closed for a refurb where they did nothing to fix major issues with the layout of the space and even removed some equipment (bar bells) and haven’t replaced them. Getting a locker downstairs has become impossible with half the lockers missing doors or out of action indefinitely. No sign of any progress being made coming into summer.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pretty good, have definitely seen better but it’s just a 50m outdoor pool. If that’s what you’re looking for it’s definitely worth the trip.

Pool is not super heated so if you stay in one spot you’ll go cold.

Plenty of clean changing facilities, I really enjoyed the outdoor hot shower to rinse off after the swim.

Pool is on the old side, but relatively clean. Bits of debri and strange shapes on the bottom of the pool so not 100% clean.
Went around 2pm on a Monday and it wasn’t that busy, managed to get a lane to myself.

Parking is very annoying; you need to find a free spot on one of the one way streets around the place.
showerReviews.author: Karen

showerReviews.reviewText: After posting a week ago about my disappointment that every winter, the pool is regularly too cold for comfortable swimming, I was once again reassured that this was a transient technical issue (this time with the thermostat) that technicians would soon resolve. I decided to avoid the pool for a week, swimming at the glorious (and 27C) Doncaster Aquarena 50m pool rather than using my membership at Fitzroy, in the hope that the problem would be rectified. Today I gave in and swam at Fitzroy where I was confronted by water temperature of 24.4C, 1.4C lower than it was last week. And this after a week of technical work on the thermostat. Surely the Council can do better! Swimming Australia and FINA specify that pool temperature should be between 25-28C...
showerReviews.author: George Jelinek

locations.title: North Melbourne Pool

showerReviews.reviewText:
Okay, you guys aren't ready for this story I am about to tell you.
I arrived at the pool, around 60 seconds before closing, and every staff member I came across just started YELLING at me for no reason? Anyway, I just didn't let it get to me and continued into the water. At first, I was having time of my life because no one was there! But soon enough I felt something in the water with me! It was kind of dark so I couldn't really see, I squinted really hard and realised that there was a staff member behind me trying to fish me out with the pool cleaner!!!!! It was fine though because the pool was too wet anyway, disgusting right? Then I made my way to the sauna, but when I got in it was too hot! Like 20 degrees! Are they trying to kill me!? So, I tried to escape, buy the door was locked!? So, I just sat down, and it was actually really relaxing because they started playing some nice music for me! And also, they put on some fun red and blue lighting! But it started hurting my eyes because it was flashing too much. Then a policeman unlocked the door and escorted me to the exit! SO RUDE. Since when was the pool shut!? What pool shuts at 3AM!? Basically, DON'T COME HERE. They even made me put clothes on and said I couldn't swim unless I had a swimming cap because apparently they didn't want the red dye in my hair all over the pool.
showerReviews.author: Hamlet Gerulf

Superb little pool.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great 25m pool, and kids pool.

Love hate relationship with swimming.  Did it when injured and couldn't run, and when  doing triathlons.  1500m. On a clear sunny  but not hot day water clear as crystal and can see from one end of the pool to the other. Inviting. Hot days though, busy and water start to make me imagine, broth :) It's not of course.

Under pressure now with all the extra people.  And I hear difficulty getting staff.

locations.title: St Kilda Sea Baths Complex

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very interesting concept of a swimming pool. Filled with salt water (presumable from the ocean) it is nice to swim in their 25m pool, but if you’re coming to practice your open water skills this won’t cut the mustard 😉
The water is a bit warmer than your average swimming pools and you can’t really swim for that long because the salt water will start getting to you but if you do practice, there is an option to unwind in their hot pool with a view of the ocean and a steam room.
$15 entry + $3 locker hire was a bit more than I expected but a pretty cool thing to try out if you’re in the area!
showerReviews.author: Zoltan Kalmar

showerReviews.reviewText:
The St Kilda sea baths owned by South Pacific….I love it, but also, it’s gross!

There’s a scum line on the spa about 1cm wide at the top of the water line rim. Rarely cleaned. Dirty change rooms and steam room falling apart, their “revamp” of the steam room was non existent.

I go because I love the views, and the community, and I’m grateful for what we DO have, it’s very unique. But i’d be more than happy to pay slightly higher prices for a cleaner sleeker environment! It just could be really amazing if they put a bit of work in.
showerReviews.author: Kat Armstrong

locations.title: Hawthorn Aquatic and Leisure Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
I couldn’t be more happy about this place! It’s a very complete and well-equipped facility, with brand-new machines and plenty of space to train comfortably. They offer a wide variety of classes from early morning until evening, making it easy to fit workouts into any schedule. The gym also have a swimming pool, a warm-water pool, and a sauna. Although the sauna can get a bit crowded sometimes because it’s not very large, it’s still a great place to relax after training.

I also want to highlight the excellent work of the staff, especially the lifeguard — a blonde lady with shoulder-length hair — who truly stands out for her professionalism and dedication. It’s clear that she genuinely cares about her job and the safety of the members.

Overall, an outstanding and highly recommended leisure center 🩵
showerReviews.author: Jul O O.

showerReviews.reviewText: If you are have a swimming class full of small kids you should put a sign at the counter so people like me who actually want to swim will choose another time to come. The whole inner pool was divided into two swimming class sections and one multi-purpose section. However 80% of the kids were in the multi-purpose sections, there’s no way you can swim in there. There is only a kid swimming in the other lane and when I tried to get into that lane. The parent or coach( I don’t know) asked me to leave, why I have to leave? I also paid to be here, it’s just not reasonable
showerReviews.author: Yuchen Xin

showerReviews.reviewText: This place might have a few lifeguards keeping an eye out, but it’s still a right midden. The floors, toilets, and showers are filthy, and I never saw a soul clearing up the tumbleweeds of hair rolling about the place. They've got rotas outside the changing rooms claiming there's hourly inspections, but I reckon the cleaner is either invisible or on an extended tea break. More than half the lockers are busted, so folk have to leave their bags lying around and just hope some wee chancer doesn’t pinch them. If you’re looking to accessorise your feet with a lovely mix of old plasters, hair, and mysterious grime, then this is the place for you!
showerReviews.author: George-Li

locations.title: Brunswick Baths

showerReviews.reviewText: It's below average I'd say. I mostly use the gym and occasionally the pool. Not sure I'll keep the membership long term. Firstly, this place is not a good option if gym is your priority. It is quite small with limited equipment, and during busy times the wait for certain equipment is long. They have all these cardio machines that not many people use. It would be better if they got rid of some of these unused machines and replaced it with more gym equipment. The change rooms often get manky. Something that happens everywhere I guess, but the hygiene of some of the toilets are a test of endurance during busy occasions. Third issue is with the lockers in the change rooms. The amount that have faulty locks and don't work is ridiculous. The matter has been brought to their attention before, but it seems to me they don't give a .... and no I'm not wasting my time sending an email to some generic address only for it to be ignored with no reply when you already know it's an issue. Instead I'll let the public here know that it's a problem.
showerReviews.author: Darren L

showerReviews.reviewText: It's below average I'd say. I mostly use the gym and occasionally the pool. Not sure I'll keep the membership long term. Firstly, this place is not a good option if gym is your priority. It is quite small with limited equipment, and during busy times the wait for certain equipment is long. They have all these cardio machines that not many people use. It would be better if they got rid of some of these unused machines and replaced it with more gym equipment. The change rooms often get manky. Something that happens everywhere I guess, but the hygiene of some of the toilets are a test of endurance during busy occasions. Third issue is with the lockers in the change rooms. The amount that have faulty locks and don't work is ridiculous. The matter has been brought to their attention before, but it seems to me they don't give a .... and no I'm not wasting my time sending an email to some generic address only for it to be ignored with no reply when you already know it's an issue. Instead I'll let the public here know that it's a problem.
showerReviews.author: Darren L

showerReviews.reviewText:
Unfortnately the lanes are now all single again as they have been for many weeks. Wake up management....having double lanes is a better swimming experience and actually allows more people to share. Also the changerooms need a regular clean.

Great tbat the lanes are now split into double size. This is a much better swimming lap experience, as you can pass people easily and actually have more people share the lanes. Good on management for trying something different. This works well. I hope you do this with all the lanes all the time.

showerReviews.reviewText: My little son contracted Cryptosporidiosis (parasite) after attending the pools here. He was held under the water by a swimming instructor during a lesson without being taught the basics of holding his breath. I witnessed my son swallow a significant amount of water before being pulled up by this instructor and gasping for air. Disgusting behavior, disgusting pool. If you find yourself getting sick after attending this facility, contamination is the reason why. Beware.

locations.title: Richmond Recreation Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
Richmond Recreation Centre is a fantastic community facility, and the pool is easily one of the best features. It’s the kind of place that works for everyone — whether you’re swimming laps, bringing the kids for a splash, or just wanting a casual swim to unwind.

The main pool is spacious, clean, and well maintained. The water temperature is always just right, and there are plenty of lanes available for swimmers of all levels. I really appreciate how the lanes are clearly marked for different speeds, which makes lap swimming smooth and enjoyable without the stress of overcrowding.

There’s also a great program pool that’s perfect for lessons or gentle exercise, plus a kids’ pool and spa/sauna facilities that make it a full experience rather than just a swim. It’s a genuine all-rounder.

The lifeguards and staff are excellent — professional, attentive, and friendly. You always feel safe knowing the pool deck is properly supervised. The staff at reception are equally welcoming and efficient, making the whole experience easy from the moment you walk in.

The centre itself is well equipped, with modern change rooms, lockers, and showers that are clean and functional. It’s clearly looked after with care, which makes a big difference for regular swimmers.

What I love most is that Richmond Rec Centre really feels like a hub for the community. There are people of all ages and abilities using the facilities, and the atmosphere is always positive and inclusive. Whether you’re training seriously or just dipping in for some light exercise, it’s a place where everyone fits in.

Richmond Recreation Centre pool is an asset to the area — reliable, welcoming, and consistently excellent. Highly recommended for anyone in Richmond looking for a great swim spot.
showerReviews.author: Angel Chooky

It would be nice if they could provide towels and swim caps in case guests forget. They are also replying mail if you ask for information. Easy to reach with public transportation. Will go back when in Melbourne.

The showers are great, but the pool’s design makes swimming a bit harder due to the depth changes. Overall, a decent spot for a swim, but be prepared for the crowd!

showerReviews.reviewText: We came here to swim with our 9mo old baby. The toddler pool was perfect for it - temperature abd depth, and easy to get in and out. The one drawback is there is only one family changing room which makes it a bit tricky to get everything organised pre and post swim, especially as most people take 10-15 mins to use the change room with children. Also the change table could do with fixing - its a little scary placing your little one on a very tilted change table!
showerReviews.author: James M

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really good facilities, friendly staff and well managed, mostly very clean and competitively priced.

I mainly go for therapy in the sauna, steam & spa facilities. For experienced users, these are not quite hot enough, but they do the job. However, other sauna/steam users that constantly come in, stay for 2 minutes, complain it's not hot and then leave, is really annoying, as they are actively dropping the heat with this behavior.
(Note to these people: it takes a minimum of 10-15 minutes of exposure to get any health benefits. Just be patient!)

Maybe management could put up some signage explaining sauna courtesy.

The change room showers are also not ideal, being too cramped, sometimes dirty and often no hot water. I avoid them and save my thorough shower for home.

Despite these complaints, it's a great place and I always leave feeling better.
showerReviews.author: Ty Allen

showerReviews.reviewText: As our closest pool, my family have given this place so many chances over the last couple of years - both lessons and casual swimming. We've concluded that this is not a good place to bring kids to swim. The atmosphere is so weird and negative. A couple of the many lowlights include one of the lifeguards touching my kid for no apparent reason, and my wife getting told off for using her phone while our kid was IN A LESSON! Casual swimming with kids is also a waste of time, as lessons are given total priority and only a small, sometimes packed area is left for others. The changing areas aren't great either. Trust me, go somewhere else - don't let this sad place be your kid's experience with swimming.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Have noticed that lots of people start swimming classes for their kids here & then move elsewhere. The instructors are great, but the classes have too many kids (this morning our son’s class had 9! Children participating in one half hour class), feels like a bit of a money grab. The staff that work in the centre are mainly kids & don’t really have answers to a lot of questions & in our personal experience made mistakes & left us to deal with the consequences of that.

We tried to book private lessons but the centre never responded so we have moved elsewhere. A shame as this has always been my local go to since I was a child

showerReviews.reviewText:
Today we made a friend with Cérge.
Going swimming isn't something we usually do as many venues can’t cater to our needs of a quiet space. But today we arrived at the venue Ascot Vale Leisure Centre feeling good, my son was slightly nervous, but staff were welcoming so that eased his nervousness.

We had a great relaxing, quiet swim and then a quick exit as the kids were worked out after their swim and will most definitely be back again!I can see how the Cérge app will make life easier for so many people and parents /carers.

Knowing the venue knew what we needed and could provide it eased out anxiety so much.
I hope every business adopts Cérge, it would certainly give us more options as a family.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I give the gym 5 stars. Good equipment (lots of recent new additions too) - nice staff. I give the pool 1 star. The pool is dreadful. I have been coming here for ten years for swimming lessons. It is incredibly hot inside as a spectator (which I have no option not to be because my kids are having lessons). They don’t seem to operate any air conditioning or even fans half the time. It’s the beginning of March and I didn’t see any fans in February. It’s even boiling in winter in the pool to have to watch your kids at swimming lessons.
Staff say no one complains about the pool temperature? Come on, that’s ridiculous, I have been here ten years and plenty of people do find the pool atmosphere too hot. Also the toilets / change areas in the pool are a mess. I expect them to be a little messy but I’ve given up showering my kids here at all after being confronted with piles of pubic hair on the floor several times recently. I know it’s hard to keep public toilets clean with high foot traffic but that’s a bit much.
Again your gym is great. Your overall facility it great. Your pool not great not even good.
Edit - swimming lessons used to be mainly ok but have gone down hill. Putting kids back in the kiddie pool to prioritise more open lanes for the public? It is what it is and public need room too but it shows a lower priority for swimming lesson customers but we are still charged same price. The older kids do four strokes of the kiddie pool and hit the other end or are made swim around in a square for a longer lap because there is no room. Just not that stimulating for them or helping with stamina
showerReviews.author: K T

We moved here for swimming after the Kensington Pool closed for renovation
and honestly we will probably stay here.

SHOUTOUT TO DAWUD 500/5 teacher pay him extra!!!! When he was my teacher I Leveled up in 2-3 months and my swimming was way better
Basicly, DAWUD IS AMAZING he actually shows you how to improve and isn't just trying to get the next paycheck -from  Alex B, Dawud's student during winter 2025. Also parking is really good and the trees are really nice. And it's really east to swap classes
ONCE AGAIN SHOUT OUT TO DAWUD, DAWUD IS THE GREATEST

We moved here for swimming after the Kensington Pool closed for renovation
and honestly we will probably stay here.
If you get a good teacher then you can find yourself going up 2 or 3 levels in 1 year. Some of the teachers aren't great and just watch you swim and give you basic tips until the level up people come and give tips. Ascot Vale Leisure Centre leaders, of you are reading this
SHOUTOUT TO DAWUD 500/5 teacher pay him extra!!!! When he was my teacher I Leveled up in 2-3 months and my swimming was way better
Basicly, DAWUD IS AMAZING he actually shows you how to improve and isn't just trying to get the next paycheck -from  Alex B, Dawud's student during winter 2025. Also parking is really good and the trees are really nice. And it's really east to swap classes
ONCE AGAIN SHOUT OUT TO DAWUD, DAWUD IS THE GREATEST
showerReviews.author: Megan Hill

showerReviews.reviewText:
Dear Management,
In my previous post you boldly replied undermining my statements and pretty much denying my accusations.
Now please note, if my review wasn't the truth, it wouldn't have got 4 other people giving it the thumbs up.
However let's skip that & have a look at these photos,
As you can see the spa's entire side isn't operating and this has been the case for quiet some time now, almost 8 Jets are out.

Then please refer to the photos of the change & washrooms.
Now please advise me if this looks like it is washed regularly?
On Thursday night, 7 people had to ask your staff almost 4 times to wash out the steam room due to its disgusting state, and we still got nowhere. Then another swimmer got up grabbed the hose and washed out the room himself.

If we look at other posts we can also see I'm not the only one who has brought up these issues.
showerReviews.author: I SK

The amenities are well-maintained, with plenty of showers and toilets available. Sanitary stations are conveniently located throughout the gym. Definitely considering getting my membership.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This place is absolutely lovely. It's not huge (thank God) but it is perfect for me.
The staff are so nice and professional. Especially Megnon (sorry but I'm pretty sure I'm misspelling her name) who showed me the whole space. Her skills at the front desk are good to admire. And Patrick, PT, who's very passionate at what he does.
The whole place is so tidy and clean. And it smells so good. Thank you for that!
Equipment is acceptable too even though there are some machines that you won't find (like the lying leg curls or any calves related) you can still do a variation in another one.
The bathrooms are big, clean and you get a hairdryer, deodorant, mouthwash, tissues, etc.
The vibe is very nice too. It feels so good in here. I've never experienced any bad situations in here. I felt welcome and very comfortable since the moment I stepped in.
You have free classes you can attend to. Which is awesome too.
Highly recommended.
showerReviews.author: Diego López

locations.title: Snap Fitness 24/7 Port Melbourne

showerReviews.reviewText: Listen, I have trained at near every snap in the city of Melbourne AND in multiple snaps overseas and in the U.S. and port Melbourne is without a doubt the best snap that there is. The facilities are amazing, the staff is incredible and the community is kind and supportive! It’s easy to train on your own or with mates as the space is huge and accommodating to any workout style. There are multiple machines so very little lines or wait times to get on the popular ones, multiple racks of dumbbells, kettle bells, fantastic boxing facilities, stretching areas are elite and the lockers are modern, clean and have great lighting! Ample parking and a beautifully designed gym that gets the best golden hour in the city!!

locations.title: Fitzroy Gym

showerReviews.reviewText: Overall great! Has everything you need (cardio, free weights, machines, plyo). Easy to sign up for a day pass and staff are really friendly. Couldn't find a cheaper day pass in the area. Has a few racks and areas to deadlift. Lots of fans and the temp was pretty good. Not too crowded. As far as complaints go, there aren't many. I did trip more than once on the elevation change going towards the locker room. Some bright tape or paint would really help on those sloped rubber mats. Some equipment is pretty well used, but it's manageable. The setup for weights near the deadlift platform was odd, just a bunch of 15 kg plates, so I had to steal some heavier plates from a nearby rack that luckily wasn't being used. Came here twice while visiting. I'd recommend it.
showerReviews.author: Christopher Hallock

locations.title: Doherty's Gym City

showerReviews.reviewText: Great, great gym in Melbourne CBD. I dropped in on a Friday morning to get some training done during my long weekend visit. I got a casual pass, which was easy to do. Staff were friendly, helpful, and approachable. Amenities were clean, spacious, and bright. The equipment and space throughout were all top notch. As a powerlifter I was impressed by the specialised equipment on hand- rogue and eleiko bars and plates, plenty of excellent racks, benches, and platforms. Body builders would be happy here too though with plenty of dbs, lots of equipment, and reminders of visits from Coleman and Schwarzenegger. Super interesting architecture also being in the banana alley vaults/ viaduct buildings with trains going overhead. 10/10 would recommend and I'll be visiting again when I'm next in town
showerReviews.author: Tiffany Christina Tran

showerReviews.reviewText: Gym is generally good with lots of different equipment. Rarely have to wait for someone to finish (especially if youre training legs), but sometimes can be a short wait for barbell bench press. Crowd can be a bit annoying during certain hours with meathead roided bros trying to draw attention to themselves or kids vaping when you're puffing in your workout. My main complaint is with hygiene. There's never soap in the toilets. Ive brought it up a few times with reception but it seems to be an ongoing issue. Also if you workout on the equipment next to the toilets it smells pretty gross. Otherwise it's a fine gym,  convenient and 24/7.
showerReviews.author: Tbbyddy

locations.title: Virgin Active Collins Street Gym

showerReviews.reviewText: I was very pleasantly surprised when I found this facility in such a busy area.  I had read a few negative reviews so I was initially a little apprehensive but from walking in, having a very cheery welcome, being offered the free trial session and enjoying a good swim in a lovely pool with the biggest jacuzzi area I have ever seen plus a really big sauna! The pool temperature was perfect for swimming, perhaps the person complaining in a previous review thought it was a bathing pool as opposed to a swimming pool! I returned the day after to use the gym, I did think that was quite pricey but it had everything I needed and it meant I could continue with my training plan.

locations.title: Port Melbourne Beach

showerReviews.reviewText:
Port Melbourne Beach is one of the most beautiful and relaxing coastal spots in Melbourne. The beach offers clean golden sand, calm blue waters, and stunning views of the city skyline, especially during sunset. It’s an ideal place for swimming, jogging, or simply unwinding by the shore. The walking and cycling paths along the foreshore are well-maintained and stretch for kilometres, making it perfect for outdoor exercise or a leisurely stroll.

The area has plenty of nearby cafés and restaurants where you can grab a coffee or enjoy a meal while overlooking the water. It’s also family-friendly, with safe swimming conditions and plenty of open space for kids to play. The beach is usually clean, and there are public facilities like showers, toilets, and shaded seating areas that make it convenient for visitors.

Port Melbourne Beach is easily accessible by car or tram from the city, and parking is generally available nearby. Whether you’re visiting for a quick swim, a walk with your dog, or a relaxing day in the sun, this beach has something for everyone. Its peaceful atmosphere, scenic views, and proximity to the city make it one of the best coastal escapes in Melbourne.
showerReviews.author: Nawid Noori

locations.title: South Melbourne Life Saving Club

showerReviews.reviewText:
The South Melbourne Life Saving Club (SMLSC) plays a vital role in providing a fun and engaged community environment and a safer South Melbourne beach, which throughout the summer months, is one of Melbourne’s most popular bay beaches. Together with the Port Melbourne Life Saving Club, the SMLSC patrols a 1.5 km section of beach between the Kerferd Road and Lagoon piers.

The current SMLSC building and public amenities are now undergoing redevelopment and a new clubhouse is being built. This will provide a new kiosk, a multipurpose room for community use, accessible public toilets, landscaping and will also improve the safety of the cycle path adjacent to the building.

As well as providing greatly enhanced club and public change room/toilet facilities, the new building will incorporate new deck, shade and ways for people to access and enjoy the beach from the footpath and bikepaths, including an all abilities access ramp to the sand.

I've seen the concept design and am really excited and can't wait to see the completed redevelopment. I'll have to revisit and update photos then.
showerReviews.author: Adam G

locations.title: Beaumaris Life Saving Club

showerReviews.reviewText:
Had the best day there yesterday. Hired the venue for my baby shower. It was just perfect! On the beach,  superb outlook, ample space for everyone, chairs , trestle tables, fridge, urn, all
the basics there to use. Windows all round, front deck and back patio area - all there to be used.

Margaret was just divine - so friendly, so incredibly helpful and even helped us set up for the baby shower - so so kind! And then Ken the President came down and also helped me hang some banners.. they then surprised me and came back at the end to help us pack up - just lovey, lovely people.

All my guests commented on the venue - parking was no problem, even had parking onsite - pulled up right to the door to unload the car. I would highly recommend this venue for anyone wanting to have a party there - a baby shower, 40th, kids birthday - whatever it may be - I’d recommend.

showerReviews.reviewText: Overall ‘passable’ motel. Stayed the night with my partner. The room is very old, smelt like cigarette upon arrival, shower head was leaking, towels had stains on them, air con couldn’t be used because of the smoke smell coming through it and the toilet roll holder kept falling off so this truely is a ‘3 star’ motel. Booking process was easy, rooms are secured with a PIN code which is a nice touch. Customer service was nice and someone was at reception (10pm) when we checked in. The area is a little bit ‘how ya going’, the police were even there at 3am, but overall it’s an okay place to get you out of trouble for the night and is reasonably priced! ☺️

We had been put in two upstairs rooms but needed one of them downstairs due to one of our group not being able to climb stairs.  He was happy to chance our room with one being available.  The rooms are clean and reasonable.  You get what you pay for and at a cheap price, it's as good as expected.  There is a supermarket, service stations, KFC, Subway and all you can eat pub restaurant across the road, so great spot close to amenities.  Would stay here again.

It was long weekend so although I thought this was average I gave them the benefit of doubt, but once that was over and they were pretty well empty still cold. Another big thing to mention is that the location is really great! I'm already looking forward to my next stay with them.

locations.title: BIG4 Melbourne Holiday Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
We've stayed at the Big4 Coburg in the past and the location is fantastic. Within walking distance to shops and a tram ride into the CBD, it's an ideal spot to relax and explore Melbourne.
The only downside this trip was that the ladies' shower block had a bit of a water issue. Apart from that, the pool was pristine, camp kitchen was immaculate with fresh tea towels and cleaning cloths, and the sites were very generous. We'll definitely be back.

We've stayed at the Big4 Coburg in the past and the location is fantastic. Within walking distance to shops and a tram ride into the CBD, it's an ideal spot to relax and explore Melbourne.

showerReviews.author: Trish W

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed twice. First time beginning of December. They drained the pool and we were not able to use it during our three nights stay. I asked the first day we arrived if it would be ready the next day and they confirmed, but in the end it wasn't. No notice given. Amenities were being renovated. What was really annoying was our second stay and it was mainly thanks to one fussy lady at reception. Upon arrival she asked to see my husband who booked our stay. I had his passport with me but she still demanded to see him in person. Did not happen the first time we checked in here. Next,  I was using the laundry and one of the washing machines came up with an error after I paid. So went back to reception to ask for a refund and use a different machine. That same lady told me she could only give a refund once she had seen our bank statement. I showed her the transaction, which said approved, not pending or canceled. In the end I did not bother to go back again with our bank statements and simply popped our washing into a different machine. That is not the way to make customers or to keep them. Sites are rather small due to location. Lots of cars parked on street or blocking pathways. Kitchen has induction, lots of people including ourselves experiencing issues as only few pots/pans work. On our second stay amenities were open again and looked quite nice, showers were not hot, though. The ensuite amenities do not have enough hooks or shelves but hot water
showerReviews.author: sandra l.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We recently stayed at Big4 Melbourne.  Our experience was fantastic and the staff were lovely, friendly and happy to always help and assist.  The cabin we stayed in was clean and tidy.

The park was clean and quiet and can accommodate for everyone. The outdoor cinema is fantastic for everyone, always received messages to let you know what movies were playing at what time. It really is a great set-up.

The games and gym areas are also a fantastic addition as we had a bit of time in both areas.

The pool and spa areas we're clean and tidy. Even the camp kitchen is well set-up as it has a number of oven's for people to use.

Well done to all the staff as it takes a great team to maintain such a clean and tidy park, cabins ect.

Woolworths is close by and the tram stop is about a 15 - 20 minute walk from the park. Such a lovely place to just relax with loved ones.

We'd certainly recommend it to family and friends. We were very happy staying here and welook forward to staying here again in the future.
showerReviews.author: paul rowe

showerReviews.reviewText:
We spent 6 nights in a villa for family holiday. The accommodation was modern and nice! Even had a dishwasher which was great! Though it was small and very little room for luggage which got frustrating. The fan in bathroom and toilet was very loud and disturbed kids at night so we used a camp light at night. No blind on kitchen window and had people looking in as they walked past and people in other cabin can see in and straight into the bathroom aswell so we had so didn’t feel very private. Parking was very tight.

The park was nice. Smaller than I expected. Location was quiet and about 25-30 min from the city. The staff were very friendly.

Overall pretty good. Would I stay again? Probably not. I would chose somewhere closer to the city and accommodation with more room.

We spent 6 nights in a villa for family holiday. The accommodation was modern and nice! Even had a dishwasher which was great! Though it was small and very little room for luggage which got frustrating. The fan in bathroom and toilet was very loud and disturbed kids at night so we used a camp light at night. No blind on kitchen window and had people looking in as they walked past and people in other cabin can see in and straight into the bathroom aswell so we had so didn’t feel very private. Parking was very tight.

The park was nice. Smaller than I expected. Location was quiet and about 25-30 min from the city. The staff were very friendly.

Overall pretty good. Would I stay again? Probably not. I would chose somewhere closer to the city and accommodation with more room.
showerReviews.author: R H

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a fantastic caravan park! Not only is it quiet, clean, and run by friendly staff, but the location is also great. The grounds are very well maintained, and we loved the shower amenities — especially the screen doors that keep the water in. The camp kitchen was spacious and well-equipped with everything you need to cook. However…………………My only reason for not giving 5 stars is the park is very close to an industrial area and if you don’t like smelling the fumes this will bother you I get headaches and this would be my only
Reason to not stay here again

showerReviews.reviewText: I can recommend the BIG4 holidays park in Coburg for several reasons. The first and important one is their friendliness over the phone and in person. Whilst I booked several nights earlier with my rooftop tent, which was great and affordable as they have amenities and a good camp kitchen.. I also enjoyed my stay at the studio cabin, which was unbelievably comfortable as anything I could’ve wished was there! Parking in front, Queen size bed with lovely fresh linen, a clean compact bathroom with ample of different seized towels, a well equipped kitchen so I could cook at “home” and a good small fridge. I watched television in the evening and had a wonderful sleep in the quietness of this great holiday park so close to the delights of city and surrounding suburbs. The shops are only 1km from this park so I was happy to top up and relax here for an overnight stay. I like the boom gate code which allows me to come and go anytime, after hours is a problem from the past - thank you for making me feel welcome 😊
showerReviews.author: Rita Kreileman

showerReviews.reviewText:
About to wrap up our stay at this wonderful place.

The park offers plenty for all ages.
Playground, pool with toddler area, heated spa, outdoor and indoor cinema (could use some beanbags in both areas) games room- with indoor playground, large chess board, large connect 4, ping pong table, gym-with modern equipment and tv lounge room!
The grounds are well maintained and clean and the amenities- laundry, camp kitchen etc are equally well maintained and clean.

Public transport is available however a short walk is required.
There is a full supermarket and cafe close by.

This has been a relaxing enjoyable experience for our family and we look forward to returning in the future!

It was me first time here on the road travelling with a friend that said this place should be great now under new management as the old owners ran it to the ground and now it’s tops ,great for a family or travelling by yourself or in a group and on top of this they take or types of campers which is great too . Now there is a games room for the kids and a pool and also a kitchen dining room so you can cook here too but please respect it as it is for everyone to use so clean up and any problems let them know so they can fix it too , beautiful showers and toilets nice and clean so that’s great too .

So do your self a favour come stay here you will like it as it was good for me it’s good for you all too . Come see what you think.

Until next time I be back again  and safe travels

showerReviews.reviewText:
I just stayed here the last few days, when picking up me caravan from the manufacturer
1 night in a dog friendly cabin, & the rest of the time on a powered site
Staff where brilliant, & super helpful & friendly, both on phone at booking & at check in
The dog friendly cabin was immaculate , you could never tell it had dogs in it before, & well equipped.
The powered site was gravel with a concrete slab, & plenty of space for my 8 metre van, the shower & toilet block i used were spotless also, over all great park & i will be using this park again on my next visit to Melbourne
Thank you guys

showerReviews.reviewText:
Awful place and poorly managed. Stayed here 4 nights - booked 2 powered spots for rooftop tents.

Location is poor for a place like this - located in the middle of an industrial area straight off the main road. Also directly under the flight path of nearby airport - very noisy trucks and planes all night.
In desperate need of maintenance. Men’s bathroom reeked of stale urine. One of the shower heads is hanging on for dear life by a thread of Teflon tape. 1/3 sinks worked.
Women’s bathroom much the same. Sinks were busted and lights didn’t work.
Make sure to pack all of your food up of a night as stray cats run rampant through the joint.

Paid for 2 powered spots. Full-time resident had plugged themselves in to one of our power points. Rather than start an argument, our group shared the 1 remaining power point.
Returning from a day out on our second night, we were greeted with 2 other vehicles in our spots. They allegedly turned up late and paid $20 cash and were allowed to pull in to our spots. After much back and forth - we agreed to squeeze all of us in the 2 spots and denied them access to OUR power point.
Multiple calls and texts to management were left ignored.

A rest area off the Hume would have been more accommodating.

I truly hope that management see this review as a wake up call and put some effort in to their park. I would be embarrassed running this place.

I am still waiting on a call back to discuss a partial refund due to having to share 75% of our entitled area.

Hope to hear something soon :)
showerReviews.author: Justin Klemenchic

showerReviews.reviewText:
Awful place and poorly managed. Stayed here 4 nights - booked 2 powered spots for rooftop tents.

Location is poor for a place like this - located in the middle of an industrial area straight off the main road. Also directly under the flight path of nearby airport - very noisy trucks and planes all night.
In desperate need of maintenance. Men’s bathroom reeked of stale urine. One of the shower heads is hanging on for dear life by a thread of Teflon tape. 1/3 sinks worked.
Women’s bathroom much the same. Sinks were busted and lights didn’t work.
Make sure to pack all of your food up of a night as stray cats run rampant through the joint.

Paid for 2 powered spots. Full-time resident had plugged themselves in to one of our power points. Rather than start an argument, our group shared the 1 remaining power point.
Returning from a day out on our second night, we were greeted with 2 other vehicles in our spots. They allegedly turned up late and paid $20 cash and were allowed to pull in to our spots. After much back and forth - we agreed to squeeze all of us in the 2 spots and denied them access to OUR power point.
Multiple calls and texts to management were left ignored.

A rest area off the Hume would have been more accommodating.

I truly hope that management see this review as a wake up call and put some effort in to their park. I would be embarrassed running this place.

I am still waiting on a call back to discuss a partial refund due to having to share 75% of our entitled area.

Hope to hear something soon :)
showerReviews.author: Justin Klemenchic

showerReviews.reviewText: Price online was $45.00 a night for powered site but was charged 60.00. way overpriced and would be the worst caravan park I've ever stayed in. Old unlockable amenities.. couldn't even put our awning out because next caravan was so close. …

locations.title: Honey Hush Caravan Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 3 nights. Initially only booked for one as we saw a lot of bad reviews. Honestly no idea what they were all talking about. The permanent residents are lovely. The campsite itself is nice and quiet. Super clean toilets/showers and the best hot showers we’ve had. (Travelled from cairns to Melbourne).
The caretakers made us feel really welcome. Price is great for $15 per person per night. Great laundry facilities and camp kitchen too! Would definitely recommend to anyone wanting to visit Melbourne, it’s only a 40 minute drive in and you can find parking for $17 a day in melbs.
showerReviews.author: Natasha Carmichael

showerReviews.reviewText:
This review concers the unpowered site for vans and the tent site.
The prices are very low, 15$ per person per night. With this prices you can't complain. Of course it isn't the most luxurious caravan park ever but it does its little job. The uncovered site are just a little parking next to a strip of grass where you can put your tent and they ar enext to the bathroom (amazing). The bathrooms per se are clean and well maintained, they do miss soap.
The laundry is clean and works well. There isn't a camp kitchen.
The area is just an industrial area close to the airport but given that is next to the freeway in just 20 minutes you are un the city center with your little van. It's cheaper to drive and to use a paying parking lot than using public transport over there, the Mickey Mouse card in Melbourne is just an abomination.
The staff are extremely nice all around.
Overall I suggest it if you just need a place to sleep and you want to spend your days in the city, it's cheap and maintained good.
showerReviews.author: Fed20

showerReviews.reviewText:
(Updated April 2025)
Every morning the camping grounds are visited by Rainbow Lorikeets eating seeds that are hung in the trees by tenants.

Cameras have been installed around the park for extra security.

If you are going to charge your electronics in the laundry, please keep an eye on them. There are some tenants that will be nice to your face, however they will steal anything they can.

(Updated December 2024)
The owners have fixed the footpaths. Tenants have painted the BBQ area with art murals.

Check the trees in the camping area and you may find something.

The place is really good for cheap accommodation.
(Updated Febuary 1st 2023)

Microwave in the laundry with 5 washing machines and 2 industrial dryers.

Just do not leave valuables unattended in the laundry.

More for long term workers who keep to themselves, overnighters would be best to park your vans in the BBQ area rather than a site. The area has large trees and lots of shade.

When you come into the front entrance, you MUST turn right. There are arrows on the road showing which way to drive, but people are constantly getting stuck, especially if you have a caravan, don't drive straight or you will be stuck doing a u-turn.

The owners are very welcoming and helpful, and most of the people that live there permanently are really friendly.
showerReviews.author: brendan vella

showerReviews.reviewText: Mamma mia, what a place. Seems like it used to be a nice site many many years ago, now just barely kept alive. The facilities are basic, many are broken, old, but as far as I could see, clean. Hot showers, but no kitchen. Not really suited for campers, looks like a derelict motel/lodge for not yet homeless people. Still, rent is low for a place near Melbourne city, with a bus connection nearby. So probably, if I had the necessity to sleep in a camper in Melbourne again, I would still choose this place over the other overpriced campsites
showerReviews.author: M. Dr. Tiede

showerReviews.reviewText: I’m disabled and on a wheelchair so we rented an accessible cabin for 1 week as I was travelling with my husband and daughter. The cabin and rooms are spacious. The toilet however is too high for shower buddy. The sink was too close to the toilet that my husband had a hard time helping me. There’s no shower curtain in the shower area so the water can splash everywhere. The sink has partial vanity so I can’t roll in. It’s a nightmare for people on wheelchair but I think it’s nice for abled body people.
showerReviews.author: Meelee Liew

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely caravan park opposite the beach with spacious powered sites. Photo shows site number 71. Friendly staff and generally quiet and peaceful; although note that it can get a little noisy on Friday and Saturday nights as people (not from the caravan park) tend to congregate in the car park opposite the park.
Clean amenities. There is a laundry available, but there is no camp kitchen; just an outdoor BBQ.
Price Reserve is right next door. You can cut through the emergency exit past sites 77 and 78. There is a large footy field and playground and on the other side, Anglers Anchorage, which sells coffee, cold drinks, fish and chips, burgers etc.
showerReviews.author: Nicola Hinton-Adams

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed here with our slide on camper. It's not a tourist park, it's somewhere safe to sleep and have base camp. It has very clean toilet/shower facilities. Dump point. Owners are very helpful and accommodating. Has shops within walking distance. Close to buses and trains for a trip to the city. Would definitely stay again.

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed at Sundowner Caravan Park for four nights with our motorhome in the middle of the last summer vacations. We were pleasantly surprised that there was room, as the other campsites were almost all full. Léon's welcome was perfect, even letting us choose our pitch and layout. It's a campsite mainly made up of bungalows and permanent residents. It's a long way from Melbourne city center, but there are many ways to get there (bus + train) in 1 hour. The campsite is very well maintained, the sanitary facilities are very clean and, above all, it's really cheap: $34 a night for 2A and 2C, 8-meter motorhome, power/water! There's also a laundry ($4 wash/$4 dry). Frankly, it's a great deal!
showerReviews.author: Thomas Chignac

showerReviews.reviewText: Concrete slab for us to place our camper onto was a nice surprise. Very clean amenities with paper towel. Plenty of washing machines and dryers and a large clothesline. Bitumen driveways and well kept grass areas. Camp kitchen with fridge, kettle, toaster, BBQ and super clean little oven with two hot plates on top. Two amenity blocks so no dramas when the cleaner is cleaning one of them. The normal cost is $34/night for a powered site. They kindly gave me a discount because I stayed for more than seven days even though it was over two separate periods. We stayed in Jan 2022. I would happily stay here again when next visiting Melbourne.
showerReviews.author: Rhonda Hill

We held a family Xmas party there for 100 family members.  The park were great on giving us a whole grass area along side a fire pit and a BBQ area.
Facilities were very good with nearly everything supplied.  Including washing up supplies in the kitchen, BBQ and function area.  Even wood for the fire area.
The cabins were very clean and neat.  Comfortable.  Staff were friendly and accommodating
Lovely quiet place to stay with great facilities.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed at two sites over 11days. First impression is amazing, the attention to detail in the gardens all around the park is truly a masterpiece. The ensuite site was good but nothing supplied except dunny paper. No hand towels, no toiletries and even the shower mat was an outdoor rubber type. The slab we had wasn't great and when it rains the slab pools in two spots quite deep making the annex area unusable.
The two camp kitchens and amenities are first class, laundries were clean with modern machines and there's fire pits, games rooms a very good information centre and the staff couldn't have been nicer, everyone I had the opportunity to interact with was so nice.
The park is quite a ways from Lillydale township and shops not walking distance or even a bike ride as the park is on a single lane highway with no Bikeway or even a kerb to safely ride on. The BP next door was handy with some convenience items.
Hope this helps you decide to stay or not. I would go again just for the magnificent gardens and laser straight hedges. 😃
showerReviews.author: Where Alien

showerReviews.reviewText: Terrible if you are camping. There is no shade cover whatsoever for campers so your tent will be in the sun all day. The campsites are also very small and close to each other so you are packed in, thereby making it even hotter. We had to check-out a couple days early because of the sweltering heat. There are a couple of big areas that have great tree shade but they are wasted as walk-through areas only (not even a seat to sit on). Having said that, the kitchen and shower facilities are good.

Only suggestion would be to have some drinks,  snacks available at the office or maybe even a vending machine on site. The servo is handy but so expensive and as another reviewer said its just that annoying distance out of town when you just need some milk or a couple of beers. :)

locations.title: Rose Garden Motel

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Rose Garden Motel is from the era where breakfast was served through a hatch at the front door.
It certainly hasn't been completely locked in that 90s time theme, but there are still elements that are still there.
The room is super clean and well maintained, with all the amenities you would expect.
The bed very comfortable, with ample pillows for sitting up watching TV.
The split system worked well for those cold winter nights.
The bathroom was extremely clean with plenty of towels.
Was surprise with the size of the shower, so big that 3 people could be accommodated.
Would note that the toilet seat is due for a replacement.
Would also add the parking space is super wide very unusual for motels, this makes removing bags very easy.
Great place with ample room and very close to the CBD, staff very helpful and friendly.
showerReviews.author: Peter Cigognini

showerReviews.reviewText:
We cannot rate this motel high enough. Everything about our stay is second to none.
Sadly it seems that good old fashion service has been forgotten, but not here.
My husband and I had just paddled the Barwon river and we needed to wash our clothes. All I was expecting was to be directed to a coin laundry close by, but low and behold the manageress took our washing in her laundry, washed and dried the clothing, and then placed it neatly in our room whilst we were out, for a very modest fee.
Exceptional gold standard.
I always say it is the little touches that mean so much.
We will always stay here if there is a vacancy. You have us for life.
Congratulations team.
showerReviews.author: Karen Hutchinson

locations.title: BIG4 Yarra Valley Park Lane Holiday Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
Still staying at the Superior Family Cabin that sleeps 8 people. So far nothing seems superior about it. First thing when we walked in for the dirty, moldy floors. At the end of the day your socks are so dirty! Floor seems to have some black mould or something which I don’t want to touch. The cabin air quality seems to be very dusty or have a lot of pollen as I cough non stop everytime we’re inside. Air quality seems to be cleaner and better outside than inside.

As stated the Cabin is suited for 8 people. They have heaps of knives and forks but MINIMAL plates and bowls, maybe around 3 plates, bowls and a few wide plates. Like seriously?!

Towels and face towels all have stains, some with some black marks and some dirt on it which we end up not using. WiFi is non existent here, can find it but cannot connect to it. Can only connect when you’re outside.

Coffee at the kiosk tastes horrible. Something that a kid would make, you have a fancy machine and grinder and yet you don’t know how to make a coffee.

Rec room is bare, air hockey has no puck after paying to play it. Pool table but no balls and sticks. Would thought they would have some activities for the kids to play with which we DON’T need to pay for since it’s a family park!

Management here is appalling, their first impression they seemed confused, I even gave them the cabin number we are staying at. And still got my name wrong after stating it the first time.

First time staying at this resort and would be the last.
showerReviews.author: Alex Cooper

showerReviews.reviewText:
I can not recommend this place enough. Having stayed last week at another Big4 that was questionable, this place is a luxury resort.

The bathrooms have heated flooring and absolutely beautiful showers. The sites are wide allowing for ample room to park and use as needed.

The laundry didn’t need coins! It’s just a tap on a phone or a card which is so much easier.

The amenities on site are above and beyond expectation with bouncing pillows, kiosk that serves coffee, great playgrounds and food trucks on site for the school holidays.

We are so much happier

showerReviews.reviewText: Iluka Retreat is a true gem where beauty meets nature—think serene bushland views, fresh air, and that perfect escape from the hustle. Our stay was a beautiful experience overall: the tent setup felt adventurous yet comfy, with stunning sunsets and beautiful birds right outside. Staff were friendly and the on-site trails were a highlight for some peaceful walks. That said, it does feel a bit costly compared to the facilities in the tent—basic amenities without some extras. Still, worth it for the tranquility if you're okay splurging on the vibe! 🌿🏕️

showerReviews.reviewText:
Beautiful views and a tranquil place which was great for 3 days away with the family. Tents were spacious and beds were comfy. Surroundings were great and the kids loved the obstacle course.

Sadly the facilities were very outdated and in need of some love. The hot water was also extremely temperamental so the showers were either freezing or scolding. This isn’t really what I’d expect for the price they are charging per night. The noise was also not policed very well and on two of the three nights we were kept up until 2/3am.
showerReviews.author: Sam Wright

showerReviews.reviewText:
Family winter trip.
We had a beautiful glamping experience! Everything was clean, well-organized, and peaceful. The place had stunning views and was surrounded by nature, which made it feel private and relaxing.

The communication from the hosts was excellent — they were friendly, responsive, and made sure everything went smoothly. All the amenities were thoughtfully prepared, and even though it rained during our stay, we still had a lovely and cozy time.

Highly recommended for couples or families looking for a quiet escape with beautiful scenery. We’d love to come back again!

Thank you for such a wonderful stay!

Evelyn

locations.title: Crown Towers Melbourne

showerReviews.reviewText:
For the past seven years, my niece and I have stayed at Crown Towers annually for 2–3 nights to celebrate our combined birthdays, always booking a Premier Room. Aside from consistently dirty windows, the experience has repeatedly been a genuine five-star stay.

This year, I stayed for three nights over Christmas with my cousin, booking a Studio Room. While the windows were spotless and the small walk in dressing room fantastic, everything else fell well short. Despite astronomical Christmas rates, my room (1025) was tired, dated, and clearly overdue for refurbishment.

Issues included chipped furniture, stained upholstery, marked and dusty lampshades, mould in the shower, marked and dated power points, a missing desk lamp. The bathroom amenity box was heavily marked and scuffed, with visible stains and wear. The in-room amenities were abysmal. Toilet paper and tissues were thin and of poor quality. Opening the tea and coffee drawer felt more like a budget motel than a five-star hotel. Sparse condiments, no napkins, and poor presentation were completely unacceptable for a five-star hotel and particularly for the nightly rate charged.

Overall, I was exceptionally disappointed. Lesson learned: insist on a recently renovated room.

Positives: location is spectacular; dining at Conservatory, Gradi and Rockpool was excellent; service, spa and pool were all excellent.
showerReviews.author: stacie mitchell
