showerReviews.reviewText:
An unforgettable luxury experience at Crown Towers Melbourne
Once again, Crown Towers Melbourne delivered an absolutely exceptional stay for our family. This has become a much-loved annual Christmas tradition, and every year it somehow feels even more special.
We were thrilled to be upgraded to a Crystal Villa, and the room was nothing short of breathtaking. Beautifully designed, incredibly spacious, and finished to the highest standard, it felt like a true luxury retreat. The steam shower was a standout feature, and the sheer amount of space made the stay so comfortable and relaxing for our whole family.
The luxurious touches truly set the Crystal Villas apart — having a private elevator and private access directly through to the pool made the experience feel exclusive and incredibly special. Those details really elevate the stay and make you feel completely pampered.
The service in the Crystal Club was absolutely outstanding and deserves special mention. The team went above and beyond with thoughtful details and personal touches that made our children feel genuinely welcome and special, which meant so much to us as a family. That level of care and attentiveness truly sets Crown Towers apart and makes the experience unforgettable.
A small thing to be aware of (mentioned only for clarity): while we had Crystal Club access, we had assumed all food and drinks were included. We were charged for some drinks during the high tea service — not a major issue at all, just something for future guests to be aware of.
Overall, the room quality was exceptional, the service was flawless, and we were extremely happy with our stay. Crown Towers continues to exceed expectations, and this was another wonderful five-star experience for our family. We already can’t wait to return again next Christmas. ✨
showerReviews.author: Hollie Borowski

showerReviews.reviewText:
Check in at 3pm which is quite late and if you arrive 3:30 good luck (photo was from a Sunday), was over 30 min wait.

Pool is packed full of kids (and adults to be fair) and the hot tub spa only fits around 4-6 people. Adults only hours 8-10pm which is good but pool closes 10 so you pretty much need to skip dinner. Steam room only, no sauna, fits maybe 8 people.

Gym is nice if you plan to workout.

Rooms are dated, in deep need of a refresh, stains on carpets/couches, walls have been dented etc. drains were semi blocked, tiny toilet and water pressure too low to run shower and spa at the same time.

Rooms were pretty quiet tho so can’t complain and appeared quite clean.

Tv was small however okay channels and also was able to chromecast from phone.

Was given low floor room despite putting high floor request on booking.

Bathtub is both short and narrow, if you’re over 1.8m, it’s tight. No slippers on arrival, had to call and ask.

Bell staff don’t direct valet traffic or open doors and get your bags, not sure what they are doing.

I would not recommend the breakfast at conservatory, again very basic and kinda pricey
showerReviews.author: k zh

showerReviews.reviewText: Powered site with large concrete pad. Pet friendly with small fenced off-leash area. Lovely patient staff. Mostly cabins and permanents. Features: kitchen, games room, comfortable tv room, laundry, undercover bbq area. Favourite feature: high pressure showers. Great stopover for visiting family and friends in the region if you have pets and therefore banned from other options nearby. They may be closing the touring van section later this year.

showerReviews.reviewText: We just stayed for two nights at this motel. First impressions were that the room was clean, an important aspect for most people I would think. Three issues caused me to only give two stars. Firstly, after a day of sporting activity my wife wanted a shower and the hot water ran out, (or just stopped) half way through it. I rang the managers and could only leave a message asking for them to return my call in case it was in the same condition the next morning. No return call was ever received! Secondly, they have the thinness toilet paper I have ever seen, as another reviewer said, it's disgusting (and false economy, work that one out for yourself). And finally, there was no service to the room at all after the first night. They even ask you to take your rubbish to the outside bins! At $140 per night, I'm sorry but I expect better.
showerReviews.author: John Flanagan

showerReviews.reviewText:
I discovered this place many years ago and found it an absolute treasure. I sometimes paddle down to Longridge and check it out and have a picnic.
THere are toilets and hot showers (solar) as well as a lovely simple, basic campground. You can access the park via Alexander Road which runs alongside the High School. You can book the site for group camping or for simple groups of up to 40 people. Only campers can come here.
It was nice to get up on a Sunday morning, drive into Warrandyte get a coffee, the paper and drive back for time in the deck chair on the Yarra River.
You can go fishing here as well but don't forget to get a licence.
There is a BBQ here which has wood provided by Parks ic. There is also an Information Shelter and tables. If you've got a canoe, there is now a canoe ramp.
If you'd like to book a site by calling Parks Vic on 131963 and you MUST book in advance, you can do this online. The time period between between 1:00pm on the 1st day and Noon on the following day constitutes consititutes a single day’s booking.
This place is quite disabled friendlly.
Highly recommend.
showerReviews.author: Debi Slinger

You could probably just drive up and park here instead of booking. Nobody on site

In fairness to the maintenance staff, the toilets and showers were very clean

locations.title: ibis budget Melbourne CBD

showerReviews.reviewText:
The location is great — it’s within the city and tram access is convenient. I stayed for only one night and expected a basic hotel, but even with that in mind, some budget hotels are cleaner and more organized than this one.

There were no tables or chairs in the room to work on a laptop. If you go to the pantry area on Level 1, there are tables, but the Wi-Fi there is very slow. The coffee machine also wasn’t working during my stay. Hope the Wifi connection improves.

They do have a laundry area on Level 1, but two out of the four machines were out of order.

The reception staff weren’t particularly friendly — the interaction felt cold and purely transactional.

The flooring throughout the hotel is wood, so you’ll hear some creaking sounds.

Also, if you have luggage and need to book an Uber, you can’t wait directly in front of the hotel. You’ll need to walk to a nearby lane where cars are allowed to stop, such as Little Collins Street.

Overall, it’s a budget hotel, and you only get the most basic amenities.
showerReviews.author: N S B

The location is great — it’s within the city and tram access is convenient. I stayed for only one night and expected a basic hotel, but even with that in mind, some budget hotels are cleaner and more organized than this one.

There were no tables or chairs in the room to work on a laptop. If you go to the pantry area on Level 1, there are tables, but the Wi-Fi there is very slow. The coffee machine also wasn’t working during my stay. Hope the Wifi connection improves.

They do have a laundry area on Level 1, but two out of the four machines were out of order.

The reception staff weren’t particularly friendly — the interaction felt cold and purely transactional.

The flooring throughout the hotel is wood, so you’ll hear some creaking sounds.

Also, if you have luggage and need to book an Uber, you can’t wait directly in front of the hotel. You’ll need to walk to a nearby lane where cars are allowed to stop, such as Little Collins Street.

Overall, it’s a budget hotel, and you only get the most basic amenities.
showerReviews.author: N S B

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our family had 3 rooms at the Ibis Budget Melbourne CBD from 20/11 till 26/11. Front desk personnel were friendly, attentive and as accommodating as they could be. Housekeeping was alright for the first few days and then they totally slacked, not replacing towels and the wet floor mat by the bathroom. Since the bathroom (shower stall actually) didn't have a proper door, the floor and carpet by the sink was perpetually wet. Air conditioner in all 3 rooms were old and noisy. Hotel really needs a bit of work, and then it would be perfect.

On the plus side, the location is amazing. The lane behind the hotel has very good food (Mork Chocolate, a banh mi shop, a bagel shop, ... all good). Block Arcade across the road, Queen Vic Market and lots of malls nearby. The tram stops in front of the hotel and you can travel within the CBD for free.
showerReviews.author: Gwendoline Chia

Didn't have hooks for clothes especially in the tiny shower. TV is soooo big  which isnt really something I am after when staying in a hotel. It didnt make sense. Could have had a smaller TV for hooks and more space in the shower. If you're just there to sleep or if you're on your own, then it's fine, but for more comfort and better feel, find another hotel.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed here for one night and unfortunately it was not worth the nightly rate. The only genuinely positive thing I can say is that the bed linen was clean.

The rest of the room felt more like a budget hostel setup. The carpet was noticeably worn, the shower was tiny, and the “bathroom” was essentially just a curtain separating the shower from the rest of the room—which felt quite odd and uncomfortable. Amenities were minimal, and overall the space felt tired.

Nighttime wasn’t great either. There were constant noises in the hallway and a bright strip of light under the door that made it hard to relax. It honestly felt a bit unsettling trying to sleep.

For the price charged, I expected much better. This room simply doesn’t match the cost. If you’re considering staying here, just be aware that what you get is extremely basic.

locations.title: Richmond Private Rooms @ 151 Hoddle Homestay

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed at this hostel for 3 days and had a very pleasant experience! The accommodation was extremely clean; the toilets and kitchen were spotless, the water pressure was great, and it had everything you’d need. Check-in was smooth, and the location is super convenient, just a short walk from both the train station and the tram, making travel to the city seamless.

I’m not sure if it was Patrick or Frank, but the reception staff was very helpful, observant, and always available whenever we had questions or needed assistance. He took great care of our laundry and made sure our luggage was safe when we left it with him after check-out.

I definitely recommend this hostel to anyone looking for an affordable private room with well-maintained shared facilities. The only thing to note is that, because it’s close to the station and the road, you can hear some noise, but if that doesn’t bother you, this is a great place to stay!
showerReviews.author: nat

showerReviews.reviewText:
AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS

I'm still trying to process the horrific experience I had at this place. The room was disgustingly dirty, with stains on the floor, dirty linens, and a general feeling of grime everywhere. The air was thick with an unpleasant odor that seemed to cling to my clothes and skin.

The state of the bathroom was particularly appalling, with hair and soap scum in the shower and sink. The toilet didn't even flush properly. I'm not exaggerating when I say it was like a biohazard nightmare.

Honestly, I wouldn't allow a dog to stay in this hotel, let alone pay customers. The lack of cleanliness and basic maintenance is staggering. Needless to say, I won't be back, and I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy.

*DO NOT STAY HERE* unless you want to risk your health and sanity. There are far better options out there. Save your money and your dignity - look elsewhere.
showerReviews.author: Scott Farrow

locations.title: St. Kilda Accommodation

showerReviews.reviewText:
Hi there, I am not the one to leave a bad  review but i have to for this place.  To be honest, i did have high expectations due to what i saw on their website..

I feel like this is false advertisement from what shows online.  the place is very very dirty, the showers, bathroom, dorms,  I am sorry but it is not worth  $58.28  for what i paid for,.

As someone who has server asthma i had a hard time sleeping due to how dirty this place was.. Gum was found on the bunk , front dest isnʻt open 24/7. They close at 430pm)
* they were very responsive to my emails so I will give them that*
i was told  by someone that they show up when they want to in the mornings when they feel like it. ( no one is on site the whole time to keep things tidy & cleaned . I  have lived in so many hostels over a decade of traveling,  and I have to say this is pretty bad... This is a health concern,... There was 2 germans ladies who were also in my room and they were super sweet & they also  felt the same way... Idk  how people can live in this filth...
The pillows are very flat, Underneath the  beds never get cleaned,  It was very dirty,  dishes were under there too,,,  This place isnʻt 100%  safe if you have medical conditions * not to mention how very difficult it was  to find..

*  as someone who has hostel & hospitality experience of  8 years,  I know you can only do so much when you are short staff but at least try to keep this place a bit more cleaned  and be honest on your advertisement. Also  donʻt  be lazy and work when you feel like it. This is supposed to be a Hostel and not feel like a  homeless shelter. Maybe i came on a bad time and maybe they didnt have the people to clean this hostel, if that is the case then I would give some grace....

there is also not a common space, you have the kitchen but its very very small and the front desk area is super small also. ) .

The rubbish was overflowing in the bathroom, no soap was provided in the girls bathroom  during my stay and the shower and toilet were very dirty and gross..
the females  bathroom has 2 showers and 2 toliet)

* There is NO laundry here as well.

overall this place is not worth paying almost 60$ per night im sorry. =( The only good thing about this place was the sweet girl i met when i checked in and some of the people who were staying there was super nice..
showerReviews.author: Nova Lani (Nova Lani)

showerReviews.reviewText: This hostel is good value for the price and a basic place to sleep, for those seeking and/or just starting out with work / holiday / study as it’s centrally located to the closest beach to the city, transport, amenities and the restaurant strip. This place has been trying to make improvements as of late in relation to Spring deep cleaning and solving issues. Reception is very welcoming and accommodating to requests and the Wi-Fi is great. The kitchen and foyer is small but suitable for whipping up a small basic meal, watch a movie or chat with newcomers from all over the globe

showerReviews.reviewText:
Probably the worst hostel I’ve ever stepped in!
It’s dirty, the showers, toilets, dorms are barely (if never) cleaned. It smells like old feet as soon as you step in. But wait until you get to your dorm.

The kitchen disposed of one only fridge for 30+ people 🤯 as well as one little table and 5 chairs. Oh and yeah, pots and pans haven’t been changed in the last 3-4 years. Handles are bravely giving their last breath. Teflon has been scratched almost entirely. Happy cancer to you all!

This place is literally abandoned by the management who’s only after making easy money and not paying a dime to make it liveable/comfortable to anyone. If you have the chance to cross path with the lady manager, give her your best smile and say hi, she won’t return it back 😂

If it wasn’t for Ama (the receptionist), I would have left straight away. She’s the only star this place deserves.
showerReviews.author: Tom Belleflamme

locations.title: Flinders Backpackers

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have absolutely nothing but amazing things to say about this hostel. My friends and I booked a three bed dorm and luckily got put on the 10 floor (one of the floors that had bathrooms since not all floors have one) & it put us one floor down from the cafe/rooftop. Rooms were clean. Bathrooms were clean - we actually saw the housekeepers cleaning them every morning and were amazed at how meticulous and efficient they are.

I love the band system and I love that you needed the band to get in everywhere - bathrooms included. Felt extra secure and safe.

Cafe was cute and affordable. Such a lovely space and two of my friends were working remotely so it worked out really well for them.

Staff were very friendly and the check in and check out process were smooth and easy. Great central location.

The only “negative” things I have to say are that the elevator took ages. Two elevators for 11 floors is a pain. The shower water pressure & temp were also kind of bad. The water will just change from hot to cold to warm to cold to hot and the water will cut out multiple times. The water pressure also messed with the toilets flushing as well - I’d have to stand there and hold down for a solid minute but anything would flush, even if it was one piece of tissue.
showerReviews.author: Briana Le

showerReviews.reviewText: Amazing experience. You’re not far from the train station, state library, casino, even the stadium was within walking distance for those unafraid of a stroll. Staff were friendly and helpful. Of course it’s luck of the draw but we had different roommates both nights and they were all respectful top lads. Kitchen and communal areas looked nice and inviting though we didn’t use them. Rooms were quite bare bunk rooms but nice and clean, standard affair for a hostel. Make sure to bring a padlock for the lockers, we were able to fit two small duffel bags in there, so quite reasonable for valuables. We really appreciated the Yellow Submarine decor in our floor. Amazing hostel for the price and location.
showerReviews.author: The Dude Mk II

showerReviews.reviewText: Great central location, lovely staff and clean rooms/bathrooms. The only downsides are that the walls in the rooms are thin so you can hear if someone is using the hand dryers in the bathroom and the temperature in the showers is really hard to master. You either have it super hot or super cold and it changes inbetween while you shower. Regardless of these points I still had an overall great stay here.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Does the job. Arrived there as my first hostel in Australia. Very big and impersonal. The common areas are not very comfy/inviting. Everybody is just doing their own thing.
Bathrooms are clean. Showers run cold in the morning on the top floors. Kitchen is quite busy, but cleaned pretty well during the day.

If you have already been in Melbourne for a long time it’s probably good value for money.
If you’re just arriving, I would recommend choosing a smaller hostel in Fitzroy or St Kilda, where it’s easier to meet other people.

locations.title: YHA Melbourne Central

showerReviews.reviewText: Location is so strategic, I can roll my suitcase comfortably from Southern Cross Station (can be noisy from the sound of the train and traffic but still tolerable). It's a clean (even the communal kitchen and shared shower room) and proper hostel with curtain on each bed to maintain privacy. Each bed has light and power socket. The hostel was safe since they only grant access to their guests after 8 pm. Staffs were friendly and helpful. Their wifi works well, and they also offer locker rent post-checkout. locations.title: Little Drifter Melbourne

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very disappointed with my stay.
I stayed for six days, and several facilities advertised were simply unavailable, with no prior notice. The shared kitchen was closed for the entire duration of my stay — no one informed me before booking or upon arrival. As a result, I had to eat out every day, which made my stay much more expensive than expected.

I reported the issue to reception: I was told to send an email and that the manager would get back to me… but I never received any reply, despite several follow-ups. No compensation, no apology.

Another problem: the laundry room was also unavailable, and guests were only notified on the same day. As for cleanliness, the room was not cleaned once in six days (no floor or shower cleaning), except for the trash being emptied daily.

For the price I paid, this is unacceptable. The place could be fine, but the lack of communication, maintenance, and customer service completely ruined the experience. I do not recommend this hostel at all.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is the first time I’ve felt the need to leave a bad review, but it really needs to be said.

I stayed a week at this hostel, which advertised “breakfast included.” What you actually get is some jam and toast (sometimes just the end of the loaf), a bit of cereal, and juice or milk (that can vary). Occasionally there’s pancake batter to cook yourself. Not terrible, but nothing special.

The real problem is the cleanliness—or rather, the lack of it. Mold and dust are everywhere, and the bathrooms are disgusting: hair, rubbish, even bodily fluids are common(after reflection I spared your eyes with the least disgusting one). Most of the time there’s no soap or toilet paper. And with only eight bathrooms for the whole hostel, it’s chaos.

Rooms barely get cleaned. Staff only change sheets and sometimes empty bins. Trash from previous guests stays under beds and on top of lockers. When I asked if it was possible to clean it, they told me I could do it myself.

On top of the filth, the hostel is extremely noisy. You can hear normal conversations from the street as if people are standing right next to your bed. On top of that, the doors slam constantly at all hours because their design makes them bang every time they open or close, making it impossible to get a decent night’s sleep.

I’ve stayed in a lot of places, even in third-world countries, and this was by far the worst. The location and price are not worth it.
showerReviews.author: James Bond

locations.title: Bounce Melbourne

showerReviews.reviewText:
Could be a nice hostel, unfortunately not really customer orientated as previous people already stated in the comment. Huge incident during my stay, and no reaction by them was quite disappointing. They have a nice set of behaviors guidelines but don’t care if they get broken.

Other than that hostel is well located. Right next to flinders station, close to where all the action happens. Obviously such location comes with some noisy streets surrounding the hostel and noisy travelers staying in the hostel.
Stayed in a 6-bed dormitory, which is alright. Super bright at night due to no curtain and a neon sight right outside of the window. Not really much space to put your luggage/stuff or hang up towels, clothes etc. one slim drawer for each traveler in which not even a backpack fits and are poorly put together. Pulled it out, was already broken. The locker for each bed is inconveniently placed above the mattress which leads that you bump into it.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Bounce is a great option for a Hostel in Melbourne. Located opposite Flinders Street; it’s in the heart of everything. Accessible via tram/walk for those coming via SkyBus.

The staff are friendly and warm, noticeably more than other hostels about. Facilities feel a bit worn now. Curtain rail was ripped, air con is on install and bathrooms could do with a bit more light due to the weird cubicle set up & understandably the water heater is clearly under a bit of pressure.

But, what hostel is perfect. Crucially there was a locker about your bed, curtains and chargers. Sure there’s a bit of noise but again you’re in a major city…would recommend staying.

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed on the side heading into Melbourne. I believe there is a rest stop on the other side of Princess Hwy for those travelling to Geelong. Best part is there is shade if you want it for summer. It has a few rubbish bins that were cleared during our 4 day stay. There are a few sets of table and chairs. It is a free space to stay for fully self contained vehicles. Public toilets are about 400m to the Service centre and can get a shower, truck stop style. Service stops also  has basic groceries like milk and bread. There is a burger joint fast food next door as well.

locations.title: Northcote Aquatic and Recreation Centre

showerReviews.reviewText: The renovation and the rebuild of this pool and gym was very successful, definitely an improvement to the previous gym and pool when it use to be owned by YMCA. Both the exterior and interior look very modern and very good compared to the previous. Inside the interior of the pool features a water park designed for kids with a water slide, a nice and warm sauna designed for adults, two pools with different lanes (one approximately 5ft, the other approximately 2ft). The outdoor pool contains one single 5ft pool with lanes and an outdoor water play designed for kids (similar to the ones seen around sand at playgrounds). The gym features exercise equipment like rower machine, treadmill, weights, exercise bikes etc. I have been there to this pool many times over 15 years when it use to be YMCA and the old building, been to the new NARC since the launch opening in November 2023. The only reason why I've taken off one star is because there is not enough car spaces and can be frustrating to find one as the parking spaces are most of the time full, but the actual aquatic centre itself is 5 stars. Would highly recommend going there for swimming and exercising.
showerReviews.author: Xavier Andrews

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really disappointed with how this new facility is being managed. The Northcote Aquatic & Recreation Centre might look great from the outside, but the ongoing maintenance issues tell a different story. The touchscreen shower system is constantly broken, the pool water is often not at the right temperature, and the main entrances — especially the ones used by parents with prams — are frequently out of order and left that way for weeks.

The biggest concern, though, is hygiene. There’s a carpet area between the indoor and outdoor pools that’s completely covered in mould. I’ve taken photos at different times, and it’s clearly not being cleaned or properly maintained. That’s really not acceptable in a community pool where kids and families are walking through all the time.

Management has been made aware of these issues several times, but nothing ever seems to change. The entrances stay broken, the showers don’t work, and the change rooms and toilets are often dirty.

It’s a real shame, because this could be a fantastic facility if it was properly looked after. Right now, though, it feels neglected and unhygienic — not what you’d expect from a newly built centre.
showerReviews.author: Matthew G.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The accessibility features are significantly lacking and have not been designed with people with disabilities in mind. Why would a new facility only have one single change room for people with disabilities that meets AS1428.1.While there is a great hydro pool that is accessible, its pointless having one change room.
The distance from the hydro pool to family change rooms is too far for people with reduced mobility.
The cleanliness in changerooms and toilets continues be be a major problem.

I do really enjoy this place, I think the toilets snd showers and facilities are really great
However just as some constructive criticism, I think there’s way too many people with gym memberships that don’t match up with the gym facilities - there’s honestly not enough machines and space for how many people go here. Every time I come to the gym no matter what day or time, it is overwhelmingly busy and I’m waiting to use machines for ages, it ends up being quite a frustrating session for me as everyone’s sitting on their phones not doing anything. I think they need to open another gym space in the building or extend the amount of machines and room available for people to work out because it’s just absurd how busy it constantly is.
I think the pricing here is awesome though and it’s an overall great place with someone for everyone

If you’re a keen gym goer and considering this as your new home, don’t.
Very little gym etiquette, weights left on machines, dumbbells left on flat benches, benches only used for a towel, ear bud or drink holder.
The crowd here are mostly coming along for movement exercises versus a good weight workout, so be mindful as most of the 55 + crowd haven’t much understanding of people around them nor time on a machine.

Area Is clean and functional for a basic community gym and classes are solid.
If you’re attending for a swim or other facilities then all good 👍

showerReviews.reviewText: Carlton Baths is a fantastic spot with a real community feel—the atmosphere is always great, welcoming, and never too crowded. I joined the gym late last year, and I’ve loved it. There’s an excellent variety of equipment, all high-quality Technogym, so everything feels smooth and well-maintained. There’s always plenty of space to move. I also love the pool and its grass area. It does get busy, but it never feels overcrowded, and it has a more laid-back atmosphere than the Fitzroy Pools. The whole place is well-run, and it’s a pleasure to be part of. I highly recommend it for casual swimming or joining as a member!

locations.title: Waves Leisure Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been a long time patron of Waves, but the recent, inexplicable decision to cut the number of male showers by nearly half is absolutely unacceptable and has ruined the experience.

Before this change, the male changing room had a manageable number of showers. Now, with the number reduced drastically, there are constantly long queues. This is causing genuine friction and arguments between patrons who are rightly frustrated, tired, and just want to clean up and go home. The atmosphere is genuinely hostile sometimes, all because of poor facilities management.

What makes this decision worse is that the female changing rooms have retained their 10 showers. Cutting the male facilities down while keeping the female facilities fully operational feels discriminatory and poorly planned. It sends a clear message that the comfort and convenience of male patrons is considered secondary.

Patrons pay good money so expect basic, functional amenities. Until Waves restores the male shower capacity to its original number, or at least provides an equitable solution, I cannot recommend this centre. The current situation is an embarrassment and the management team should feel ashamed.
showerReviews.author: Mark Smitts

showerReviews.reviewText: The level up system is full on messed up i spent 1 entire year on level 7 during this painful year i see people leveling up on their 2nd ever level 7 session even though they don't meet any of the requirements. the wave pool is full of kids who have no sense of surroundings so every 2 seconds you are getting bowled over by some 7 year old. the shallow end of the 50m pool is full of hair and old band aids. the lifeguards scream at you for jumping in while right next to me some kid is doing an insane back flip. the family change rooms are disgusting the floors have dump on them and people are bringing infants in when they can use the opposite gender change rooms until the are 6yo. the change rooms are full of the opposite gender over the age of 6. the little kids always think your stuff is theirs and take some stuff and their parents do not care. the rec lanes are full of people swimming laps even with the signs saying not to. the classes are weird my level 8 class had 7 people in it and i was in the deep 50m area and the step can only fit about 4 people so half the class is clinging to the lane rope and half the time the classes are set in slowest to fastest so if you are slow swimmer there are like 50 kids on you tail and it is way worse on your back making the lesson feel like torture and there is always that 1 kid who thinks it's a competition. the teachers don't tell you about what side you need to swim on so when doing backstroke you crash into your whole class and they blame it on you because you were swimming on the right side of the lane.
showerReviews.author: Joshua Grabert

showerReviews.reviewText: Not what I was expecting. I know waves has a lot of different pools and facilities, but I was shocked their only lap pool was a 25m. I went on Monday morning hoping to do some lap pool swimming. When I arrived the lap pools were laced with old men taking up all of the lanes, and going at a very slow speed (even in the “fast lane”) making it very hard to get any kind of exercise done without one of them bashing into my head. The changing rooms were outdated and had no privacy and it costs 2 dollars extra to “rent” a locker. I was shocked I wasn’t shown any of the facilities before paying. There was no communication when I arrived. Would only recommend for families, and old men, but if you’re 18-35, or have any athletic ability in the slightest, give it a skip.
showerReviews.author: Max Smith

showerReviews.reviewText: Not what I was expecting. I know waves has a lot of different pools and facilities, but I was shocked their only lap pool was a 25m. I went on Monday morning hoping to do some lap pool swimming. When I arrived the lap pools were laced with old men taking up all of the lanes, and going at a very slow speed (even in the “fast lane”) making it very hard to get any kind of exercise done without one of them bashing into my head. The changing rooms were outdated and had no privacy and it costs 2 dollars extra to “rent” a locker. I was shocked I wasn’t shown any of the facilities before paying. There was no communication when I arrived. Would only recommend for families, and old men, but if you’re 18-35, or have any athletic ability in the slightest, give it a skip.
showerReviews.author: Max Smith

locations.title: Monash Aquatic & Recreation Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
Amazing place
Sometimes does get very busy and they have to allocate some of the 50m lanes to recreational (as in you can do anything in that lane)
Sometimes someone does something and the wave pool or the 25m and the LTS pool are closed
Waves are very nice
I love body surfing on them it feels like I'm going so fast
Nice plantlife

Good gym facilities (but you need to be 13 to access them)
Lots of programs and clubs and stuff you can join

Food is overpriced, only get if you have to be there for 3 hours or you are a lifeguard (because u could just go to Maccas)

Lockers are paid only now 😔

Overall one of the best recreational centres and I reccomend to all people
showerReviews.author: Sina Aghabagheri

showerReviews.reviewText: I came to the swimming centre with both my husband and my daughter for a fun day out. I was approached by the lifeguard on duty not to film my family having a wonderful time and had to delete the video due to privacy issues. Even though I explained to them what was going on. The toddler area is always closed due to either high or low chlorine issues. They said they would fix the pump by summer which isn't good enough. All the lanes are always fully booked due to swimming aerobics or swimming lessons. I was advised to use the crowded swimming pool which is 1.5m deep for my daughter who is only 2 years old. Not a safe option and wasn't gonna take the risk of having my daughter drown. Prices are never the same each time . Different workers will charge what they think , which is very unprofessional. Unable to communicate with lifeguards if there's an issue . Only one worker at reception was willing to help out to try and solve the issue. Very nice of her to do
showerReviews.author: Chrysanthe Paps

showerReviews.reviewText: The Monash Aquatic & Recreation Centre is an essential community asset. It earns high marks for its extensive range of aquatic facilities, including the famous wave pool, and its broad fitness program offering. While busy times can test the capacity of the auxiliary services (parking and change rooms), the sheer variety and quality of the facilities make it an exceptional choice for anyone looking for a comprehensive health, fitness, and recreation venue in the Monash area.

There is also an indoor pool for the one that prefer much warmer temperature but when you came out you will feel the chill.

locations.title: Crown Spa Melbourne
locations.address: Level 3, Crown Towers, 8 Whiteman St, Southbank VIC 3006

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great massage and great to have access to the sauna and hot pool for an hour before the massage, with valet parking. Also enjoyed the complimentary towel, robe, slippers, and teas and snacks on offer. A truly all inclusive experience that makes the massage price worth it.
Only issue is the separation of the genders for the sauna and spa pool which seems unnecessary, when it would be a nice thing to enjoy as a couple or with a group of friends

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wow. Empress vibes from start to finish! From the moment you step inside, you're wrapped in luxury, the plush robes, the soft slippers, and the serene ambiance set the tone for an unforgettable experience.

The spa itself is stunning, with elegant rooms designed for pure relaxation. The locker rooms are beautifully maintained, offering a seamless transition into the experience with high-quality amenities and a tranquil atmosphere. Every detail, from the lighting to the décor, exudes sophistication and indulgence.

The treatments are just as exceptional, leaving you feeling refreshed, rejuvenated, and completely pampered.

Crown Spa is more than just a spa, it’s an experience. If you're looking for a place that makes you feel like royalty, this is it. Highly recommend for anyone wanting to escape, unwind, and indulge in luxury.
showerReviews.author: Kali Ma

showerReviews.reviewText:
Updated on February 1, 2024 only few days from visiting the spa and changing my review as my gel manicure is coming off, so disappointed Nathalie was wonderful but the gel manicure was overpriced especially as it’s coming off only after 4 days.
Located on the Southbank in Melbourne Australia. The spa is on the third floor of the Crown Towers. Exceptionally clean and spacious space. I chose the relaxation massage was greeted. Provided an extremely soft robe and slippers. My masseuse Annabelle was amazing. 90 minutes relaxation massage. She listened to my needs and provided an amazing experience. Afterwords I had a manicure. Nathalie was wonderful. The spa has a steam room jet shower and many wonderful amenities. Will definitely come back when in Melbourne.
showerReviews.author: Danijela Pope

showerReviews.reviewText:
Crown Spa is a complete experience, where you can immerse yourself in complete relaxation. The luxury escape is located on the 3rd floor of the Crown Towers complex.

I recommend making a day of it, as every 1 hour treatment includes 4 hour parking and access to their Aqua Retreat which include a relaxation lounge, sparkling vitality pool, steam room, Swiss shower, 25m indoor pool and outdoor sundeck. Men’s and Women’s Spa experience is separate. 🏊🏼‍♀️

We didn’t end up using the valet service and parked at the multi-level instead because we wanted to spend more time here and get breakfast prior at The Conservatory. This ended up being free anyway as a Crown member (for spends over $50). 🚗

They have a cafe with a small selection of drinks and snacks for those who may want something pool side. There are many beautiful sun beds and cabanas available to relax on. 🥂

I went for a 1 hour relaxation massage, which was definitely relaxing and had a very luxurious feel to it. Whilst you use the facilities you have access to a secure locker and afterwards are welcome to use the showers and amenities such as hairdryers, straighteners and curlers. 💆🏽‍♀️

We had a beautiful day and felt very spoilt, the service was amazing. I did feel some of the areas and appliances were abit dated. I personally wouldn’t spend $180 for the massage alone but the value was great considering all that was included.
showerReviews.author: Stephanie Rose

locations.title: You Day Spa
locations.address: Next door to Sofitel Hotel, Level 12/15 Collins St, Melbourne VIC 3000

showerReviews.reviewText:
What an absolute treat You Day Spa in Collins Street is.

Helen is a rock star, so are the therapists.   Helen was so accommodating in organising, at short notice, a detox package for my husband and myself.  We also opted to add of a facial each.  We were not disappointed with the treatments or the service.  From the initial telephone conversation to arrange an appointment to when we left You Day Spa after our treatments, we were greeted with genuine warmth, professionalism and friendliness.  Our experience was truly 5 star.  The spa is clean and the staff are friendly and professional.

We started with 60 minutes in the steam room which included a full body scrub. After a quick shower, we indulged in a phenomenal 90 minute body massage followed by a 60 minute facial.

I could have stayed all day.  Next time!!.

I can’t wait for our next visit.
Thank you
showerReviews.author: Marina Ward

locations.title: Leisurelink Aquatic & Recreation Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
Only signed up here for swimming, not the gym. The pool itself is great, clean, good quality, with kind lifeguards and friendly staff. Showers are spacious too.

The downside is the morning lane allocation. Often 3–4 lanes are reserved for school swimming, leaving everyone else squeezed into just a few lanes. Why not schedule swim school during less busy times? Or if possible, since you're all pros, why not use the deeper pool instead of taking over the main one that most people use?

Also, the price for just a swim pass is too high! That needs a rethink too.
showerReviews.author: Bao Nguyen

locations.title: Geelong Aquatic Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
We've been at GAC since January 2021. What started as a 5 day summer intensive for my two preschoolers lead to immediate enrolment and we have never looked at another centre since.

We've had caring teachers that have gone above and beyond to gain the trust of my two water phobic children and we now have 3 children who are happy and competent swimmers that now get to enjoy other water based activities like paddleboarding, kayaking and fishing.

We really appreciate that each term they have a safety week to focus on safety in and around water. Swimming is so much more than just stroke development.

I was so inspired by the GAC team I actually enrolled in the course to become a swim instructor.
showerReviews.author: Melissa Shell

showerReviews.reviewText: Long time regular for the old Norlane swimming pool but this is my first time in this “newish” facility. The proper lap swimming area (the core part of pool) is greatly reduced, the water is also much shallower than before, no proper sitting area, tiny tiny change room, slow spraying shower with very tight timing. All these so called smart and environmentally friendly designs are sacrificing the basics of swimming—and if you don’t want to get cold by stay under waiting for shower, then go home with bleach smell and can’t do anything else before waste more water to clean yourself.
showerReviews.author: kev dai

showerReviews.reviewText:
It is less than a month I got membership of  swimming , sauna , spa etc. I want to give certain suggestions for improvement.
1- water temperature in public showers are very high. It would be appropriate if you keep it just warm. Today 9-7-2025 at about 11.00am I took bath and hardly escaped to become unconscious.I informed about it to the receptionist.
2- Sometimes Cleanliness of toilets and washrooms are not better. Specially at noon or onwards, no one cares if dirty.
3- Today steam room was closed, sometimes Spa and Suana were closed without any intimation. It’s maintenance should be arrange in off time.
4- Use of antiseptic materials in pools water are high side which creates skin irritation afterwards.
I will be grateful if you look into above suggestions to improve the facilities of the complex. Regards,
Amin Asif

locations.title: Bellarine Aquatic & Sports Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
I agree with all the previous reviews regarding the older lady lifeguard with long grey hair. As MANY have said about her previously, the way she speaks to adults is disgustingly rude.
She walks around like I'd image a prison guard would, although I'd imagine even prison guards would smile more.
Just last week she told my wife to watch our daughter more while she was swimming, the delivery was like this as she walked past my wife who was between watching our sons swimming lesson and watching our daughter swim.
"You know you still need to watch them" referring to our daughter who is well and truly above the age of close supervision (per all the pool rules). This was delivered as she just walked by my wife and kept walking.
The lady next to my wife was in disbelief at how the older lady lifeguard had spoken to my wife, and also pointed out how out of line she was and that she herself and many of her friends had had similar issues/experiences with the same lady.
Action is needed.
showerReviews.author: Paul Anderson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Swimming teachers are amazing but the pool itself is a really bad layout. If you're trying to play with your child in the big pool which is the only public area to really play when swimming lessons are on you only have the one strip and have to constantly keep looking behind you for the elderly that are exercising so should really be in the 2nd lane. You can't enjoy playing with your children because this is all you do. There needs to be one big pool for playing and no elderly doing laps so kids can have a proper play.

Also needs to be more then one family toilet for the disabled and families with kids. The other ones are impossible to shower and dress kids in and I'd imagine very hard for elderly/disabled to shower and get dressed in.

However:

Swimming teachers are all amazing
The kids area is good and warm
The Cafe is great, best coffee there is, also great food.
showerReviews.author: Bec

showerReviews.reviewText: We go twice a week for swimming and gymnastics. The cafe is delicious, the staff is amazing and it's reasonably priced. The pool is always clean, and has spacious change rooms and a family change room as well. The waterpark area is great for kids up to 10. Best thing to do with the kids, especially in the winter.

showerReviews.reviewText: We go twice a week for swimming and gymnastics. The cafe is delicious, the staff is amazing and it's reasonably priced. showerReviews.author: Kate Lyons

showerReviews.reviewText:
As I only use the pool, I can only give you a review on that part of the aquatic and sports centre.
Saying that, from the moment you walk in the door, everyone is genuinely happy to see you. It doesn’t matter if you’re a member of the centre or a visitor to the area, you’re welcomed and helped if needed by all staff. They carry a good range of swimming equipment, even swim suits for all ages and genders.

The lifeguards are amazing, true to their profession, they have their eyes on everyone all the time, it doesn’t matter if you’re in the water, or watching, the lifeguards know exactly where you are and what you’re doing. There are plenty of lifeguards on duty all day long. If you didn’t see one of them making eye contact with you the moment you walk through the doors, they will acknowledge you while you’re in the pool or on a chair. I have even been lucky enough to have a number of lifeguards assist me in my antiquated technique, which has made swimming a lot more enjoyable. The pool is at a nice temperature, well I like it, it’s clean, and they have great amenities including lockers and a quick rinse off area so you don’t have to have a full shower before you leave. It has an awesome area for the wee ones, and of course plenty of lanes available for those who swim laps regularly to folks doing their aqua exercise and others who are just starting to get comfortable in and around water.
I can honestly say that everyone that I have met at the centre, from staff, fellow swimmers, parents sitting on the chairs while their kids do lessons have are all very friendly and respectful. I can genuinely say you will have plenty of fun, feel great and safe the entire time you here.
Added bonus, there is a great little cafe in the centre that makes the best coffee on OG.
showerReviews.author: Katie “Ceitidh” Alexander

showerReviews.reviewText: I’ve been bringing my two boys to Jump Geelong West for the past six years. One son has outgrown the centre but he enjoys coming in and saying hello with his little brother. I moved my oldest son from a local council run swimming pool as the class sizes were getting too large and my son would sometimes get two laps of the pool during an entire lesson. The class sizes are capped at four kids which I find perfect and the teachers are all amazing and very approachable. I would highly recommend Jump Geelong West.

Have a few refurbished meeting rooms available for meetings, conferences, and training sessions.

Huge

showerReviews.reviewText: It's a decent gym with all you need in the heart of Geelong CBD. Expect treadmills, bikes, stair climbers, rowing machines, three squat racks that can be converted to bench presses, two lat pulldowns, a small group exercise space, dumbbells up to 50kg and a few hammer strength and pin loaded machines. It's generally not busy that you need to wait for machines. Amenities are amazing with wheelchair accessible bathrooms, showers, hair straighteners and hair dryers. The staff do an awesome job on top to make you feel at home with free deodorants, fruit, sanitisers and more. It's a typical small commercial gym with heart.

showerReviews.reviewText:
10 South Gym in Geelong is a top-tier fitness facility that offers a comprehensive range of equipment and services for all fitness levels. From the moment you walk in, it’s clear that this gym is designed with the user in mind. The layout is spacious and well-organized, making it easy to navigate between machines and workout areas. The atmosphere is welcoming and energetic, making it a great place for beginners and seasoned fitness enthusiasts alike.

One of the standout features of 10 South Gym is the variety of equipment. Whether you're into weightlifting, cardio, or functional training, there’s something for everyone. The machines are modern and well-maintained, and there’s ample space for stretching, bodyweight exercises, or group workouts. They also offer a range of fitness classes, from high-intensity interval training (HIIT) to yoga, catering to a wide array of preferences and goals.

The staff at 10 South Gym are friendly, approachable, and always ready to help. Whether you need advice on using a particular piece of equipment or tips on improving your workout routine, they’re knowledgeable and supportive. The gym is kept clean and tidy, with hygiene being a top priority, especially in shared areas like the locker rooms and showers.

For those looking to elevate their fitness journey, 10 South Gym is a fantastic option in Geelong. With its excellent facilities, professional staff, and welcoming environment, it’s more than just a gym—it’s a community focused on helping you reach your health and fitness goals.
showerReviews.author: Sam Riordan

locations.title: Carbon Gym

showerReviews.reviewText:
I’ve trained at big-box gyms in Melbourne for a few years, but I’ve dropped into Carbon Gym North Geelong as a casual the last two Mondays — and honestly, it blows my regular gym out of the water.

The place is spotless. Not “quick wipe with a dirty rag” clean — actually clean. Equipment is in top condition, everything is where it should be, and the whole gym just feels properly looked after.

Even the clientele are different — people actually re-rack their weights. Wild concept!!!

Staff are friendly and welcoming And the bathrooms? Cleaner than some hotels I’ve stayed in. Toilets, showers, the lot — immaculate.

If you want a gym that’s well-equipped, well-run, and actually gives a damn about standards, Carbon North Geelong is miles ahead.
showerReviews.author: Sean Liston

showerReviews.reviewText:
🌳 Fantastic Family Park & Coastal Pool Opening Soon!

Visited this lovely park in Geelong today during our holiday, and it was a great time despite the chill. The well‑equipped play area kept the kids entertained, with plenty of open grass, picnic and BBQ facilities, and clean amenities. The views of Corio Bay were simply stunning—perfect backdrop for family photos and sandy play.

We were delighted to learn that the children’s sea pool at Eastern Beach—just by the park—is set to reopen from 1 November through to April. The shallow wading area, with its diving tower, springboards and fountains, is patrolled by lifeguards during the summer season  . That gives us another seaside treat later this year!

Highlights:

Great for kids: Playground zones + space for running games

Amenities: BBQs, picnic tables, toilets, showers

Scenic spot: Art-deco boardwalk, sea baths, diving platforms

Seasonal bonus: Children’s pool opens 1 Nov–21 Apr, with lifeguards on duty

Despite a crisp spring breeze, our crew had a blast. Can’t wait to visit again in November when the sea pool reopens—another fun swim to add to our Geelong holiday plans!
showerReviews.author: Rebeca Corripio Bort

locations.title: Geelong Waterfront

showerReviews.reviewText: On a nice day, the beach and pool are amazing. There is a pool section for the kids and there is an enclosed beach area as. This area has a bit of seaweed floating around but not bad enough to stop people from swimming. The water looked good over the Melbourne Cup weekend. There are showers, a restaurant and bbq areas on the lawns nearby if you don't like sitting on the sand. Parking is a bit of a challenge but if you are patient enough you will find one. The ferrous wheel was fun too. Awesome views from the top.
showerReviews.author: Trust Nyamombe

Loved the jetty and esp the kids pool, leading into adults lap swimming n then straight into ocean. The views from atop and the star are breathtaking. Its a must place to visit and spend a quality family day or a romantic date at. Refreshed my mood and reenergised me. Ahhh! We're returning here again soon. :)

Concession stands, toilets, shallow swimming area for the little ones, larger swimming area with an elevated platform for jumping into the water. Lifeguards on duty. Plenty of parking.
Especially enjoyed the decorated bollards lining the walkway.

showerReviews.reviewText:
A Must-Visit Destination👌🏼🤩

I recently visited the Geelong Waterfront with my family, and we had an absolute blast! The waterfront is beautifully maintained, with stunning views of Corio Bay and the surrounding landscape. Here's a rundown of our experience:

The Good Stuff:😊

Scenic Views🤩: The waterfront offers breathtaking views of the bay, perfect for photography or simply taking in the sights.

Eastern Beach Reserve: The historic swimming pool and shark-proof enclosure are a must-visit for families. The pool is well-maintained, and the diving towers are a great spot for kids to splash around👌🏼.

Playgrounds🛝 and Picnic Spots🧺: There are plenty of playgrounds and picnic areas throughout the waterfront, making it an ideal spot for families or groups.

Dining🍗🍻 and Shopping💰: The waterfront has a range of cafes, restaurants, and shops, offering something for everyone.

Walking and Cycling Paths😊: The waterfront has well-marked walking and cycling paths, perfect for a leisurely stroll or bike ride.

The Practical Stuff:😊👇🏼

Parking🚘🚗🚘: There are several car parks throughout the waterfront area, including paid parking options and some free parking spots. We found parking to be relatively easy, even on a busy weekend.

Toilets and Amenities🚻: The waterfront has clean and well-maintained toilets and amenities, including showers and change rooms near the swimming pool.

Accessibility😊: The waterfront is generally accessible, with ramps and pathways suitable for people with mobility issues.

Tips and Recommendations:👇🏼

Arrive Early👍: If you're planning to visit on a weekend or during peak season, arrive early to secure parking and avoid crowds.

Pack a Picnic🧺: There are plenty of picnic spots throughout the waterfront, so consider packing a lunch or snacks to enjoy while taking in the views.

Take a Stroll: The waterfront is perfect for a leisurely walk or bike ride, so take your time and enjoy the scenery.

Overall:👌🏼
The Geelong Waterfront is a must-visit destination for anyone in the area. With its stunning views, family-friendly attractions, and practical amenities, it's the perfect spot to spend a day or evening. We can't wait to come back and explore more of what the waterfront has to offer!😊
showerReviews.author: Bibin Thomas

locations.title: Ocean Grove Surf Life Saving Club
locations.address: 28 Surf Beach Rd, Ocean Grove VIC 3226

showerReviews.reviewText:
There's a lot of year-round parking, clean indoor male and female change rooms, showers and toilets; outdoor shower; grassy area; the red and yellow flags designate the safest swim area and life guards patrol in summer over the weekends and weekdays on the school holidays. (Don't swim there if there are no life guards or flags.)
It's a beautiful, clean beach with sand that can get quite compacted after a high tide, and deceptively safe due to there being shallow water for quite a distance.
showerReviews.author: Sue W

locations.title: Anglesea Surf Life Saving Club

showerReviews.reviewText: Excellent patrol crew, such a great place to catch waves for all ages as the sand is flat and doesn't drop down at the water edge so waves come in smoother to shore (not dumping you) for nice long boogie board rides! You can play in smaller waves at shallow shoreline too or teach your kids to boogie board. Large beach, beautiful sand, nice dunes and cliff views. New Cafe and bar at the SLSC has great views and service. Yummy food too but not always open. You would need to cross road to get food otherwise. Drinktap by playground and inlet. Parking in various places but you need to carry your stuff a little ways depending on where you park. Beach carts only useful if coming down SLC driveway to beach. Outside showers by toilets at parking or SLC. Also in older toilet block by SLC.Be safe, swim between the flags and watch your kids as conditions change with the tides. A favourite spot every year.
showerReviews.author: Melanie Jacobsen

locations.title: Bancoora Surf Life Saving Club

showerReviews.reviewText:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Bancoora Surf Life Saving Club is a fantastic place for nippers and swimming memberships. This hidden gem offers plenty of parking and direct access to a beautiful beach.

The club maintains a flagged zone for swimming, ensuring safety for all. It's great to see both locals and non-locals enjoying the water, with a strong focus on safety and fitness.

The public toilets, managed by the council, are well-maintained and there is accessible parking available.

The beach itself is stunning and conveniently located not far from Geelong.

Highly recommend Bancoora Surf Life Saving Club for a safe and enjoyable beach experience!
showerReviews.author: Kia Yang

The beach itself is stunning and conveniently located not far from Geelong.

Highly recommend Bancoora Surf Life Saving Club for a safe and enjoyable beach experience!
showerReviews.author: Kia Yang

showerReviews.reviewText: Nice surf beach, good for fishing, walking etc... dangerous for swimming, my children did the Nippers program here and it was fantastic but there is a strong rip current.

locations.title: Ocean Grove main surf beach

showerReviews.reviewText: Stunning coastline with views all the way from Barwon River Mouth to Point Lonsdale lighthouse from Ocean Grove main surf beach. A family friendly beach patrolled beach (seasonal) and lots of room to spread out on the sand especially low tide and grassed areas looking down on the water. Modern clean toilet shower facilities cafe and restaurant kids playground and life saving club for a cold ale at the end of your beach day. No dogs during peak season but there is one dog beach about 1km down the road for your furry mates. Rock pools to the left of the lifeboat ramp at low tide to explore for the kids. There is plenty of chances to boogie board or surf outside the flags depending on conditions but the more serious surfer maybe better at Raffs or 13th especially at peak times. There is a big free carpark but on those hot days it can be difficult to get one as it get very busy over the summer. Watch for Rips and swim between the flags when they are out and enjoy one of the best beaches in Victoria
showerReviews.author: Vicki Pickett

locations.title: Discovery Parks - Geelong

showerReviews.reviewText: This was the second time that we have visited Discovery Parks Geelong, and we have been impressed both times. Their cabins are kept in immaculate condition and have everything you need. The swimming pool and BBQs are great. And the service in the office is exceptional - they work really hard to assist you, especially Cath! The park is conveniently located very close to Geelong City Centre, and nearer are shops and restaurants to cater to every taste. Access to the Bellarine Peninsula is easy, and I just enjoyed walking along the Barwon River in the beautiful  reserves just opposite. I strongly recommend this park.

locations.title: Corio Bay Motel

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very near to spirit of Tasmania terminal which was great, sadly that's about the only good point apart from the good customer service.

The biggest let down are the actual rooms, they resemble the dark dinghy room from a horror movie, stained carpet, mould in the bathroom on ceiling and shower bay, paint falling off surfaces mirror absolutely filthy and in a room for 2 there was 1 fork and 1 knife to eat with, the pictures will explain some of it.

Owners need to advertise what the room actually look like not what the Web shows, so please before committing to a stay see the attached pictures

Sorry but I need to be honest.....
showerReviews.author: Neil Lane

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have multiple photos of the filth we walked in on.

Firstly I paid for a queen room only to be given a double without them acknowledging their screw up and just told me to get ahold of Agoda which Agoda has tried calling numerous times with no response.

Carpets are stained so badly and filthy! Food on the floors, toilet wasn't flushed so yellow with toilet paper floating round.

Black mould on the shower curtains

Stains all up the sides of the bed.

Food stains up the walls.

No tv remote

Heater is super loud

No kettle in the room yet there's mugs/coffee/sugar provided and even says a kettle is included in the room.

Under the toilet is wood missing where there is rotting boards and fecal matters/wads of toilet paper stuffed in there.

Shower leaks

Reception woman laughed at me and tried to tell me a double bed is bigger then the queen bed!

Very appalled of this place, no matter how cheap the price, no place should be this filthy!

Hoping to take this further as when you look at the photos you definitely don't get that!

All in it for the money but clearly don't care about keeping customers happy.
showerReviews.author: Josie hannah Buis

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a dump...something out of a horror movie. 1st room we were allocated no hot water, shower curtains in shower, TV, not all lights working, broken fittings.
Spent ages trying to contact reception no answers: answer service that doesn't allow messages. Eventually got on to reception allocated another room. Only lights 2 small bed table lamps on the floor. No heater(winter in Victoria not ideal). Bed doonas that don't fit the bed, and I think the sheets were thicker.  Grabbed doonas off the other beds to try and keep warm.  Window didn't close properly, microwave interior rusted and peeling. Mould, broken fittings, bench sticky, room not cleaned during our visit only towels swapped over. We were given extra blankets not a heater like we were told. Both rooms manky stained carpets. If there were minus stars to allocate we would.
showerReviews.author: Maree Lansdown

locations.title: Geelong Holiday Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Good:
1. Location is excellent if you wish to explore Geelong as some amenities are in walking distance.
2. Probably the best holiday park I've been to in terms of cleanliness, and we'll maintained facilities. Really impressed.
3. Staff are really friendly and helpful
4. Well equipped kitchen.
5. Great activities for kids
6. Daily coffee and snacks van

The not so great:
1. Powered sites are small and power outlets are shared between a 2 or 4 sites making hard to try pass an extension cable behind other campers to get to yours.
2. Location is next to a main road/bridge going over Barwon river, making noisy even at night if camping in a tent.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The cabin was a lovely modern, clean cabin, well set up with all a guest needs for a short stay and I assume a much longer stay.
Plenty of plates, cups bowls and such. Cute little kitchenette, perfect for breakfast.
The master bed was deliciously comfortable, bedding warm and sleep easy. The caravan park was quiet, though it was a cold rainy night so that probably helped.
Master bedroom was quite small.
Living area was well designed. Huge comfortable couch.
Shower was hot and very well appointed.

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed in a 3-bedroom cabin. Location was great and the staff are friendly and helpful, but for us the beds are very uncomfortable, hard and no padding felt like springs were sticking into us. Cabins are showing a lot of wear and tear, eg fan switch nobs missing, doors have water damage, benches the laminate has chipped, fridge the shelves are broken. Outside, the towel rails brackets are not secure, the cabin wood needs painting, and the panels are lifting. Cleaning, showers need mould kill, particularly in the door, skirtings need dusting, windows need cleaning, walls and doors need wiping over. Grass needed mowing and many of the cabins had weeds in the garden beds. I think more maintenance and more time to do proper cleaning would benefit. There is talks of upgrades, so here's hoping for new beds!
showerReviews.author: Talina Whitington

showerReviews.reviewText:
My friend and I just wanted a place to sleep for a single night. This suited that bill. It was clean, comfortable and well stocked. We didn't have the kindest neighbours, but that's luck of the draw, especially in a caravan park.

The staff were lovely and accommodating when I rang and asked to change my cabin type. A thanks to Tammy who I think I spoke to every time.

One major issue we had, which we discovered late in the evening. There was no hot water in our shower. I don't know why and I didn't get the opportunity to speak to a staff member about it. I wasn't all that fussed given our very early start to the morning. But it is something that needs to be addressed in either paperwork of just fixed.

Overall it was a pleasant enough experience for me.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Forget searching for El Dorado—I've found it, and it's a beautifully maintained park managed by the legendary Chelsea and her crew!
​Seriously, put your tiny travel worries away. The facilities? More immaculate than my grandma's Sunday best. The staff? So friendly and accommodating they practically rolled out a red carpet (but, like, a nicely manicured grass carpet).
​Whether you're a tent-pitching minimalist or a cabin-cruising maximalist, they have the perfect spot. And the cost? It's so affordable I thought I'd accidentally won the lottery. You get all this beautiful space for a price that feels like a friendly handshake.
​But wait, there's more! The rec room, decked out for Christmas, is the real MVP. I'm talking:
​🧊 Arctic-level A/C (hello, Aussie summer relief!).
​📺 A big screen with Foxtel and all your streaming needs—AKA, your entertainment command center.
​🛋️ Couches so comfy they'll try to keep you forever.
​🍽️ A kitchen equipped for a feast (dishwasher, fridge/freezer, the works!).
​🏓 Ping-pong showdowns waiting to happen.
​📚 Enough books and games to start your own library/casino (the fun kind!).
​I'll post pics of that festive rec room soon. Five stars—they absolutely nailed the stay!
showerReviews.author: Cassandra-Jayde Blake

locations.title: BIG4 Bellarine Holiday Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just finished our second stay at BIG4 Bellarine and it definitely won't be our last. It is consistently such a great place for a family getaway.

​The park is always impressively clean and the amenities are top notch. What really keeps us coming back is the range of children’s activities because there is so much to keep the kids entertained. It actually lets the parents relax for a bit.

​The location is also a huge plus. It is tucked away enough to feel like a holiday but it is still super convenient for the essentials. Having Aldi, Coles, and Woolies all within a 10 minute drive makes grocery runs so easy. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a stress free family break on the Bellarine Peninsula.
showerReviews.author: Adel Salah

showerReviews.reviewText:
100% recommendation this park it was quiet very modern facilities & the caravan sites were very large. The park is in pristine condition with fantastic play areas for children including 3 x jumping pillows, Indoor heated pool & many more play areas & equipment to keep them amused. The camp kitchens are awesome and well maintained.

Cabin accommodation is ample ranging from studio apartments to 3 BR apartments these were very clean & modern and catered for all needs.

Service was excellent & very friendly, we plan to return next year.

locations.title: Bellarine Bayside Holiday Parks

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had an amazing site for our caravan here right on the beach, great swimming beach for kids and amazing walking track along the beach.
Beautiful sunset beach with the lights hitting the city and the spurit of tassie cruising out. Toilets are cleaned regularly. Only complaint would be the timers on the showers. 4 minutes is not long for a girl with long hair or a mum with a couple kids to shower. Showers should not be timed and just be part of the fees.
Also would be nice to be able to have a small fire at camp site.
showerReviews.author: Brooke Youl

showerReviews.reviewText:
I dislike making negative reviews but this one is necessary. The room looked as advertised but sadly it lacked amenities, especially in the bathroom. There was no place to put your personal items.  It was very cramped, poorly maintained with dirty skirting edge of floor level tiles, the shower had cracked wall tiles, even with the shower curtain closed water went over the floor.  The room itself was very dusty.  When the room was serviced the tea/coffee/sugar/biscuits were not replenished.

The main bed was rock hard, but the single was very comfortable but extremely high off the floor.

Working out how to get the very noisy and not very warming reverse cycle unit to go was a huge challenge due to the lack of overall lighting in the room. Fortunately I had a torch either me to shine into the corner behind the TV in attempt to read the controls.

The carpark is tight for larger vehicles.

Overall it is a budget hotel and well located.

I must give credit where due, when I reported a faulty light globe it was dealt with immediately.  What I did find a bonus was the electric blankets and additional blankets as the weather was extremely cold.  The huge flat screen TV was great.

Another bonus is that it is directly opposite the supermarket, so easy to walk across the road to get supplies. Lady that checked me in was very helpful in letting me know about the closest supermarkets.
showerReviews.author: Anja

locations.title: Mantra Lorne

showerReviews.reviewText: Very happy with the room and given a free upgrade for one of the nights. We had a resort room with ocean view. Reception was very helpful. Loved the heated mineral pool and spa- best used early in the morning if you want to do laps. Only one half on the spa jets were working but they were excellent strength. Women's changeroom had very slippery floor tiles- not the best choice for a wet area and was small with  only one shower.. super close to the shore and we could hear the sounds of the ocean with our window open. Just don't open it wide enough for the cheeky cockies to enter as one got in and made a big mess all over the floor of our chips and pop corn! Worth noting, your car park may be un named as some are not designated to the rooms. Unimpressed with the in house breakfast buffet and the service in that area of the resort. Wouldn't bother again. Lovely sunrise from our room. Loved the cute ducks around the place.  Overall a very enjoyable stay.
showerReviews.author: Soleil Poynton

showerReviews.reviewText:
Location is great however the cleanliness of the facilities has gone downhill in the last 2 years.
We have been coming for about 13 years and the facilities have never been upgraded
It is now quite expensive for an unpowered bush site so surely some funds could be allocated for cleaning the toilets and basins which would not pass basic hygiene laws.
The male toilets and showers are particularly gross
Have seen much better maintained in free camp grounds
showerReviews.author: Debbie C

showerReviews.reviewText: Facilities are poor and haven't been updated in years. The sites are overgrown and are branches, rocks, dirt and grass patches. Standing there one night waiting for the cleaner to finish, I was amazed how bad the job done was. The cleaner literally fills the toilet paper, hoses the floors then leaves. No cleaning products, no scrubbing showers. The smell from the men's urinal can be noticed outside the block as the flushing system has been disabled. For the money paid to camp there, I can only assume it's invested in the powered, watered, cabin area area of the site that has sealed roads, gardens and grass.
showerReviews.author: Nick Nemet

locations.title: Eastern Sands Geelong Accommodation

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our shower had clearly not been cleaned.
Arriving back late to our room, upon opening shower door there was male body hair throughout the shower, quite a lot in the base. Someone had blown their nose in the shower and it had dried on the shower tiled wall. There was dries soap on the glass door. Unfortunately too late to contact staff or change rooms. Our towels were also in a very worn state with shredded hems.
Although booking site advised cable tv, we could only get 3 channels on normal free to air tv. Upon asking staff after arrival how to access cable they advised they could not help and didn’t know how to work the tv. Staff very unhelpful and unapologetic. I have contacted the motel as office unattended upon checkout.
showerReviews.author: Melanie Keilar

showerReviews.reviewText:
Booked this hotel room for two nights whilst spontaneous decision to travel to Geelong
The website on booking com appeared to be reasonable for the cost per night
Booked for two nights. Couldn’t get parking
Couldn’t open the door with key
There was no hot water
The room was definitely not splendid
It was dirty, reported it to manger of the accomodation stating the room was not up to standard as per on website
Told him to cancel booking for next night
Couldn’t sleep in bed mattress as hard as a block of wood
Reported it to booking com
They gave me 37 dollar credit from a 400 dollar cost
I rate booking com disgraceful and unsupported
I booked accommodation at another place for the next night which was more than comfortable

Disgusted with both booking com and eastern sands motel
The reviews provided in previous are not factual

I rate this place a 1
showerReviews.author: Barbara Manolas

showerReviews.reviewText:
⭐☆☆☆☆
A Real Review!

I recently stayed at Oaks Suites Geelong and unfortunately, my experience was disappointing.

When I entered the room, there was a strong musky smell. I raised this with reception, but was told it was likely due to the previous guest staying for an extended period. I wasn’t offered another room, which was frustrating as they apparently were booked out.

The shower water constantly fluctuated between hot and cold, which made it uncomfortable. The bed sheets felt poor in quality, and the mattress had a noticeable slope on one side, making for a very restless night’s sleep, waking up at 3:30AM

Other details added to the overall negative experience:
•	The reception bench looked run-down with bubbling laminate.
•	The car park layout was very inconvenient, requiring me to carry luggage across different areas of the hotel and even down stairs.i ended up parking in front of the apartments, for easier access, my luggage was heavy!

•	For the price I paid, the standards were far below expectation.

On checkout, I let reception know about my experience. They apologised and said they would look into it, but I felt dismissed—there was no real attempt to make it right. Considering I paid a high rate as it was a Friday night!

The location is great, but overall I would not recommend staying here. There are better options in Geelong, and I personally wouldn’t return!
showerReviews.author: Cath Guerrieri

locations.title: Gold Star Stays

showerReviews.reviewText: · We had to chase up the host for details on how to access the property, which was frustrating after a long trip. The front door lock was dodgy and didn’t feel secure. The apartment wasn’t very clean, there weren’t enough towels, and several lights didn’t work. The Wi-Fi was basically useless, and the bedside lamp was unsafe. Overall, the place felt very tired and worn out — definitely in need of maintenance and a good clean. We were charged top dollar ($400 for one night) due to a basketball tournament in town, which made it feel like a real rip-off given the poor condition of the property.

showerReviews.reviewText:
From the moment I arrived, I was impressed by the level of service, the modern amenities, and the overall quality of this apartment complex.

First and foremost, the location is fantastic. Gold Star Stays is situated right in the heart of Geelong, making it incredibly convenient to explore all the city has to offer.

My accommodation was clean, well-maintained, and beautifully designed. The furnishings are modern and comfortable, making it feel like a home away from home. The kitchen was fully equipped, which allowed me to prepare some of my meals when I wanted to. The living room was spacious, and the bedroom was cozy, ensuring a comfortable and relaxing stay.

I particularly appreciated the cleanliness of the apartment and the common areas. It was evident that the management takes great care to ensure a high standard of hygiene and maintenance.

I can't recommend Gold Star Stays enough, and I look forward to my next visit to this wonderful apartment complex.
