locations.title: Tōhi Skin•Scalp•Spa

showerReviews.reviewText: My first visit to Tohi was amazing. I booked in for a weekday facial and it was with the lovely Sophie who made me feel so cared for and my face was glowing afterwards, so I immediately feel in love and booked the same again, with Sophie. However my second visit recently was a very different experience, my appointment was not with Sophie as I had booked, and instead of being in a private room on a comfortable treatment bed I was put on a 'bed' with a plastic head rest that is used for the hair spa treatment. There was another client having a hair spa in the same room and as we were only separated by a curtain I felt like I was next to a shower room hearing the loud intermittent water. Trying to relax and enjoy my treatment was very hard hearing the hair spa next to me, being on a hard head rest, having water drip down my neck and back, and missing the elements of the facial that I experienced in the first appointment such as a soft pillow, and quiet room. I was so looking forward to my facial but didn't receive the same private experience I had hoped for. Not sure whether to try again because I honestly fell in love with Tohi first time but I'm unsure as to whether I will ever receive the same experience I had received initially 😞
showerReviews.author: Tanya Carmody

locations.title: Lon Retreat & Spa

showerReviews.reviewText: Honestly the best massage I’ve ever received, this place was heavenly from start to finish. Upon entering, the space is so beautiful and serene. I was booked in for a 90min just breathe massage and my therapist was a lovely lady named Jo. She was so intuitive and her massage techniques were perfect. I asked for firm pressure and a focus on neck/shoulders, Jo relieved all my tension and didn’t rush at all. I’ve been to many many 5 star spas across Australia and all over the world but I can confidently say that this was the best massage. Every part of my body felt pampered, even my hands and feet were properly massaged and moisturiser was applied. There were hot towels and hot stones plus Jo even got a heat pack for my sore stomach. Just an absolutely incredible and thoughtful service. I can’t wait to come back!
showerReviews.author: KJ

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Lon Retreat, and from the moment I checked in to the moment I checked out, the experience was nothing short of exceptional. The team was kind, attentive, and truly welcoming, making me feel right at home.

The suites were a haven of tranquility—calming, relaxing, and beautifully designed. Every detail had been thoughtfully curated, from the quality linen, bedding, and towels to the soothing decor. It was clear that the team had put immense care into creating a luxurious and comfortable space.

Having private access to the beach and the opportunity to explore the scenic walks around the property was a highlight. As a woman traveling alone, I felt completely safe and secure, which made my stay even more enjoyable.

The meals provided were simply next level—fresh, delicious, and nourishing wholefoods, all served in the comfort of my suite. It was a welcomed escape, allowing me to truly unwind without having to think about a single thing for a few days.

A special thank you to the incredible team at the spa. Their skills, kindness, and calming nature left me speechless. The experience was transformative, making all the difference in my stay.

Lon Retreat is an absolute must-visit. I’m already looking forward to planning my next trip!

Sarah xx
showerReviews.author: Annonomys

locations.title: Ballarat Aquatic & Lifestyle Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
Ballarat Aquatic & Leisure Centre – Great Facilities, But Needs an Update

Ballarat Aquatic & Leisure Centre offers a wide range of facilities, making it a popular spot for fitness, swimming, and family activities. The staff are generally friendly, and the location is convenient with good access and parking.

However, during my recent visit, I was disappointed to see that the flooring in the kids' pool area has not been updated or maintained to the standard you’d expect from such a prominent community facility. Given the high usage by young families, safety and cleanliness should be a top priority. An upgrade would definitely enhance the overall experience and comfort for both kids and parents.
showerReviews.author: Dr Wajid Unpaid Reviewer

showerReviews.reviewText:
Cast an eye over the gym and you’ll quickly realise the real workout is trying to ignore how filthy the pool area is. The waterline sports a lovely crust of grime think of it as a “natural exfoliant.” The pigeonholes for your belongings? Grotty enough to make you consider just holding your towel for the entire swim. And the water? Less refreshing dip, more chemical soup with a hint of mystery.

The secure lockers haven’t worked since what feels like the Industrial Revolution, and best of all, parts of the pool are routinely closed with all the warning of a surprise pop quiz except this one costs you money before you know what’s happening.

A triumph of mediocrity disguised as a community aquatic centre.
showerReviews.author: Ashley Simpson

On a hot day this is a really nice place to be.

locations.address: 102 Stawell St S, Ballarat East VIC 3350

showerReviews.reviewText:
Eureka Aquatic centre multiple pools 50metre outdoor toddlers area
I recently visited and provide this rating based on experience, staffing and amenities
There was a lack of life guards on duty public holiday 10.3.25 I am of the understanding ratio is 80 patrons = 1 lifeguard
This was not the case today across 3 pools 1 guard how safe is this? Especially when it appeared some parents are busy on phones and not supervising children under 10 years
Entrance was grubby staff welcome on paying non existent even when I inquired about safety for lane swimming
Kids were entering swim lanes, diving in throwing objects and even crossing over the top of rope lanes.
Pick your act up Ballarat this is not a welcoming venue for visitors to the region
Entrance area grubby, amenities sufficient but definitely not clean
showerReviews.author: Murray River

showerReviews.reviewText: Brilliant family pool for a hot day, as there's multiple pools and a heap of grass to sit on, so feels very spacious. Visited on a hot school holiday day, and only the kid's pool was crowded, but still felt OK. There's a huge lap pool, with half available for general swimming, completely shaded toddler pool, kid's 1m pool with small slide, and a sizeable splash park. All pool temperatures are pleasant, clean facilities, and lots of shade sales over the grass areas and bench seats, so plenty of space to spread out. Kiosk sells packet chips and icypoles, not hot food or coffee on the day we visited.

locations.title: Fernwood Fitness

showerReviews.reviewText: This beautiful club is specifically designed to women and with each glance nothing goes unnoticed from the relax lounge area that invites as a safe area to chat over a coffee, to the luxury bathrooms supplied with every piece of equipment and supplies to have you feeling amazing after a work.  Many showers and lockers so no one misses out. The variety of classes with instructors to classes ran by virtual instructors on the hour so there's never an excuse you cant get to a class as its available 24 hours 7 days a week. Honestly the massage chairs that massage from head to toe.  This club is not a gym it is its own community, blessed to have this as my outlet. X

locations.title: Eureka Aquatic Center

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great place to briefly  cool- off, and have a poolside bbq/ picnic .... however the smaller 1m  pool nearest to the often closed kiosk needs some TLC.
The filter doesn't appear to be working properly lately,  you can catch strands of other people's hair between your  fingers while wading in the shallow water, along with debris, used bandaids, leaves and clumps of dirt/ cement etc. The splash park is often out of order for the little ones too. 😞

The concrete surface around the pool closest to the entry appears to be breaking up and washing away and has sunk around the outlet filters entry pipes posing a real safety risk to staff and patrons.
Several children kept tripping over this filter outlet ( see in attached photo) , my daughter included ( scraped knees) which I suspect is the reason for all those floating bandaids in the pool?

Please Ballarat Council, can we do better than this?

I really want to give this pool a university city worthy review now, and well into the future.

How about a couple of waterslides,  every other regional city,  including Geelong and Bendigo has a decent aquatic centre with waterslides.
showerReviews.author: Melinda Cook

showerReviews.reviewText:
I was previously at the Aquatic Centre, but Club Lime is on the way to work, has more equipment, and I prefer the showers (2). I would certainly recommend a membership at Club Lime.

showerReviews.reviewText:
-D2E has by far the best 2 gyms in Ballarat. I wouldn’t go anywhere else!
-Staff are very welcoming, supportive and accommodating. Nothing is ever a hassle for them. Always greeted by a smile and a chat at the door.
-Best priced gym in Ballarat, you can’t get a better deal.
-Excellent, top quality equipment with a great layout for everyone’s needs.
-Huge range of PT’s to choose from who have excellent knowledge and skills for everyone’s  needs
-Excellent amenities: toilets, showers, change rooms, microwave/kitchen area
-Kids area is perfect to for parents wanting to get fit
-Always clean and tidy, I’ve never had an issue with cleanliness. Disinfectant wipes available all over the gym.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym advertises itself as 24/7, but they’ve now changed the timings without any prior notice. I emailed them about it, but no one even bothered to reply. When I requested a refund for my membership—since the new hours make it impossible for me to train—they simply said no. That’s completely unfair.

On top of that, the hygiene here is terrible. The equipment is always dirty, and there are never any wipes available. If you’re looking for a clean gym that actually values its members, avoid this place at all costs!

locations.title: Swim & Survival Academy

showerReviews.reviewText: We have been very impressed with the team at Swim and Survival Academy. The staff are super-friendly and caring. They go the extra mile to create a fun learning environment that our three boys love. We have seen our boys rapidly developed their swimming skills and progress through the swimming levels. Highly recommended.
showerReviews.author: David Pearce

showerReviews.reviewText: We have been very impressed with the team at Swim and Survival Academy. The staff are super-friendly and caring. They go the extra mile to create a fun learning environment that our three boys love. We have seen our boys rapidly developed their swimming skills and progress through the swimming levels. Highly recommended.
showerReviews.author: David Pearce

showerReviews.reviewText: Swim & Survival Academy is the best place to bring your kids to learn to swim. The instructors make it fun for the kids, and the very nervous first timers are soon made to feel happy and relaxed in the water with their teacher. And if they aren't, then they don't push it, they just leave it until next time. I have put 2 kids through here, both through to squad level. I still have one in senior squad with only elite squad to go. He has an intellectual disability, but his squad coach, Lachie, seems to know how to get the best out of him. So much so that he represented his school in state level swimming recently and received a bronze medal in backstroke. Swim & Survival Academy is by far the best swimming school for kids from 6 months to 18 years of age. I can't speak highly enough of the teaching and all the staff there. Do your kids a favour and get them involved here. You'll never regret it.
showerReviews.author: Kim Browne

locations.title: BIG4 Ballarat Windmill Holiday Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
I’ve never been to a caravan park before that has dedicated fenced sites for dog owners and a dog waterpark. This place makes traveling with your fur babies easy.

The fenced sites cost a little bit more than the unfenced sites but the ease it creates is well worth it. I didn’t have to worry about going to the showers or camp kitchen, my dog was safely fenced in and happy after a big swim.

Easy check in, located on the western edge of Ballarat with a shopping centre less than a km away. Facilities were clean, modern and close to my site. Plenty of amenities, pool, gym, tennis, basketball and playground.

This is now my go to spot when visiting Ballarat.

We attended in the school holidays where they did an activity each day for the children & a movie night each night. Was fantastic, will definitely be coming back.

showerReviews.reviewText: First time at park, We Booked the powered premium site! First impressions of the park were great, looked lovely and clean with great facilities and amenities and then we noticed the dump station, RIGHT AT OUR DOORSTEP! Sitting there out in the open in an old flaking paint timber outhouse. So wondering how on earth could you call that site PREMIMUM! I do hope that with all the works going on at other sites you have included shifting the dump station, and fixing the potholes would be great too. I am sure you do have all this in the pipe line but we won’t be booking and paying for a premium site again.
showerReviews.author: Susan Mc Phee

showerReviews.reviewText:
Second time staying here because we have kids and they like the facilities. We stayed at miner cabin the first time and deluxe cabin this time. Both times find the cleanliness really needs to improve especially the floor. I found the miner cabin very dusty and thought maybe it is a bit old. I was very excited about the deluxe this time, unfortunately we checked in with very dirty floor! No sight of being vacuumed with debris around and apparently it was not regularly mopped and there were ants too.
As my kids love playing on the floor, I spent some time cleaning it and was shocked with how dirty (black) it was. The couch needs steam clean too, full of dirty stains.
We love the spaciousness and quality of the deluxe cabin, very modern with dishwasher. Really wish the place was cleaner. We will be reluctant to come back again.
showerReviews.author: Huiting Ho

showerReviews.reviewText:
As a family of four (children being 3 and 6) we had an AMAZING experience at this caravan park. It’s a quiet little caravan park and when we were there, there was HEAPS of families there. All the staff were absolutely amazing and kind. The gaming area needs a little work done to it but for what it was, it was great! I loved they had options for the younger kids to play as well as the older kids AND adults.
The mini golf needs a bit of maintenance done to it as it’s quite worn down but never the less my sons had a blast in there.
I loved that if we had any questions the staff always were willing to help and had a smile on their faces.

The cabin we were in was clean, smelt lovely, the heater/air con worked wonders and the master bed was SO COMFORTABLE.
Shower also had phenomenal pressure and hot.

Thank you so much for having us.
showerReviews.author: Jacqui lindholm

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed here for Christmas 2026 having driven from WA to pick up a new caravan.
Really lovely small park. A little road noise but not disruptive to a good nights sleep.
Lovely owner/caretaker and although amenities are older it’s very very clean and has absolutely everything you need.
It can be windy depending on your site so be prepared to bring full awning etc if you’d like some shelter.
I will definitely stay again when I’m in West Victoria.

Long story short, it's good to overnight for a day, but wouldn't spend any more time here.

locations.title: Woodmanshill Motel & Caravan Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
We were looking for a cheap unpowered site for 1 night. For $41 with power and water (not that we used either) it could have been better. We don't know the situation of the owners but they seemed to have relaxed on maintaining the caravan park. By allowing the weeds to take over, grass to grow wild and general untidiness it doesnt reflct the advertising pictures. We felt the ablution setup was poor, as there was only 4 toilets and 2 showers for the 30 sites. Most of which appeared to be permanents, which I don't have a problem with. If the owners are struggling then can't the residents pitch in and help???
Anyway, I would leave it to others to decide whether they feel it's worthy of a longer stay, if we were to return it would only be for 1 night again.
showerReviews.author: Alicia Paul

showerReviews.reviewText: After paying $165 for the night it would have been nice to have had a clean room my son choked on a bead from what appeared to be a broken child's bracelet. He also on his crawling journey found multiple socks and a dummy that wasn't his indicating room wasnt cleaned properly. We had no hot water so were unable to even have a shower. The bed was comfy but other than that it overall wasn't a great experience or a child friendly room. When I rang them to make them aware all I got was thanks for letting us know.. no sorry or could we help out with a partial refund for the inconvenience. $165 was way to expensive to not even be able to shower.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely disgusting!! Avoid if you can.
Used as emergency accommodation, cabin was mouldy, had no heating for a week, no hot water for a week, and then no water to cabin - still charged full cost.
Had to disgard items that were stored in wardrobe as they were found to be wet and mouldy due to the shower leaking into cupboard and bedroom.
Mattress covered in stains, 'pull out bed' still had dirty linen attached.
'Management are just rude and in it for the money' charge a fortune for shitty hospitality and unkept living quarters.

Management wouldn't refund money paid for an extra guest that didn't end up staying (nor did they accommodate even with payment)
Upon departure 'managment' stood and watched trying to intimidate even though cabin was vacant, yet had to voice themselves stating they'd charge an extra night.

Only positive was that the other residents on the property were friendly,
Cleaners and maintenance staff were Absolutely wonderful

Ended up leaving due to issues with Management and found crisis accommodation elsewhere.
showerReviews.author: Renae Harrop

locations.title: Creswick Holiday Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely location and nice grassy sites. Camp kitchen basic but cosy.

Bathrooms outdated. One shower barely had any pressure (night 1) so I froze! Next morning I chose a different shower and the pressure was 👌  But... drains must be blocked as it eventually became a bath I was standing in and flooded under the door. No shower curtains in any of the stalls so shoes on floor got soaked both times. As can be seen from a photo of old graffiti I took it seems the bathrooms have been sub par for a while.. the attempts to paint over the graffiti hasn't worked.

Service needs BIG improvement. Middle of winter and heaps of empty sites but a couple of basic requests were initially not once but three times flat out refused quoting 'policy'  rather than  first considerjng and weighing up thw requests or negotiating anoher option. Policy or not if youre in the service industry use some logic and COMMON SENSE. Is agreeing to an 11am departure from a tent grass site rather than 10am (to allow for post parkrun shower and social breakfast) going to impact your business negatively in any way? NO. A grass site requires no clean up and even if it did, the next check in isn't until 2pm. On the flip side saying yes to this request immediately shows kindness and good will to people who are visiting your local town PURELY to inject money into your community.  We stayed all of one night to do an 8am parkrun and while staying bought dinner and drinks from two local eateries Fri night then breakfast and coffee at a third Saturday.  We ran with locals and between 4 of us spent $116 staying at your park. You should be supporting tourists like this so we come back and spread the word to others. That's how a business gets more business.

Next time I recommend asking yourself is this request that hard to accommodate?

Same goes for asking to park a second car inside the locked caravan park rather than outside the boom gates. Maybe consider creating a parking space that you charge $10/24hr fee for and make a new policy. Eventually you accepted $20 to allow us to fit the second car on the same site as the first one with swags. But this took three goes. You could have again just exercised some logic and said 'look usually we cannot accommodate this but as its winter and the park is empty we will do you a solid and let you park your car on one of the empty three sites next to you...

Hope some of the above improves as it is a lovely spot and would have returned mire regularly if it had been more pleasant overall
showerReviews.author: Annie Wild

locations.title: Big 4 Kryal Castle Holiday Park - Ballarat

showerReviews.reviewText:
We went for a long weekend tent camping, the site was plenty big enough for a 10p tent and Tarp shelter plus our suv.
There is no play equipment or spaces for kids to play, just be aware if you're travelling with kids. But you might be able to access the castle to play on their equipment, just not as convenient if you need little people to buzz off for a few minutes as you need to accompany them.
The bathrooms are small but clean and quite new. They have powerpoints which was good as i brought my hair-dryer. The lights and fan are on a timer so they kept turning off while we showered but that wasn't too bad.
The camp kitchen is basic; fridge/freezer, microwave, single sink, stove and oven. Minimal bench space and small kitchen so i wouldn't want to try and use it at a busy time, you'd be waiting hours. We packed our own stove and small appliances, using only the sink late at night to do dishes when everyone was gone. There was also a bbq on the deck at the lichen too. No cutlery, a few utensils and no crockery for campers to use so bring what you need.
It was super quiet when we were there, but it seemed to be popular with caravans and campervans.
The staff were lovely, really helpful and assisted with a few booking issues we had.
Kryal castle on the door step made for a great day out and an easy walk to the tent.
showerReviews.author: Zoe Thorn

showerReviews.reviewText:
We arrived after 5pm and followed instructions to collect the keys for our cabin, easy.
The cabin was very cold and despite heater , on for whole night never reached a really warm temperature . As the heater is high on the wall I suspect a lot of heat went out through the ceiling .
A big disappointment was there were No extra Blankets . We had to use bath towels and our coats on the bed to try to get warm .
There's also no hair-dryer in the bathroom !
All the above being said .
The staff are so pleasant, helpful and happy to chat about Castle and local places to visit.
We very much enjoyed the castle and all within  and in spring or summer will try to visit again, maybe bring family too.
showerReviews.author: josephine barker

showerReviews.reviewText:
Not a good place to stay, unless you want to sleep with flies and be frozen.

They would not tell you in advance what to expect in the room even though they knew flies would be everywhere in your room. Instead they will BLAME you for not knowing what to expect in countryside and not asking for help at night time. Well, I would have called the after hours services if I was told that they could help me with catching flies but no I wasn't told anything about what to expect and how to deal with it when things happened. Usually accommodations in regional areas would tell us what to expect like there could be wildlife around and what to do but not for this place. They said they would have sprayed something in my room if I had called them but I had a baby with me. I dont know what makes them think this would be a good solution. Most staff are nice but the management sounds arrogant.

Plus, the floor was greasy and sticky; windowsills were full of dust; we saw hair on a towel and bedsheet as well; the bathroom was freezing and none of us bothered to take a shower.

Also, dont book directly with them. It is better to book through a third party booking agent as they wouldnt get back to you when things happened even they said they would. At least the agent can help you follow things up. I had to try different channels to get someone calling me back!
showerReviews.author: randy chung

showerReviews.reviewText:
Excellent rooms for a motor inn. You can feel the cleanliness of the linens and towels.

I booked a King room for two adults and a child and came to a room prepared with the sofa bed, much to my child’s delight. The bathroom was spacious, great rain shower and better towels than most inns.

The little kitchen nook came with plates, cutlery, microwave, kettle, fridge. Even dishwashing soap which I appreciated and able to wash some of our road trip lunchboxes.

There are two levels, so probably best to request for a ground floor room ahead if you are mobility challenged.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Had been planning to visit this place for sometime and finally could make it last week. We were a group of almost 70 people (around 16 families) with kids as young as 4 years old and adults as old as 65 years old. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed the camp.

The cabins were clean, comfortable and airy. Washrooms were quite well maintained. Kitchen was well equipped for self catering groups such as ours. Activities conducted were adventurous and the staff (Tegan) conducting the activities was highly skilled and cooperative. Although we were not able to meet Grant or Christine (there is always a next time) but they were always in touch through emails or phone calls.

The only thing which we couldn't experience was the BonFire Pit as it was raining in the evening.

Hope to visit again in future !!!
showerReviews.author: Irfan Polra

locations.title: Ballarat Central B&B
locations.address: 202 Dawson St S, Ballarat Central VIC 3350

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed in a standard single.  The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable.

Breakfast was included and was ample - continental-style with bread for toast, butter, spreads, juice, cereal and a fruit cup.  Tea and coffee were separately available freely for guests.

The B&B is spotless and the hosts go out of their way to help guests.

There are two shared bathrooms and a further separate toilet and this worked fine for my stay.

I made use of the laundry, which has both a front and top loader washing machine, a tumble dryer and two ironing stations.

There is a nice lounge area open to residents use, with a tv and books available.

The B&B is two blocks away from Sturt Street, the main east-west street into the city, but sits in a quiet area.

I would happily stay again if I am passing through Ballarat.
showerReviews.author: Gary

locations.address: 5/7 Humffray St N, Bakery Hill VIC 3350

showerReviews.reviewText: Very noisy. Could hear the neighbours tv through the wall all night every night as well as people arriving and leaving.  Also the ashtray was mounted to the wall outside my bathroom meaning I had smokers constantly outside my room and had to keep the blind down in the bathroom, at one point the ashtray was smoking so bad I had to put water in it. My room stunk of cigarettes.  The shower curtain was about 60cms away from the floor and pushed into the shower while using it and it stuck to my leg.  I didn't meet the staff at any time, everytime I went to reception it was closed and locked.  Wouldn't stay here again.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have stayed here twice.
The first stay was ok, and we were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room.
The second time was deeply unpleasant.
When checking in, I asked the manager if I could get late check out to 11am. He responded as if I had just made the most ridiculous request he had ever heard. “We are very busy, everyone want late check out, no late check out.” Ok, dude, chill.
I proceeded to my room. I had taken care to book the same room type, as my family had enjoyed the size of the room last time. I walked into a room half the size of last time.
I went back to the front desk, not expecting much after my earlier interaction, but did ask if another room was available as my room didn’t match what I had booked. “No, we are full,” he responded before staring back at his computer.
These two interactions set a negative tone for the stay. Our bathroom smelled moldy. The shower was backed up and overflowed. I guess that is why the bathroom smells moldy. The horrible shower curtain keeps blowing up against you while you shower. The people in the room above us seemed to be having some sort of jumping competition from 12:30 to 1am.
In the end I was happy to leave the room well before 10, no need to stay late here.
If the manager does not want to provide friendly service to customers, perhaps he should consider other lines of work. Until then, if you are in Ballarat, trust me, just stay somewhere else.
I came for the weekend for a special birthday celebration with my family and regretted choosing this hotel. Don’t make the same mistake.
showerReviews.author: Kevin Carrico

Room was not clean
New towel had hair in the folded towel
Hair dryer doesnt look like its even been clean

We booked and payed late check in
Our code for a lock box for our check in was sent via sms

Got there after 8pm
Try the code for box to get card and it didnt give me my door card for our room

We rang him and was 15 mins away to check us in even though our card was in lock box but it wasnt

Now if i got there say after 10pm or midnight to check in with my code and didnt work

And they wouldnt answer the phone
You would be so screwed cause u payed for a night which u cant stay there cause they forgot to put our door card in the lock box

Also small lamp in room 22 not clean

Also air con filters in room 3 not clean 🤢🤢

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed a few days over Xmas while catching up with family over Xmas. The motel was in a great location, walking distance to the main street and walks along the Murray. The room was clean and had everything we needed to be able to breakfast in or have a BBQ at the motel. The table and chairs outside the rooms got the sun in the morning and the motel pool and spa pool were greatly welcomed and enjoyed-even in the rain! A TV at the shared BBQ area meant we could watch the cricket and meet other guests. The guest laurndry had a washing machine and dryer for a good price. Thanks for your hospitality. We would stay again for sure.

locations.title: Bell Tower Inn

showerReviews.reviewText:
We were travelling as an adult family of 3 - 2 rooms, for 2025 NYE. Initially booked with pet but cancelled pet as puppy too young. You MUST advise at booking as they have a limited number of pet friendly rooms.
Positives:
Rooms were large and clean with extra towels available for swimming- on request- at reception.
Ample free parking
Room amenities included a microwave
Easy check in & check out process
Close to Ballarat Golf Club (* NYE dinner was an easy booking thank God!)
NEGATIVES:
Restaurant CLOSED NYE!!! So, no room service, either‼️
Advertised heated, indoor pool WASN’T 🥶
Not  at ALL! Not tepid, not at ALL warm.

We chose this place for the heated indoor pool & onsite restaurant- my husband was looking forward to some hydro therapy for his x2  recent knee surgeries.
… And luckily, the Ballarat Golf Club restaurant was easy to book for NYE dinner - a very pleasant environment with full table service.
showerReviews.author: AJ Burchell

locations.title: Lake Inn Ballarat (Accommodation)

showerReviews.reviewText: We loved our stay at Lake Inn Motel. We were there for 3 nights for kids basketball tournament. My kids loved the comfort and its closeness to the game venues, the IGA around the corner and the big beautiful lake. We booked the queens deluxe room and it was just perfect, we felt at home. Spacious room with study desk, small dining table, small kitchen and spacious bathroom with wide mirror, big shower space and toilet. It felt like we were staying at a serviced apartment. Inside the residence parking space also very safe for our car and close to room easy in and easy out. Shellie the manager is also very welcoming and helpful. We felt welcomed as soon as we stepped into reception. As we packed up and looked out the window and realized we enjoyed and will miss this place. We will absolutely come back. Highly recommend this place to others. Thank you once again.
showerReviews.author: MELE SINGH

showerReviews.reviewText: Perfect hotel whilst visiting for work. Rooms are modern and clean and staff are friendly and helpful. When I checked in my room had a suspicious wet patch on the carpet and the reception staff quickly changed my room. Both rooms were immaculate and nicely furnished. Bathroom was newly renovated and comfortable. Great location as well. Windows aren't double glazed so you might hear the trains since the hotel is right opposite the station, but for the price and amenities it's still one of the best I've stayed. Highly recommended!

locations.title: Federation Health, Sports and Aquatic Centre
locations.address: P Building, University Dr, Mount Helen VIC 3350

showerReviews.reviewText: Great facilities and venue especially for a quieter swim than the Ballarat pool. Having said that, the supervisory staff need to be much more proactive with the adolescent kids. Attended 9/2 and staff allowed group of 3 boys (unsupervised) to bomb, swear and annoy younger swimmers to the point some families left, as well as some lap swimmers needed to ask the boys to stop agitating them in the swimming lane.  Staff were seen watching and smiling at the boys antics but not forcing them to settle down. This particular group of 3 boys are regulars to the pool. It’s not up to parents watching their own kids to monitor the behaviour of kids attending without parent supervision.
showerReviews.author: Steve Anderson

locations.title: Ballarat's Sanctuary Day Spa

showerReviews.reviewText:
So glad we could squeeze in a trip to The Sanctuary over the weekend. After walking around Sovereign Hill all day/night on Saturday it was magic to be able to unwind and relax in the pool.

Make sure you plan your trip well ahead of time as there are limited spots available and it does book up. All the better in my mind, it was so nice having the pool to ourselves for more than half the session! The team was lovely and really made our visit a great experience.

The robes were so soft with a generous fitting (easily 4XL friendly). You're given flip flops, robe, and towel included in your entry. All you need to bring is your bathers.

We had an hour with the pool and sauna which felt like more than enough time. We practically floated out of the spa, so cozy and calm on a cold wet day. Highly recommend a visit!
showerReviews.author: Kathryn Christie

locations.title: Ballarat Wellness Centre and Salt Rooms

showerReviews.reviewText:
I rang Ballarat Wellness Centre after a friend highly recommended them to me  on the 1st November, last Saturday.  Ray (owner) answered my call.  I told him I was a carer utterly exhausted and burnt out what do you suggest. He recommended a salt bath.  There are various options- massage, two types of saunas and a salt bath.  I had the salt bath recommended by Ray.  There was salt on the floor of inflorescent red light, a box of tissues and a relaxing wellness light.  There was soft music. Nothing said on way in nothing to do but relax or face the ‘demons’ in you.  I slowly began with a mindful relaxation and felt salt in my skin but it was healing my spirit.  Washing away negative thoughts, anger, annoyances with family. Etc. in the end I pictured all who were causing me pain and not helping me in my role as carer.  I gently, peacefully it
imagined what I would like to say to them and I was no longer hurt or angry or whatever. The salt bath had healed me - body, mind and spirit. A big thank you to Ray and the staff and I highly recommend it.
showerReviews.author: Maria Donegan

locations.title: Temple Health Spa
locations.address: 623 Humffray St S, Golden Point VIC 3350

showerReviews.reviewText: Today I had the “wings to fly” package as a treat. I cannot explain how amazing the time was being massaged, scrubbed, moisturized and thoroughly relaxed. Prue thought of everything from warming my cold feet with a warmed towel, to plentiful herbal tea and slippers and the fluffiest bathrobe. Her quiet and gentle manner were very welcome yet she gave me a “firm” massage as requested and I could feel all the knots in my back melting away. The refined sugar free, gluten free vegan treats were a nice touch and all the products that she used were premium quality and smelled amazing. Cannot recommend highly enough. A hidden gem.
showerReviews.author: Katie Gadsby

showerReviews.reviewText:
I highly regret enrolling my 9-year-old child at this swimming institute. Initially, the experience seemed great with one instructor for every three kids, but recently, the class sizes have grown to more than five kids per instructor. This has resulted in no real focus on the individual needs of the children. My child is just going through the motions, swimming laps with no corrective guidance or improvement.

The facility itself is consistently disappointing.The access gates are often malfunctioning, and it’s a hassle to even get in. The staff seem clueless when it comes to handling simple queries.

To make matters worse, the toilets and changing rooms are often blocked off for group use, leaving kids with no access when they need it.

The facility is incredibly hot and unbearable, making it uncomfortable to even be inside for more than a few minutes. Overall, this is a poorly managed facility that should not be in operation, especially given that it’s not even that old. Very disappointing, and I will be pulling my child out as soon as possible.
showerReviews.author: Vinson Cherolickal

showerReviews.reviewText:
Children’s Safety Compromised at Gurri Wanyarra

During my 3 year old swimming lesson, my child swam off the safety platform and struggled with no help from staff or lifeguards. I had to run to the pool myself.

This is a warning to parents: the centre runs lessons with 1 instructor to 5 young children; in our experience, this ratio is unsafe and leaves kids vulnerable. There are no proper flotation devices, only loose noodles, and lifeguards do not actively monitor the classes.

Beyond safety, the customer experience is appalling.
•	Make up classes are only valid for 2 weeks, which is unrealistic given how often children get sick. This was also not told to us from the start of our lessons.
•	We were hit with mystery charges that even staff could not explain, and when we questioned them, the woman receptionist was extremely rude, to the point that my spouse was left in tears after being shouted at.
•	The toilets and change rooms smell strongly of urine, showing an obvious problem with cleanliness and maintenance of the pipes.

We’ve pulled our child from lessons and demanded a refund. This is the worst customer service we have ever experienced, and combined with the lack of safety, I cannot recommend this facility to any parent. The Bendigo community deserves far better than a pool that cuts corners at the expense of children’s safety.
showerReviews.author: Angelina Liu

locations.title: Golden Square Pool

showerReviews.reviewText:
I feel very lucky that this is our local pool and it’s close enough to walk to (even if it’s a couple blocks).

Sam the president is a friendly guy who is always chatting with volunteers and patrons. The volunteers are ALWAYS so welcoming and helpful, even the kids!

Love that there’s a smaller shallow pool for younger kids who are just learning - I do wish that parents of older rougher children would be aware of that however the lifeguards are usually on top of anything dangerous.

Cheap kiosk prices for snacks and drinks or even goggles if you need them, I would like entry cost to be cheaper as it’s $16 for myself and 2 kids to get in with a concession card but it’s volunteer run and the profits go back into the pools maintenance so I’m happy to pay it!

2 warm showers in the women’s change room which is great because the pool can be chilly some days and my kids like to warm up and get dressed before we walk home again.

The man in charge of the lawns needs a special mention because you can tell he works so hard on getting that grass so green and manicured.

What a beautiful little place to do some reading by the pool, take your baby for their first swim or go for a family evening like the movie night or food truck events.
showerReviews.author: Candice Anderson

showerReviews.reviewText:

Love that there’s a smaller shallow pool for younger kids who are just learning - I do wish that parents of older rougher children would be aware of that however the lifeguards are usually on top of anything dangerous.

locations.title: Brennan Park Swimming Pool

showerReviews.reviewText: This is a nice place for swimming and competitions, including alternative for people who cannot swim, a main problem is the lack of privacy and loathsome of the changing rooms, but the other factors including shady areas and seating spots are exceptional.
showerReviews.author: Backup Account

showerReviews.reviewText: This is a nice place for swimming and competitions, including alternative for people who cannot swim, a main problem is the lack of privacy and loathsome of the changing rooms, but the other factors including shady areas and seating spots are exceptional.
showerReviews.author: Backup Account

showerReviews.reviewText:
First visit to Brennan Park Swimming Pool. On a positive note, it has a nice 50m lap pool and clear water.....which is expected.

There is supposed to be 4 pools in total, but there's only 3. Someone decided to fill in the dive pool and not update the description.

The other two pools are basically tiny shallow pools.....nothing to brag about.
There is shade, but without seating under it. There are bench seats, but without shade above them. There's a BBQ area with picnic benches and shade, but unless you're there to eat, then this is a useless place to supervise the pool from.

Pool staff were friendly. There's a kiosk.

Two change rooms/toilets only .... Labelled "Male" & "Female". That's it. There's no family change room either.

The "Male" change room is disgusting. I took my son in after his swim lesson so he could shower and change. The change room was empty, so it was a good opportunity to have a closer look . My son did not want to be there and I completely understand.

It is rundown, old, outdated and neglected. There are no individual shower cubicles and nowhere to shower or dress with some privacy.  It resembled a football locker room of the 70's

There is a shared shower area with three showers and an open change room. The shower area is raw concrete and the ceiling throughout is painted asbestos. How do I know this..... it's labelled asbestos.

I've attached some pictures so you can get a feel for the ambience the Brennan Park Swimming Pool have managed to encapsulate.

My recommendation, there's far better options in Bendigo.
showerReviews.author: ausorganicpork

locations.title: D-Club247 Fitness

showerReviews.reviewText: I've been going to this gym for 4 years and it's absolutely fantastic. The facilities are suitable for a variety of training styles from plates to strength training to pylometrics and more. The downstairs area has cardio equipment, machines, free weights, several squat racks, and a Reformer pilates area. The upstairs area is spacious whilst still offering a variety of equipment. There's also a small dance room. The atmosphere is great regardless of if you want a gym community or would prefer to keep to yourself, though there's always a friendly face at DClub. The lockers and bathrooms are always sparkling clean and offer toilets, showers, lockers, hair straighteners, ironing board, and more.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great gym for a lifter, has all the things you need to get your workout done.

Only has weights, and limited cardio machines though, so if you're interested in classes as well, they aren't here. Does have bathroom and shower facilities too.

Bottom line, coming here is insane value. Memberships are very inexpensive, and for the traveler or casual user, $5 single visit passes are unique to Doherty's, with other gyms charging $15 or more for a casual visit.

locations.title: BIG4 Bendigo Park Lane Holiday Park

showerReviews.reviewText: Great park. Well set out however reception could have a bit better signage upon entry, we didn't see any obvious sign pointing up to reception because it's already such a colourful area with a lot of signs, maybe a painting on the road with Reception this way would be handy for those who havnt been before. Other than that it's a fantastic park. Ensuite sites are very practical and modern facilities. Family room in the main amenities that had a bath which was great for our youngest. The play centre is a fantastic addition and a great way to wear the kids out! A very family friendly park. It is close to a main road however the road noise wasn't really noticeable at night. The park is also located quite close to a shopping centre that has plenty of food options and supermarkets. Highly recommend this park if your travelling with kids to Bendigo.

We camped at the en-suite site with our camper trailer and they are amazing! Best en-suite site we have ever seen. Very clean, beautiful white towels provide and lovely soaps provided to use during the stay.

Would definitely recommend this place and we will go again.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Liked:
The room was spacious and pet-friendly. Clean towels and nice shampoo/shower gel were provided.

Disliked:
1. The couch! It is DISGUSTING 😭 It's visibly dirty and actually broken. It looks as if they found this couch in a dumpster and brought it in. I am very grossed out by it. (All the furniture in our room felt quite dated, but the couch was the worst.)

2. There were many flies in the room. I killed at least eight before going to bed.

3. The 10 AM check-out time feels really early. 11 AM would have given guests more time to enjoy the facility and their breakfast.

4. Wifi didn't work.

Overall, we enjoyed our stay here with the dog and the baby, but I feel the room could use some renovation, and I wish we didn't have to rush to check out by 10 AM.
showerReviews.author: Erica Chang

showerReviews.reviewText: For over 12 years we have stayed in cabin 6. This year seems to be our last as we went to book for next year.when we were leaving and were told it is already booked out to a family. Now the new owners apparently  have no idea on allowing existing patrons the option to rebook when leaving if they chose to. It is a shame Paul and Dwyane decided to leave as this was the best place to stay. Our cabin had dust that thick on the fridge I could write my name. No tea towel or small broom and shovel to sweep the floor. When we stay it s for 4 nights Min so it,s important to us to keep clean. The state of the park and cabins now worry us as to the the cleanliness  of the place. No one in the office at anytime, it,s a shame this once beautiful place has gone to discrace.
showerReviews.author: Ray Clover

locations.title: All Seasons Hotel Bendigo

showerReviews.reviewText:
There is much to like here, the facilities are good with a pool and sauna etc. The rooms whilst clean were sparse and I really think overpriced to be honest. Also beware the floor on my shower was a little slippery.  There was no noise issues so slept quite well.

But it is a fair way away from anywhere to eat or go for a glass of wine so you will have to hop in your car (or taxi/uber) or just use the onsite bistro and bar. Same if you want to go to the main part of Bendigo and the traffic is quite heavy. There is a Sportsbar/gaming/bistro onsite with some good food and nightly special prices (Happy Hour is a good time to grab that beer). There was however nowhere to sit and have a glass of wine or beer or whatever you fancy other than the Sportsbar, which I was a little surprised about.
showerReviews.author: Erica Simpson

showerReviews.reviewText:
I just wanted to say thank you for the wonderful service and facilities at your hotel. This was the first time I have stayed at all seasons and it was a wonderful experience. From the first check in where I was greeted by a lovely friendly young lady to the wonderful rooms you offer. The bed and pillows were fantastic, and the shower was elite. Instant hot water and lots of it. I ate in the restaurant on Monday evening and the food was excellent. Your gym, sauna and pool were a welcome bonus.

Thank you it makes business travel so much better when you have something nice to come back to after a long day.

locations.title: Newbridge Loddon River Camp Ground

showerReviews.reviewText:
Such a great find.  Cheery community run camp ground for $15 per night with fire pits (BYO wood), and spots by the river.  Plenty of space to feel the bush camping vibe, and the amenities were spotless, with hot showers and flushing toilets.  Only detraction was the flies (perhaps from some nearby cows), but they disappeared at dusk.
We were very lucky to find this spot, and are appreciative to the Newbridge community for offering it.
showerReviews.author: Mike Cretan

locations.title: Lake Eppalock Holiday Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely love Lake Eppalock Holiday Park!
The park owners and staff have been lovely every single time we've visited and are so relaxed and welcoming.
There's a swimming pool, playground, jumping pillow and little animal farm.
Best of all though you're right on the lake so it's easy to launch a boat or jet ski and there's loads of lake frontage so it doesn't feel like everyone's on top of each other.
The sites are quite large and the facilities are great. And if you're super lucky you might be there on a weekend when they come round delivering fresh hot jam donuts or scones!
showerReviews.author: Annette P

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed on a powered site with our camper trailer on Australia Day long weekend and had an absolutely wonderful experience!
From the moment we arrived we were pleased with how friendly the lady in the office was and it only got better from there! The facilities are amazing, there was activities for the kids, a live performance on the Saturday evening on the beautiful grassy area which was complete with fresh pizzas available to order and an ice cream truck! The playground looked a bit dated but the kids absolutely loved it! The pool looks small when passing by but is absolutely great and surprisingly spacious! The shower block consists of multiple little ensuites with enough room that I could shower my two daughters and myself one after another without being crammed.
The kids loved seeing the animals everyday in the petting zoo area, not to mention the cute little chickens at the back of the shop! The jumping pillow was also a huge hit!
Everything down to the bbq area being freshly stocked every morning with enough dish soap and a few freshly washed and dried chux cloths and tea towels just made the stay even more perfect! And just when you think you may have forgotten something just pop into the little shop to grab literally anything except the kitchen sink!! From nappies to batteries to hydralyte, first aid kits, salt and pepper, water and fishing rods the convenience of the little shop absolutely blew my mind! A little pricey but you’re paying for the convenience which is well worth it! And considering how lovely the service is who cares if you’re paying a tiny bit more than usual for an item you need!
We absolutely loved this place and next time will bring the kids bikes for the little bike track!

Thank you to your entire team for such a great weekend!!
showerReviews.author: Kimberley Weinbrecht

locations.title: Notley Camping Area

showerReviews.reviewText: I stayed here last night- 6/5/23.. Great camp grounds.. Lots of flat area to park cars, caravans and campervans.. Lots of green tables with benches to sit and have a bite to eat. Huge undercover area with more tables and benches to sit and eat when it's raining. Behind the undercover area is a lake half empty tho but not good to go in for a swim as the water is murky. Lots of fire pits to cook food and 2 drop toilets if you need to go.. No showers or rubbish bins but otherwise a quiet spot. Foxes are cunning tho and do come near the fire pits so obviously people have been feeding them for them to come close to where you stay.
showerReviews.author: Sunflower 90

showerReviews.reviewText:
Had a few nights here, March 2023. Absolutely lovely, peaceful spot. Some very big trees so be mindful where you set up. Not many other campers. Lovely quiet spot for swimming in the river near the bridge.  Never got the kayak in a it was a tad windy, next time. Plenty of wood on the ground for a small cooking fire.
Shame about all the toilet paper along the water side, move away people, at least 100 paces, and do the right thing.
showerReviews.author: Janine Kenyon

showerReviews.reviewText: We made a last minute decision to stop here overnight in Sept. We would definitely recommend this caravan park.

showerReviews.reviewText:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Incredible Stay – Seamless Check-In & Immaculate Facilities!

Our recent stay at the St Arnaud Caravan Park was absolutely outstanding from the moment we arrived. The check-in process was seamless, thanks to the instant message service
We received extremely fast responses with their initial availability , clear instructions on everything I enquired about , and on arrival, had our site sorted with zero fuss. It couldn’t have been easier.

A big thank you to Jamie and Damien, who were both exceptionally friendly and helpful. Damien  greeted us with a smile, provided personal guidance right to our drive-through site, and ensured we were fully set up without any hassle.

We chose a drive-through site near the amenities, and it was perfect. The site was sealed, with a tidy grassed area, a nearby seat, and the amenities block just across the road. The amenities themselves were outstanding , extremely spotless, and very comfortable to use. We were so impressed, we booked an extra night just to get our washing done using the great laundry area, complete with two full clotheslines right  nearby

The park is immaculate, beautifully laid out with large powered sites ( some overlooking the town ) with very modern units also available , and as a whole was clearly well maintained. The camp kitchen was immaculately clean and well-positioned for easy access by all guests. It made preparing meals a breeze.

Another huge plus: it’s only a 5-minute walk to the Main Street, where we found everything we needed—great shops, a well-kept town park, and even a visit to the lovely local hairdresser, Melinda, who gave us fantastic haircuts during our stay.
The local street art around the town was so good and the silo art is a must see , all located around the town streets .

Our time at St Arnaud Caravan Park was simply incredible. Between the friendly hosts, clean facilities, and charming town, it’s a place we’d happily return to and highly recommend to anyone travelling through this beautiful part of Victoria.

A true hidden gem !
A huge congratulations to the owners

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ s from me
showerReviews.author: Brad Skepper

locations.title: Golden Country Motel & Caravan Park

showerReviews.reviewText: Just got home from a 2 night stay in Cabin 27. Cabin was perfect! Kitchen was stocked with full sized mugs! All cutlery, utensils and appliances needed and a thoughtful cork screw bottle/can opener is also provided! Bathroom had full sized shampoo, conditioner, body and hand wash! Plenty of towels and a specific make up towel! For those that have stayed in enough cabins... you know these are a real treat! There is an established community garden you're welcome to and even accomadate local birds with bird feeders. Owners Terri, Dirk and doggy Beauie are so friendly. welcoming, accommodating and chilled! Doggies even have a fully fenced area they can play in, when their cute chickens aren't foraging. So, thank you so much to Terri, Dirk and Beauie for an enjoyable couple of days. I'll be back!
showerReviews.author: Lorena DC

Convenient location, clean comfortable room, very affordable to stay overnight; a great and grand staircase.
There is no reception or anyone present; but communication with entry code etc straight forward.
Maintenance in the bathroom urgently needed: towel rack, paper holder, lamp shade all broken, mold around the shower edges.
Forget about the 'courtyard'; it's filthy with birds emptying the rubbish bins
Could be a perfect place to stay longer without all this neglect.

Great location as this was middle of the city.
The entrance and stairs were not so clean. But, had a nice chandelier in the middle of the stairs.
Room was clean enough.  Towel rail in the bathroom was missing.

All other amenities in the bathroom was good.
Didnt have milk in the fridge. But maybe coz its in the city itself. Cups were not clean as i had to wash them again before using.
Space in the room was good.

We heard lot of noise as a couple was fighting over night. Cursing and all. Wasn't a pleasant feeling with family.

locations.title: Bendigo Homestead Motor Inn & Apartments

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely Delighted - Highly Recommend!
What a fantastic surprise from the moment I opened the door. The room smells beautifully fresh and is absolutely sparkling clean – truly impressive. I love the comfortable bed adorned with beautiful, clean white sheets and doona cover. A particularly nice touch is finding a hair dryer in the equally spotless bathroom – something you don't always get! The gentleman at the front desk is  very friendly and welcoming. This motel came highly recommended by a friend, and they were spot on – the rooms are beautiful. The added bonus of YouTube for entertainment is much appreciated. For anyone visiting Bendigo, this is the place to stay: very reasonably priced, immaculately clean, and beautifully presented. Ten stars if I could!
showerReviews.author: Sam Mazzarino

showerReviews.reviewText:
The apartment accommodation is quite basic and dated, with a distinctly 1970s feel.

The decor, including brown blankets, hasn't been updated, and the rooms lack modern touches.

There are several threatening notices around the apartment that could feel off-putting, including a warning about a $50 fee if the dishes aren’t washed, dried, and put away. 🫤

While this is a budget-friendly option, it’s very no-frills. If I were to visit again, I’d consider paying a little extra for a stay at the nearby Quest apartments for a more comfortable experience.
showerReviews.author: James Rousseaux

locations.title: Bendigo Motor Inn

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pretty decent place for the price you pay. Rooms are clean and tidy.
Room photos taken at checkout. Hence beds are unmade.
Service is all right, and rooms are equipped with a TV, a microwave,  2-slice toaster, electric water kettle as well as a bar fridge. All rooms are fitted with reverse cycle air-conditioning.
There also is an iron and ironing board with enough crockery,  cutlery and glasses.
Bathrooms are well-stocked wirh hand wash, shampoo, bath soaps and all other necessities.
Tea bags, coffee and sugar are available in all rooms for the guests.
A nice Cafe opposite the Inn can be a good choice for brekkie.
Cannot comment on the in-house restaurant and spa, pool as did not use these facilities.
But reception staff is helpful and overall a budget friendly place.
P.S. - do carry your own drinking water.
showerReviews.author: Suvrat Upadhye

showerReviews.reviewText: older looks like they are trying to clean and paint I don't mind an older room but the cleanliness of the bathroom and shower isn't anything for them to be  proud of !  To the cleaning staff   a bit of bleach  and a few sprays of mould killer in the shower and bathroom   would make your ratings and reviews  ALOT BETTER   if that issue was addressed on a regular basis   it would help  you achieve 5 star review  from alot more customers  . REMEMBER the customer is always right!! fix  your broken towel hangers and toilet roll holders before someone get injured . the dangerous  shard of plastic  broken towel rail  is a serious problem  !  I've stayed in alot older rooms in Bendigo and never felt the need to write a negative review Proper cleaning  IS A MUST

showerReviews.reviewText: older looks like they are trying to clean and paint I don't mind an older room but the cleanliness of the bathroom and shower isn't anything for them to be  proud of ! REMEMBER the customer is always right!! fix  your broken towel hangers and toilet roll holders before someone get injured . the dangerous  shard of plastic  broken towel rail  is a serious problem  !  I've stayed in alot older rooms in Bendigo and never felt the need to write a negative review Proper cleaning  IS A MUST

1,Cups and glasses were dirty.
2 No spoons.
3 No fill up front last person's visit for tea and coffee.
4,No complementary milk.
5,The blanket had marks and a shocking smell on it .we placed it underneath the table away from our clothes. definitely not washed.
6  Bathroom door has some shocking spillage just hope it's not sick from someone.
7.we heared the cleaners come I  the room next door and to our shock she cleaned the room in 10min.i don't even think you could change the bed in that time.
8, the carpark look nice but not practical. with a sports car or any low car.there are large rocks every angle of the carpark.
9, Ants? ever where .up the walls. on the balcony.

We sent them an email and texts the number with not one response?

There is no privacy at this place.
room 1 .you sit on your balcony and room 2 toilet window is in there balcony. room 2 and 3 share a two seat one table. very strange set-up.We left early as we could not relax at this place.there are other places in Bendigo we have stayed at lot more relating. the funny thing our room next to us left early to and they did not look happy.
They call it ￼Bendigo Botanic.but there is nothing Botanic about it.very let down.

We will definitely be staying again, and next time, I hope to use the pool there.

locations.title: Municipal Baths

showerReviews.reviewText: What a wonderful greenspace this is. The Municipal Baths with a lakeside loop track and boardwalk. Opened on the 3rd of February 2025, or should that read reopened? This is the site of the original swimming baths that opened in 1913. Today the space has been transformed into a wonderful greenspace and aquatic feature. You will experience shade trees, lawn areas, seating, native plantings and landscaping. The Municipal Baths area offers direct access from Barnard Street right thru to Rosalind Park and the centre of Bendigo. Well worth a visit and explore.
showerReviews.author: Greg H

locations.title: Paragon Thai Massage Bendigo

showerReviews.reviewText:
I was sceptical having all 5 star reviews but after a bad day and struggling to find somewhere else I thought I'd go anyway.
Parking was easy, Facilities are clean and well presented inside and out, Atmosphere is great, the whole place smells nice. Rooms are spacious, they have heating and are set at good temperature. Calming music is at good volume and not repetitive. No clocks ticking. Bed/Table is wide and accommodating. Face pillow is comfortable! (I struggle to find good one of these). I've had 3 different Masseuses now and pressure has been exactly what was asked for (They even walked/knelt on my back!!). Great at finding sore spots, keep hands on and go at a good pace. Warm/hot towels are used at the end (and not just one for the whole body so it's cold after the first area!). They made me feel comfortable enough to voice my needs. Pricing is good, opening hours and availability work. They give you water at the end and mints are available. They have loyalty cards.
They certainly earn the 5 star rating.
showerReviews.author: Leanne Singleton

locations.title: South Pacific Health Club St Kilda

showerReviews.reviewText:
I regret writing this negative review of the gym because I love going there. Lovely seaside location with large windows over looking the bay. However, I have complained about the condition of the women's toilets for YEARS and nothing has been done to address ill fitting toilet seats and general filth and disrepair. The toilet in the gym area is often clogged, smelly and without amenities.
This is despite spending a fortune on renovating vast areas of the gym and buying countless more weights for yet more focus on lifting.
Hygiene continues to be a problem overall and methods of cleaning the equipment are primitive and often scant.
I fault the management for neglecting women's needs in general and the neglect borders on disrespect. My membership is $1200 per year.  Don't let this gym go under.  It is wonderful in potential but lacking in management.
showerReviews.author: Deborah Salkov

showerReviews.reviewText:
I regret writing this negative review of the gym because I love going there. Lovely seaside location with large windows over looking the bay. showerReviews.reviewText:
I’ve been a member at South Pacific St Kilda for only a short time, and unfortunately my experience has been consistently poor from the very beginning. The facilities and the service both fell well below the standard you would expect from a gym at this price point.

To start with, the cleanliness of the pool area and male changing rooms is unacceptable. The pool has repeatedly appeared unclean, and the changing room almost always has a strong, unpleasant smell. On several occasions I noticed dead flies left in the lockers, which is clearly a sign that basic cleaning and hygiene standards aren’t being met.

We then experienced problems with our access cards being locked without any explanation. My partner entered with their card, held the door for me, and I tapped myself in as well. Apparently this isn’t allowed, something to do with a strict “one person at a time through the door after it closes” policy. Yet none of this was ever communicated to us during sign-up or induction. We only found out after emailing management, who informed us of the rule after the fact. Even after that, the access for one of us still didn’t work properly, leaving us stuck in a loop of back-and-forth with no resolution.

The attitude and experience level of the front desk staff also left a lot to be desired. Each time we tried to get help in person, the staff seemed unsure of procedures, unable to fix issues, and generally not very helpful. There’s a noticeable lack of training or support for them, which unfortunately spills onto customers.

Finally, and most frustratingly, we followed the official cancellation procedure through their online portal over a week ago, visited the gym in person to follow up, and emailed both the main inbox and the manager. We’ve had no response whatsoever. For a gym that stresses policies and procedures so heavily, they don’t seem able to follow their own when it comes to processing cancellations.

Overall, this has been one of the poorest gym experiences I’ve ever had. Unclean facilities, inconsistent access, unhelpful staff, and a complete lack of communication from management. I’m still waiting for confirmation of my cancellation, and at this point I’m extremely unimpressed. I hope they take this feedback seriously and improve things for future members.
showerReviews.author: Ali

Each time we tried to get help in person, the staff seemed unsure of procedures, unable to fix issues, and generally not very helpful. There’s a noticeable lack of training or support for them, which unfortunately spills onto customers.

Finally, and most frustratingly, we followed the official cancellation procedure through their online portal over a week ago, visited the gym in person to follow up, and emailed both the main inbox and the manager. We’ve had no response whatsoever. For a gym that stresses policies and procedures so heavily, they don’t seem able to follow their own when it comes to processing cancellations.

Overall, this has been one of the poorest gym experiences I’ve ever had. Unclean facilities, inconsistent access, unhelpful staff, and a complete lack of communication from management. I’m still waiting for confirmation of my cancellation, and at this point I’m extremely unimpressed. I hope they take this feedback seriously and improve things for future members.
showerReviews.author: Ali

showerReviews.reviewText: I regret writing a negative review for this venue as I used to enjoy coming on a regular basis, beautiful ocean views with large windows are a great bonus. Visited in 2025 - the hot water spa pool is not hot, I wouldn't even consider it warm, the jets are no longer strong + there is mould, grout on the pool (even though they shut for a while month to clean) the steam room is not steamy either. I called in advance to ask if they close the steam room / pool early and they assured me it was 9.30pm. ultimately they turned the steam room off more than 10 minutes before the facility closed. Incredibly disappointing st Kilda sea baths. Used to be better.

locations.title: St Kilda beach

showerReviews.reviewText:
🏖️ St Kilda Beach in Melbourne is one of the city’s most popular and beautiful coastal destinations, perfect for a day of relaxation by the sea. On a sunny day, the brilliant blue sky blends seamlessly with the sparkling blue water, creating a breathtaking and serene view. The long sandy stretch is ideal for sunbathing, swimming, or taking a leisurely walk along the shore while enjoying the fresh ocean breeze.

The St Kilda Pier offers stunning panoramic views of the bay and is a great spot to catch a magical sunset. Around the area, you’ll find plenty of cafés, restaurants, and ice cream shops, making it the perfect place to grab a snack or drink after a stroll. The lively vibe, paired with the peaceful sound of the waves, makes it a wonderful escape from the city bustle while still being just a short tram ride from Melbourne’s CBD.

Whether you want to relax on the sand, take in the scenic views, or explore the vibrant nearby attractions, St Kilda Beach offers the perfect mix of natural beauty and coastal charm. 🌊☀️

locations.title: Nomads St Kilda

showerReviews.reviewText:
Party hostel, if you’re looking to rest, go elsewhere

I’ll start with the pros and what this hostel does great:

1. The staff are amazing! Super friendly, always happy to help, join in activities and just generally good vibe. Shoutout to Pepe and Luke!
2. It’s a party/social hostel which makes it very easy to make friends and socialise. But beware that 90% of people coming here are British so if you’re from the UK and want to stay away from Brits, tough luck 😂 otherwise the activities are super fun, there is something on every day and the alcohol is MUCH cheaper than going out (especially if you catch happy hour)
2.1. Free breakfast, fresh pancakes are dope! Maybe not every day, but when you really can’t be asked with cooking and just want something for the hangover, pancakes are a lifesaver!
3. The app!!! They use an app (called Goki) and if you stay here, you can basically get through all the doors without having to carry an annoying wristband or card that is easy to leave behind. I’d recommend memorising the codes anyways, but saves you time with punching in the codes if you just use the app

Now the cons:
1. As I said, it’s a party hostel. I wouldn’t recommend staying for longer than a week unless you’re into that much partying (to each their own). But after 7 days you’ve seen all the socials, and you can always come back and join in even if you stay in a different hostel. Be prepared for people to come in at all hours of the night, usually drunk, or with someone else, so an eye mask and very good ear plugs/noise cancelling headphones are recommended
2. Which is not really a big issue but found it quite strange - during the events there is sometimes a queue outside and even if you live here you have to queue or ‘prove’ that you live in the hostel and argue with the bouncers (who are not the friendliest I found, especially late at night)
3. And this is the biggest issue - the facilities!!!
The rooms are just terrible, and I’m not talking about the cleanliness, it’s how they’re set up. I stayed in a 6 bed room and these were double beds that have no curtains (therefore 0 privacy), no shelves or plugs on the top bunks (so if and when your alarm goes off you have to jump off the bed before it wakes everyone else up) and the whole bed is extremely flimsy, basically ready to fall apart. The structural integrity of the beds is very questionable, I stayed in the top bunk and every time I climbed on the stairs I felt this is the moment the bed falls over.

The showers are not much better either, very outdated, water going everywhere and if anyone wants to use it after you they basically have to swim in. There is also only one shower/toilet per room so if you’re in a bigger room and don’t get in first, tough luck.

And the lockers are tiny and look like they are from WW2. These are hostels for backpackers but you will really be able to put only your valueables and few other things in there. And be prepared the the metallic clinging will wake everyone up whenever you open/close them.

Finally the kitchen is just run down. Very outdated, you can see everything has been used for years and hasn’t been replaced and can fit max 8 people at once in there.

Don’t get me wrong, the rooms were cleaned every day as well as the common rooms, they just feel very outdated compared to other hostels that charge similar prices.

At the end with Nomads you pay for the social events and the premium location at St Kilda, and you get amazing staff who will accommodate you, and if that’s what you’re looking for, this is the place for you! 😊
showerReviews.author: Zoltan Kalmar

showerReviews.author: Amandine Béchet

locations.title: Summer House Melbourne

showerReviews.reviewText:
3/5 - Mixed but mostly positive. Great staff and location, facilities and info could be improved.

We had a mostly positive stay at Summer House—way way better than our experience at the ancient Sydney one. There’s a lift, plenty of space in the corridors and rooms and it’s more modern throughout. The staff are a credit to the brand, and went above and beyond to help us with anything we needed.

That being said, it’s a youth hostel and you get what you pay for. We’re in our early thirties now so maybe we’re less tolerant of the inconveniences that come with staying at places like these. For example, the kitchen gets very busy, and again there was no room to store our groceries properly (fridge or non-fridge)—everything had to be stuffed in.

There is a bathroom (toilet and shower) in every room. Good at first. But of course, at 2am a roommate decided to take (no joke) half an hour to take a shower. There’s no other toilets accessible in the building except on the rooftop floor, closed at night. If there was just one available for cases like this, that would be good, but tricky to implement.

A much easier fix I’d recommend to management is to clearly list accessibility information on the website and provide a seat or two at reception. My partner injured her knees and struggled to use stairs or stand for long periods of time. These small things would have made the world of difference in our case.
showerReviews.author: Philip Demir

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
The hostel has a really welcoming atmosphere at first glance, and the location is actually quite convenient — close to shops, public transport, and a few nice cafés. The common areas also make it pretty easy to meet new people, especially in the evenings.

However, there are several issues that really affected our stay. The lockers in the rooms are far too small, so it’s impossible to store all your belongings properly. We placed some of our things neatly in bags on the side of the room, but the staff pushed them under the beds in a careless way, even with their feet. That felt very disrespectful. The kitchen is small, constantly crowded, and often dirty. On top of that, we had a balcony attached to our room but weren’t even allowed to use it, which was extremely disappointing.

Still, I want to mention that the reception staff were genuinely friendly and always tried to help whenever they could. The social vibe is great if you want to meet other travelers, and the common events in the evenings were fun and well-organized. With a few improvements, this hostel could actually become a much better place to stay.
showerReviews.author: Emil Ganzleben

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
Accommodation, facilities and cleanliness were great. It’s a shame that the customer service by the reception team, specifically Marie, DOES NOT match the good experience that a guest can have.
After booking for one night and experiencing the facilities I wanted to extend my stay for another week and even longer after that. I was already staying for one night, instead of working together to ensure I could stay. I was only hit with policy. My request was not outrageous. I wanted to reserve for a week. Pay a deposit and pay the full amount the next day. But THIS WAS NOT POSSIBLE according to Marie.
Instead. I ended up booking elsewhere for a week.
I don’t think that a business would be happy knowing that not only a guest spent their money elsewhere but they have also lost future business.
WIFI kept dropping and was very slow. Hot water in the showers was more like a warm to cold shower which was quite unpleasant in the morning.
showerReviews.author: Diego Pappalardo

locations.title: Roamer St Kilda

showerReviews.reviewText: First off it was great to be upgraded when we arrived to have a private bathroom. We were very chuffed about that! Sadly there were not lifts so it was hard to carry all our month long luggage up to the top flight. The receptionists were friendly and helpful. We did not feel safe in Melbourne though, especially in this area. Lots of questionable people and I did not want to be alone. Room had hair on the floor but otherwise room was nice and we were glad to have towels! It was quiet at nighttime but lots to do if you’re fancying an event! Sadly would not return as did not like Melbourne and did not feel safe.
showerReviews.author: Asha Sutton
