showerReviews.author: Trip.com Member

showerReviews.reviewText: Nice room, however toilets kept blocking up every couple days and the showers could be a bit cleaner. There was one shower on our floor and 2 toilets which didn’t seem like enough. The vibe of the place is nice and the people
showerReviews.author: Trip.com Member

showerReviews.reviewText:
Chill and friendly vibe here, just what you need after a long day of travelling. Nice bar, friendly staff which makes a huge difference, pool table, books. Cocktails, good cider on tap, and raffles, what more do you want?!
Secure entry and exit at the main door is good esp considering location.
Love that they've kept a lot of the original building architecture design. I don't understand why people complain that there isn't a lift for a two storey building! Or, why they'd expect there to be.
The clean, fresh, and tidy double room was ideal. Tiny shared bathroom with one toilet and shower - all clean! Cos it's very small, more hooks would be useful for changing clothes and toiletries because there aren't any surfaces to put your stuff down.  Downstairs G floor unisex shared shower pretty pitiful. Showerhead leaks - probably just needs a new washer or shower head? Floppy shower head which don't help. Nowhere dry to put your stuff as flow pooled with water, one tiny hook on the back of the door, and a cold tap handle which comes off every time you touch it - so watch out for yer feet. Overall a bit minging. Dorm beds good, clean, light and power cables in each bunk -and a like light curtain across each bed which makes a difference from everyone putting up towels for privacy years ago :D

Barista on-site pours great coffee and has good chat.
Bar closes at 11pm which is fine but would be useful to know when you check-in.
Didn't see any kitchen or similar room for water, making tea or a snack which is something I've always used at a backpackers. Fortunately I had an esky & ice with my backpack because I'd been camping, usually I put my chilled stuff in a fridge in a communal kitchen when travelling.
The only reason I give 4 stars and not 5 stars for the room is because the price changes dramatically, sometimes over $100 for a small double room to nearly $200. Pretty unexpected for a backpackers imho.   The same with dorm bed prices changing and not being static - why would a backpacker want or expect to spend up to $79 on a single bed in a shared room? The changeable and sometimes really high pricing takes away the inherent freedom of traditional backpacking for me.
Doing a different type of trip where I might plan a couple of days here or there interstate and want a budget motel on the road, I can expect $100ish+ for an Aussie motel room with private bathroom; For a city suburb like across metro Melbourne perhaps a night at a Quest incl Queen bed and private bathroom is getting closer to $160-200 (and above, the nicer you go) and although those prices fluctuate they don't change by 50-100% like they do at Roamer, and they're not a hostel/backpackers.
For a backpackers in a major city, (and having backpacked on and off for 20 years) I think charging anything like $100-199 per night for a small room and tiny shared bathroom is unreal, let alone suggesting $60-80 to share a dorm per night!  That said, Roamer is friendly, KIND  (which is something you really appreciate when travelling), it's clean, bright, cool interior design, great location, so if you get a good price it's an unmissable place to stay. Larger backpackers are also friendly, but Roamer St Kilda has something special.
showerReviews.author: J R

locations.title: Ritz Backpackers

showerReviews.reviewText: I had the opportunity to live at the hostel for two months, and it was a great experience! The comfortable beds have curtains, power outlets, and their own lights; the spacious kitchen is well-equipped; the bathrooms have enough showers and toilets so you don't have to wait long; and the friendly staff takes care of keeping the place clean and tidy. But for me, the best thing was that, being a rather unsociable person, I mostly didn't feel pressured to interact unless it was out of my own motivation. I feel that, in general, there is a non-judgmental and respectful environment, where everyone has space to be themselves without being made to feel uncomfortable or having to end up locking themselves in their room. I feel very grateful to the hostel, the staff, and the guests <3
showerReviews.author: Carolina Peters

locations.title: Bayside House

showerReviews.reviewText: This place is good if you are on a budget. The room was clean on arrival. The place is centred right outside of tram stops so you have easy access to both the city and St.Kilda. Unfortunately I won’t be going up in my overall rating as one day I left my room to go to the city and venture around Victoria. Only that when I returned to my accommodation, my room’s door was left completely wide open meaning that any other resident could walk in and grab my stuff from my suitcase. Now this could have been to clean the room or whatever but I just didn’t appreciate the door being open. Fortunately I am blessed and highly favoured and that nothing was stolen and all my more important items were on me in my backpack. It just wasn’t a great look in my opinion. Other than that the bathroom doors, shower doors and some of the toilet seats were broken, or loose.
showerReviews.author: Pickle Jayden Sabell

showerReviews.reviewText:
“A Masterclass in Hospitality – A Hidden Gem That Puts Luxury Hotels to Shame”

If the Ritz is the high-gloss cover of a magazine, this hostel is the heartfelt, handwritten letter tucked inside – raw, real, and unforgettable.

From the moment I walked in, I felt like I'd arrived home. The staff? Absolute legends. No robotic greetings or forced smiles – just genuine warmth, quick wit, and a level of care you can’t fake. Whether it was helping me plan my day, sharing a beer and a laugh in the common area, or remembering my name and story after one conversation – these people get it.

The place is spotless, effortlessly cool, and buzzing with the kind of energy that brings people together. Beds are comfy, showers are hot, and there’s an unspoken magic that happens when backpackers and locals share stories under fairy lights until the early hours. Community doesn’t just happen here – it’s cultivated.

Forget overpriced room service and gold-plated nonsense – this hostel offers something no five-star hotel can: soul.

Stay here once and you’ll understand. You won’t just leave with memories – you’ll leave with family.
showerReviews.author: zac abbott

Kitchen and shared toilets was dirty at time of arrival, however, it was cleaned up the next day. Presume guest dont adhere to the guidelines and rules of utilizing common areas, particularly toilets. Guest do not know how to use toilet papers, floor is wet at all times, kitchen utensils used were not washed.  Attitude issues of Guest from some countries has an implication to the living environment. At bayside house, basic shared facilities  available for travellers, trams station within walking distance.

locations.title: 50 Green St

showerReviews.reviewText: A bedside table with a lamp or a hook to hang up your towel would have been the super plus, but the staff was always really friendly and helpful, the kitchen was always clean, the house itself has a charming character and the general atmosphere there was welcoming and friendly. Closely located to Chapel Street -yay, walking distance, even in sight from my cute little balcony- meant that it took me a night or two to get used to roaring car engines, squealing tyres and simply people partying through the night. So bring your earplugs or ask for a room at the back- and you can have a great time for a reasonable price!

locations.title: The Salvation Army Crisis Services

showerReviews.reviewText:
Waited on hold for 30 minutes, which was nothing compared to how long I was thinking we would’ve had to wait.
Lovely girl answered the phone and my partner and I were in desperate need of a nights rest/ shower. Luckily she was able to provide us with a one time only 2 day accommodation for a motel where we could shower and sleep.
Thank you guys, I was hesitant to call at first but you’ve made this already stressful period a little less difficult .

locations.title: Clarke Shields Pavilion
locations.address: South Melbourne District Sports Club, St Kilda VIC 3182

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Clark Shields Pavilion which adjoins with the David Mandie Pavilion, at Albert Park, with the Gary Smorgan Oval (Oval 9) on one side and the Lindsay Hassett Oval  (Oval 11) on the other, is located at Aughtie Drive directly opposite Fraser St Light Rail stop. The pavilion was named after Clarke Shields, a former South Melbourne District Football Club player.

On the ground floor the Pavilion has both Home and Away change rooms each with showers and toilets (4 change-rooms including juniors’ and women’s facilities), male and female public toilets, disabled access and amenities, and a kitchen/kiosk with store room. On the first floor there are umpires and coaches rooms, a committee room,  a club room/social area, a meeting room, Education and Training area, toilets and kitchen. The Pavilion is fitted with a solar hot water panel roof.

There is only limited parking at the pavilion itself and while roadside parking is available, it can be difficult to find a spot during busy times when events are also taking place at the other adjacent sports grounds. You also need to be aware that parking fees apply to all marked bays and roadside parking throughout Albert Park. While all profits raised from parking are put back into Albert Park, which is a good thing, another option might be to park along Canterbury Road opposite Fraser Street, which is only a few minutes away, and walk across the Light Rail.

The Clark Shields Pavilion is the home of the South Melbourne District Sports club which offers a wide range of sports throughout the year to suit all ages from kinder to seniors, including Milo in2Circket for girls and boys aged 5 to 8, AFL Auskick for children aged 5 to 12, Junior Cricket, Junior Football, Women's and Men's Football, Little Athletics and Senior Athletics.
showerReviews.author: Adam G

You also need to be aware that parking fees apply to all marked bays and roadside parking throughout Albert Park. While all profits raised from parking are put back into Albert Park, which is a good thing, another option might be to park along Canterbury Road opposite Fraser Street, which is only a few minutes away, and walk across the Light Rail.

The Clark Shields Pavilion is the home of the South Melbourne District Sports club which offers a wide range of sports throughout the year to suit all ages from kinder to seniors, including Milo in2Circket for girls and boys aged 5 to 8, AFL Auskick for children aged 5 to 12, Junior Cricket, Junior Football, Women's and Men's Football, Little Athletics and Senior Athletics.
showerReviews.author: Adam G

locations.content: Clarke Shields Pavilion is a verified shower facility in South Melbourne District Sports Club, Victoria. User reviews confirm shower facilities are available. Contact the venue for current pricing and access information.

locations.title: Stand Up Paddle HQ- St Kilda

showerReviews.reviewText:
If you haven't as yet tried Stand Up Paddle boarding (also know as SUP or Supping) then you must and there's no better place to try it out than at St Kilda beach. Stand Up Paddle Boarding HQ operate there right on Pier Road, in front of the Royal Melbourne Yacht Club, so you can hire a board and all the equipment you need, and paddle away.

You can also have group or private lessons if need be. Stand Up Paddle Boarding HQ operate their SUP school there and they are skilled and passionate about supping and they will help you learn the correct technique and master the sport.

Not only is this sport great for general and core fitness (great for strengthening your core back) through strength and balance exercise, at the same time you'll have lot of fun in the water. Paddling among the beautiful yachts and the sea life, even with penguins visible swimming underneath your paddle board is a lot of fun.

Highly recommend.
showerReviews.author: Adam G

locations.title: Goodlife Health Clubs South Melbourne

showerReviews.reviewText:
I signed up to good life in June/July this year and have just cancelled my membership as of today - I’m not one to write reviews but I feel it would be good for people to hear my experience before signing up to a year long contract etc.

The gym is horrendously busy at peak hours be that before or after work hours and every machine is in use at some point. I failed to get an entire workout in the whole time I was there because I didn’t fancy waiting an extra 30 mins to be able to get my lifts in. I also have a problem with the culture there - I rarely saw anyone wipe down equipment after use and barely anyone used a towel.  I thought it was maybe just a Melbourne thing but I have since moved to another gym and it is no where near as busy, they have a no towel no train policy and everyone wipes down equipment!

The staff are lovely, but I think the gym has massive issues as a whole - and have now been slapped with a 245 dollar cancellation fee. Probably my own fault for not shopping around but this place has some serious issues.
showerReviews.author: Harry Miller

locations.title: Anytime Fitness South Melbourne
locations.address: Ground Floor/105 York St, South Melbourne VIC 3205

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym floor is amazing, great space, clean, tidy and well equipped.

The bathroom arrangement however, is a huge fail. In the shower, aside from the shower itself, there's nothing else. No sink, no tap, no mirror, no bench, meaning you out your bags on the often wet and soiled floor. Getting changed is a challenge as there's no bench to sit when you change your shoes.

This is the same with all the change rooms, no bench, no tap / sink and no mirror. The only user friendly bathroom is the accessible bathroom, where there's toilet, sink, tap and mirror, meaning you dont have to jump from one room to another to get ready for work. You'd still have to leave your bags on the wet and soiled floor though. Ventilation is non existence in all bathrooms, and toilets, meaning all walls and floor is wet with condensation after each use.

There is also no where for anyone to put their clothes. Unlike the old gym, there's a clothes rack. The bathroom arrangements in the old gym is great, where there's a toilet, sink / tap, mirror and bench.

This is such a shame because everything else is great, as a new gym should be.
showerReviews.author: Kit Chun

locations.title: Rare Breed: Boxing South Melbourne

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently had a fantastic experience at Halo Gym, and I couldn't wait to share my thoughts! The moment I stepped in, I was impressed by the clean and welcoming environment. The cleanliness was particularly noteworthy; And the cafe is a game-changer: After an intense session, I was able to refuel with a nutritious protein snacks right on the premises. It's a thoughtful addition that adds a layer of convenience to the overall gym experience.

Now, let's talk machines. Halo Gym boasts a comprehensive range of equipment that catered to all my fitness needs. Whether you're into cardio, strength training, or a mix of both, they've got you covered. I appreciated the variety, and the machines were well-maintained, making my workout sessions smooth and efficient. One thing that stood out to me was the fantastic lighting throughout the gym. Natural light streamed in, creating an energizing atmosphere. It made a significant difference, especially during my photo shoot.

The gym was buzzing with activity, and I loved the vibrant atmosphere. It's motivating to be surrounded by like-minded individuals all working towards their fitness goals. And let's not forget about the pricing – it's a sweet deal. Considering the clean environment, diverse equipment, convenient amenities, and the bustling community, the membership fees are more than reasonable. It's refreshing to find a gym that offers so much without breaking the bank.

In conclusion, Halo Gym exceeded my expectations. It's not just a place to work out; it's an experience. The attention to cleanliness, variety of equipment, thoughtful amenities, excellent lighting, and a lively community make it a top-notch choice for anyone serious about their fitness journey. I'm definitely making this my go-to gym – and maybe the backdrop for my next fitness photoshoot!
showerReviews.author: Yilin Wu

locations.title: Snap Fitness 24/7 Southbank

showerReviews.reviewText:
Equipment seems a bit dusty and a bit old but at the time of me visiting all equipment was working perfectly fine 5/5

Location is perfect if you work in the CBD or around the area. Short stroll to public transport 5/5

The area is very very small. The stretching area here is enough for probably just one person. No area for skipping, no space for even walking lunges. I suggest coming here only for cardio and other machines 3/5

Again because of the size of the gym, with just 5 people in it, it felt crowded to me. Clean floor though. Note that there is only 1 unisex toilet here, also clean at the time of me visiting 3/5

There are no lockers here whatsoever, even if you come with your own lock, there is nowhere to leave your stuff safely here 0/5

Climate control is the biggest problem here for me. It is very very humid inside making it difficult to exercise. I'm not sure whether it's the aircon settings or just the humidity from the 3 showers 1/5

To me the music sounded too loud. These days people either come to the gym to socialise, exercise quietly with no noise or music, or exercise with their headphones on. I had to turn the volume in my headphones higher than usual. 3/5

I visited after hours so can't comment on the team and the vibe here

GREAT facilities. The toilets and showers are clean, accessible, and not over flowing with water on the ground. Very tidy. And serviced daily.

Lots of bird life!
The lots are plenty big enough for all kinds of caravans.
Very nice staff.

Very happy with my 2 nights.

Thankyou for making our stay enjoyable 😊

showerReviews.reviewText:
Upon arrival manager stated that amenities were old but clean. Clearly his idea of clean is not the same as ours. The amenities have been vandalised and never fixed. I gingerly found the cleanest of the toilets and pulled on a roll of toilet paper and insect, dirt and leaf debris fell from the roll holder. The showers ( when you found one with a shower head intact) had mosquitos , cockroaches and other insect both dead and alive over the walls and floor not to mention the litter from tampon wrappers snd paper towel and toilets not cleaned at all. I’ve never found even a free campsite this dirty.
We spoke to manager and he said he cleaned them last week and he can’t believe it and that someone must be coming in at night and making a mess. Do not stay here, they refused to refund our money and we will be reporting them to the department of health.
showerReviews.author: Kylie Bailey

showerReviews.reviewText:
This would have to be the overall worst caravan park
The amenities are absolutely disgusting. Toilets are never cleaned. Urine on the floor, toilet bowls are dirty,  no female bins, showers are revolting. If you go into the toilets at night or early in the morning the lights are on timer and by the time you sit on toilet or even get ready for the a shower the lights will go off. Very unsafe.
Laundry is pretty much the same as the toilets.
DO NOT STAY HERE

locations.title: Milano Serviced Apartments

showerReviews.reviewText:
Milano Serviced Apartments. Comfortable stay in nice part of town. The room was very clean and presentable and the facilities were just as listed. A couple of repairs have obviously been overlooked, not sure if cleaning staff are supposed to report. Didn't have time to try out all the amenities - gym, sauna, pool. Super quick and efficient elevators (×3).
Front staff could do with some customer service lessons, especially on the topics of a welcoming greeting 🤗 and actually looking 👀 at guests when they are checking in.
Booked at last minute so got a good deal on room 🤑 Don't think it would be worth paying full price that is usually charged.
Overall, a recommended short stay in the heart 💗 of Melbourne.
showerReviews.author: Bella Jane Rose

locations.title: The Mansion Melbourne

showerReviews.reviewText:
I was proper disappointed arriving here. Nothing like pictured on booking.com. Four showers and toilets for a whole floor which were ALWAYS dirty. Only one person of the staff was actually nice, the other ones barely nodded when greeted. Seems like a whole bunch of people are just living there, including one member of staff who seemed rather touchy with multiple male guests. Weird vibes overall. Our room was also wayyyyy too small. We paid for a private room for two, but honestly there was no space to even put our suitcase properly. I wasn't expecting a 5star hotel but this really is not the spot for anyone other then backpackers.
Also the fridge system? You get 4 small bags with tags and then you can just put it  wherever, and still people will take stuff out of there unfortunately.
Perfect location for us, as it was close to city center to explore and MCG where we had to be two days.
Would not recommend.
showerReviews.author: Annelore Coppens

locations.title: Dandenong Oasis

showerReviews.reviewText:
My family has been visiting Dandenong Oasis for several years now. It's a nice little pool complex, that includes a small heated spa, hydro pool, sauna & shallow kiddie pool. Everything that you're looking for in a local, well maintained swimming pool. Only the hydro pool offers wheelchair accessibility (via portable hoist), which is unfortunate (but better than nothing). Group exercise classes are also available.

I'm sad to say though that despite the good array of swimming and wellness facilities offered by this complex, the customer service is absolutely appalling. If you're unlucky enough to be overcharged by one of the ever-rotating casual junior staff members at the front desk who frequently make mistakes at your expense, or if you can't get into an Aqua Fun/Fit class because they've been overbooked (which you have paid extra for in advance, mind you) - good luck getting any help. It's not possible to actually get your money back via refund (Oasis policy - yes, really), and although the promise of swim credits apparently exists for overcharges, they're harder to get your hands on than a rainbow coloured unicorn farting coffee scented fairy dust.

The junior cashiers (who are the only point of call at the pool if you run into a problem) will generally lead you down a maze of misinformation, until one of them will eventually advise you to get in touch with the elusive customer service manager, Simone, via email. You follow this advice, and if you're lucky, Simone might respond to your email within 2-3 weeks (or maybe not at all, if she doesn't feel that way inclined), to let you know that she won't help you. If you then decide to go back to the pool to speak to Simone face-to-face about your problem, the junior at the cash register will first pretend to not know who Simone is, and after eventually kindly remembering, will not be able to tell you whether she is in the building or not. They will also not be able to check if she is present or not. You will most unfortunately be directed back to your computer, and asked to send her an email (which may or may not be responded to).

It sounds comical and somewhat exaggerated, but I'm sorry to say that it's not. It's a great little pool as far as infrastructure goes, but heaven help you if you need assistance in any way, from anyone. Know your prices before going in there, because the staff don't.

Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year.
showerReviews.author: StoryZone

locations.title: South East Leisure

showerReviews.reviewText:
The building is old and needs to be demolished and a new aquatic centre built for residence of Dandenong.
The family change area is the most unhygienic public space I have seen.
The door frames around the toilet & shower are covered in rust. There is tiles missing and the grot has stained the grout , tiling and floors.
There is a trolley bed blocking the entrance into the end shower cubicles which is old and looks very unsafe for use by disabled as I presume that's the purpose of it been placed in this area.
It's a safety hazard and very dangerous to other people using this area.
The smell is harendous even the bleach can't  mask the foul stench.
This is very unhygienic and the fact the spa has a sign stating 'NO SPITTING' says enough in itself.
The gym area is not wheelchair accessible as there is stairs up to it.
The downstairs 'circuit room' was advised to be disabled accessible in place of the main gym been not accessible.
However 'the circuit room' has outdated equipment which is not suitable for disabled people (I'm disabled so can verify this) The equipment in this room needs to be updated as the weights weren't a complete set, the pully set was well worn and difficult to use. It was in diar need of maintenance.
The fees to use the facility are over priced. I paid $19 as a casual guest for the use of the hydro pool & gym. I could not access the gym and the 'circuit room' did not have accessible equipment I could use.
I felt exposed & unsafe In the family change area as the door was rusted and wouldn't close securely for me to get undressed privately without a passer by seeing in if they looked.  The smell turned my stomach and made me feel nauseated so I didn't get changed to even access the hydro pool.
The overall experience of visiting Oasis was eye opening and I strongly warn people to reconsider using this facility especially other disabled people.
Dandeong needs a new aquatic centre and council need to condem the Oasis before someone is injured from using unsafe gym equipment or get sick from the very poor hygiene conditions here.
The neglected and debilitated state of the facilty leaves great concern for the welfare of those who use it.
showerReviews.author: julie kent

showerReviews.reviewText:
I go here twice a week for hydrotherapy.
I have been doing this on and off for over 6 years.
Most staff are friendly. But the ones that are not are just plain rude.
Unfortunately, theft and vandalising at this place place is over the top.
Seems on a weekly basis that the disabled toilets near the hydrotherapy pool were having the handheld shower heads either stolen or torn off the walls.
I'm not sure how they can stop that behaviour, but they need to.
Recently, they did an upgrade to the showers in the disabled showers and and they're so much better.
Thank you

locations.title: Noble Park Aquatic Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
This review is about the pool only. I’ve been coming here for two years now and been having a steadily good but not great experience.
The place has an indoor heated shallow pool and an outdoor 50 m lap pool with shade covering about the half of the pool. The water quality is average, cleanliness could be better but still acceptable.
I usually come here to swim on weekdays around midday and always have a lane to myself. Except for summer months when it’s really crowded.
The change room is spacious with enough cubicles. The water pressure in the shower is an issue along with hot water. If you let the water to stop running you’ll have to start again with cold water. Cleanliness in the change rooms could use some attention, especially the hair all over the floor. Maybe if there were bins in the change room, possibly where people dry their hair, and not only on the corridor, this could be resolved.
Overall the pool is still a lot better than many others in the southern suburbs.
showerReviews.author: Aniko K.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This review is about the pool only. I’ve been coming here for two years now and been having a steadily good but not great experience.
The place has an indoor heated shallow pool and an outdoor 50 m lap pool with shade covering about the half of the pool. The water quality is average, cleanliness could be better but still acceptable.
I usually come here to swim on weekdays around midday and always have a lane to myself. Except for summer months when it’s really crowded.
The change room is spacious with enough cubicles. The water pressure in the shower is an issue along with hot water. If you let the water to stop running you’ll have to start again with cold water. Cleanliness in the change rooms could use some attention, especially the hair all over the floor. Maybe if there were bins in the change room, possibly where people dry their hair, and not only on the corridor, this could be resolved.
Overall the pool is still a lot better than many others in the southern suburbs.
showerReviews.author: Aniko K.

showerReviews.reviewText: Noble Park Aquatic Centre has become my regular swimming pool. There is a beautiful outdoor heated 50m swimming pool. On some occasions when I visit, there is squad, private swimming lessons, and private scuba diving lessons. But I can always guarantee that there will be an available lane to swim in. For a $29.90 fortnightly membership, I can swim there whenever I please. The staff are always friendly and helpful, and the pool and ammenities are always clean and well-maintained. My only suggestion for improvement is to update the lockers so that members and visitors can store their belongings safely whilst enjoying the services at the aquatic centre. Thank you Noble Park Aquatic Centre.

locations.title: Splash's Swimming School - Dandenong

showerReviews.reviewText:
Ever since I moved my son from our local council-run swimming pool to Splash Dandenong, the difference has been incredible. He has not only excelled in his swimming but also matured, grown in confidence, and developed such a strong sense of self-belief.

This review is really a thank you to the dedicated, passionate, and genuinely caring team at Splash. Their love for their work shines through in everything they do — from teaching to customer service. You can tell they treat every child and parent like family, and that makes all the difference.

I want to personally thank a few standout staff members who have made our experience so special:

💦 Isabelle – A truly kind and passionate instructor. She goes above and beyond every week, clearly explaining progress and celebrating achievements. Her communication and care give parents so much confidence.

💦 Bec – The all-round superstar! Whether she’s on pool deck, at reception, or helping with customer service, she’s always smiling, professional, and knowledgeable. You can count on her for anything.

💦 Tey – My son’s first swimming teacher and an absolute gem. Tey’s professional, calm, and goal-focused approach helped my son progress quickly and enjoy every lesson.

💦 Kat – Always full of energy and confidence, Kat is fantastic at customer service and never hesitates to help. She’s professional, approachable, and consistently goes the extra mile.

To the whole Splash team, thank you for creating such a positive, family-friendly, and motivating environment. You’ve truly made a lasting impact on my son’s growth — both in the water and in life. The facilities are great and so is the atmosphere

Highly recommend Splash Dandenong to any parent who wants their child to thrive, not just swim. 🏊‍♂️💙
showerReviews.author: Ben Howden

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our teacher Mitch is fantastic!
After doing lessons for our toddler, we had the heart attack moment where he fell in the pool. We were only a meter away from him in the water but it took us a sec to get to him. During that time he had managed to turn himself on to his back floating with his head out of water, and was feeling for the edge of the pool. This alone makes the lessons worth it. He absolutely loves swimming lessons and is always eager to get in the water with Mitch. We can’t thank you enough!
showerReviews.author: Rebecca Zeeman

showerReviews.reviewText: My son who is 9 and has severe autism needed to learn to swim. Learning anything for Keean is almost impossible but Phil and the team at splash Danenong have always been supportive, patient and helped my son finally develop the fundamental skills with swimming. Even on his hard days where keean just struggled to participate they were always patient and supportive. I wouldnt take my son anywhere else. Thank you so much Phil for your endless patience and kindness. Im just so happy with the results and the journey.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had a 1 week stay here for work.
* I stayed in a 2 bdr family apartment at the end.
* The apartment was HUGE, the furnishings and decor were antique theme, really homely, unique and comfortable.
* The bed was really comfortable.
* The bathroom is a good size. Soap and shampoo is provided but you'll need to bring your own shampoo, conditioner, laundry detergent and body wash.
* The kitchen has a gas stove and oven. The cooking time for the oven is quite lengthy, but I'd say it would be due to the age. There is no dishwasher and pots were difficult to clean, so make sure you buy some steel wool.
* There is a washing machine but no dryer in the apartment.
* The room was serviced daily and communication with reception via text was prompt and helpful. Kept immaculately clean.
* No smart TV, so I used my laptop for streaming.
* A really beautiful and green town. Quiet and peaceful.
* The room was quite cold, but they is heating/cooling available via aircon.
Thank you for having me!
showerReviews.author: Shafia Jahan

locations.title: Dandenong Ranges National Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Dandenong Ranges are an absolute gem for locals and visitors alike. With a fantastic variety of well-established tracks, you can easily tailor your day to your energy levels. Whether you’re looking for a punishing, quick cardio workout on the 1000 Steps or a peaceful, long-distance trek through the towering Mountain Ash forests, this place has it all.
​The amenities are surprisingly plentiful, with clean picnic spots and cozy cafes nearby for that essential post-hike caffeine hit. It’s an easy choice for a weekend escape that feels worlds away from the city hustle. Highly recommended for nature lovers and fitness junkies!
showerReviews.author: Christopher Farmer

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stunning place to explore with some very challenging hills. Plenty of trails to explore and take many different routes to see lots of wildlife and some 500 year old trees. The views are amazing but can be challenging to get to.
Public amenities are limited, not many restaurants or water stops, and few picnic areas. Lots of parking in many different places though.
showerReviews.author: Tom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The site was the best site I visited over the past week staying at 4 sites that were scoring 4.5 and above. I do not understand how this site is now only 4.1, perhaps due to historical factors. But for sure, my stay was awesome, ensuite toilets well stocked with good amenities and the place was quiet and conducive for children. I was briefed to drive only at 5km/ hr for the kids safety.

The site was spacious, every parks were spaced away from each other and the entire place was quiet at the evening.

Maybe just one thing they need to work on is to extend the wifi signal to the farthest ends, that’s the only smallest gap

showerReviews.reviewText:
There is a reason this place is the cheapest in Perth! Managment is very poor. They have rooms for addicts and dv cases and one of them stole my property from the camp kitchen.
I have overheard the caretaker belittling other employees on several occasions. Caretaker threw out my towel while I was at the shop getting supplies.
Not yo mention you need a packed lunch and a watter bottle to get to the toilet block!
Take your own kitchen ware as the camp kitchen has nothing in it anymore.
Previous management had it fully stocked.
Take plenty of mossie repelent in spring and summer as there is  a drain and a small river  close by the mossies will take small children away lol.
Its  not actually in the swan valley!
But its close to a rough neighbourhood!
The only good thing about this place was the lovely ladies in reception!
Head to another park is my advice!😀👌
showerReviews.author: Dazza P

showerReviews.reviewText:
Have stayed here a couple of times with our van, lastly with a 2 bed cabin for family as well. Cabins are modern, spotless, spacious and well appointed.
2nd time we stayed we asked for a drive through site as some of the other standard sites are a bit tricky to get into with a caravan when it’s busy.
All in all a great location. Had no issues with thieving as others mention. Amenities spotless too and the radio a great touch. Will be back again a bit later in year

showerReviews.reviewText: We have just spent a fair amount of time staying at Discovery Park Perth Airport during a 14-month stint of caravan living whilst building a house. It was the perfect place to stay; we absolutely loved it. The park itself looks beautiful and the amenities are modern and clean. The staff, like Jenny, Sharon and Paul, are absolutely lovely, so warm, friendly and helpful. This is not always the case and certainly helps set this caravan park apart from others. We found our stay quiet and relaxing with everything we could want. It is perfect for those travelling with dogs. We cannot wait to return for another stay very soon. Highly recommended! Mel and Fred :)

locations.title: Discovery Parks - Coogee Beach

showerReviews.reviewText: I don't usually leave reviews but I feel I need to add some positive feedback. Some of those I read prior to our visit were very negative. James was most helpful in finding us a site for an extra night on arrival. He put us on a lovely large concrete slab, very welcome considering the rain we've had. He also came over & offered to securely store our bikes. While the amenities may be old, they're clean & have good hot showers. The location is great too, close to the beach, cafes & Fremantle. We have thoroughly enjoyed our stay here

locations.address: Perth Tourist Caravan Park, Unit 39/186 Hale Rd, Forrestfield WA 6058

showerReviews.reviewText:
Perfect location close to airport and other site seeing locations.
40 minutes on bus to city or quicker by train.
Staff are very helpful and friendly.
Shopping centre 1km down the road.
Catch the 270 or 280 bus to get there every 30 minutes.
Pool and games room with cinema over weekends for families.
There are a variety of cabin's and a lawn areas to pitch a tent.
Bathrooms and laundry close by.
Public Kitchen available with oven's.

Powered sites for your caravan  with your own amenities.

We enjoyed our stay and thank the staff for their support during our stay.
showerReviews.author: Mike Smissen

locations.title: Emerald Backpackers Hostel

showerReviews.reviewText: I was here 34 years ago. Joop the manager and son Marco lawnmowing. I stayed in an old caravan for 55 dollars a week. We had a great time, worked locally. Those days there were two showers/ toilets/laundry. It was simple, but that s ok when your simple yourself. A bit traveller doesn t whinge about not too much luxury. I revisited the place in 2012, because i m living permanent in Oz since 1996... Marco was Manager and Joop was still alive, he told me then. It was much bigger now. And he lived in a unit where in my time my caravan stood. I  was nice to see the change. I wish Marco good luck. He even remembered with which girl I came there...
showerReviews.author: Ar bleep

showerReviews.reviewText:
Everything is old, the whole Hostel would need a renovation. Only four bathrooms for 60-70 people is not enough! Some parts of the ceiling are mouldy, no opportunity to pay by card, kind of brave to have 150$ rent/week (or 100 if you're sleeping in your car or tent) around. The kitchen is also too small for so many people, parts of the equipment are old. Normally you get a job while winter very quickly, I don't know how it is in summer.
It is ridiculous that the only time the cleaned stuff is really clean is on weekends - when the two weekend managers, backpackers as well, tidy up.
The community area is good but also old and you can see the signs of using.
Free WiFi is good, but it doesn't always work (probably cause too many people are using it).
It could be a very nice place to be, but it definitly needs some more bathrooms/showers and renovations!
I would probably give 2,5 stars if possible, but as it isn't I decided for two as there are more bad than good points at the moment.
showerReviews.author: Yannick Anonym

locations.title: Cambrai Backpackers Hostel

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had a good experience at this hostel. Bec and Adam are always around and really caring about the backpackers and the atmosphere. There are always activities going on, both during the week and on weekends, which makes it super easy to meet people.
The kitchen is a bit small for the number of guests, but it’s manageable. During winter I got a bit cold because the heater sometimes broke or didn’t work when people left the doors open, but they always offered extra blankets or hot water bottles.
Overall, the place is quite clean, and there’s a supermarket and a gym very close by, which is super convenient
showerReviews.author: Delfina Elissalde

showerReviews.reviewText:
AVOID AT ALL COSTS! WORST EXPERINCE EVER!!
We booked two weeks in advance to ask for two female masseurs. When we arrived, the only masseurs available were two males. We started with a foot massage. My 'masseur' poured boiling hot water on my foot which resulted in a burn. When it came to the massage, rather than a massage, he proceeded to simply touch my feet? He either had no idea or couldn't care about the task he was given. When I asked him to increase the intensity, it didn't get much better. The massage was conducted in the rear of the property rather than in one of the private rooms.

locations.title: HOLISM RETREAT
locations.address: M Gallery Hotel Chadstone, 1341 Dandenong Rd, Malvern East VIC 3148

showerReviews.reviewText:
From the moment I walked into Holism spa I knew I was in for something special. The calming scent of essential oils, soft ambient music, and warm smiles at the front desk instantly made me feel relaxed.

I booked a 75 min massage with hot stone add on and my therapist Woody was exceptional. He took the time to ask about any problem areas and adjusted pressure throughout to ensure I was comfortable. His technique was both intuitive and skilled, melting away the knots in my shoulders and lower back without ever feeling rushed.

The treatment room was spotless, cozy, and thoughtfully designed with dim lighting, heated tables, and soft linens. I particularly appreciated the little touches—a warm towel under my neck at the end and herbal tea offered after the session.

Prices were reasonable for the quality, I left feeling lighter, more relaxed, and mentally recharged.

If you’re looking for a true sanctuary to unwind and reset, Holism is a must-visit. I’ll definitely be returning and trying more of the experiences and treatments this spa has to offer.
Highly recommend!
showerReviews.author: TouliP22

showerReviews.reviewText: Beautiful day spa experience. My wife and I arrived at 12.pm for our experience which started with a herbal tea then we changed and went to the rooftop pool for a sit in the hot spa the a relaxing lay in one of the cabanas around the pool. When it was time to return to the spa we caught the lift back to the spa level and had a quick shower before our treatments. We were booked into the Shala room which is very spacious and has 4 treatment table which is great for couples or friends to be treated together. The therapists were fantastic and got just the right pressure for our deep tissue massages. This was my wife’s 3rd visit and we both would recommend Holism for a great day spa experience!
showerReviews.author: Colin Ilsley

showerReviews.reviewText:
Rating: 3.5/5

Despite the positive reviews, this is a genuine review of our experience booking a 3 hour package.
Generally not a bad place but for the price and as it's marketed as a more up-market option than your general massage day spas (with prices reflective of this), we felt it didn't live up to the expectation.

-ves:
•The booking, use of gift vouchers, health fund process and welcoming all were clunky and required our follow-up.
•Being that the 1hr bathing part of the package is in the very busy hotel pool, you will find on more occasions than not that you will be sharing the pool with many noisy children. We stayed at the pool for 15 mins before returning to the lounge for quiet time.
•Although the massage and facial were good, they weren't uniquely memorable to warrant returning in my opinion.

+ves:
•All staff were polite and friendly.
•Massage went well and the therapist did read the pre-filled form.
•We didn't feel rushed and was offered ample time to get changed, shower, have a drink/tea etc.
•Appreciated the free locker provided for our belongings.

To elevate the experience, they could offer a small sweet/treat to have with the tea or drink after. This is quite standard for day spas in this price range. Fairly inexpensive but a thoughtful and memorable gesture to encourage a return visit.
showerReviews.author: D Yas

locations.title: Heritage Retreat and Day Spa
locations.address: 1 A St Andrews Ct, Chirnside Park VIC 3116

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed at Yarra lodge and my husband played golf at the heritage. I thought the spa would be a similar standard of service because it was recommended on their website and I was completely wrong.
I emailed them two weeks prior, explaining I was 30 weeks pregnant and wondering if there were any treatments I could have, like a facial, where I didn’t need to lie down on my back as I couldn’t because I was pregnant, so I thought I was quite clear and specific.
They responded saying yes and that their facials were safe for pregnancy. So I was reassured and booked a facial for me and a massage for my husband. (They’re not cheap either and I was so close to booking their more expensive packages, thank god I didn’t)
They charge extra for the “facilities” and they’re just not worth it (a pool, small gym and cold sauna), zero customer service as soon as we arrived. Usually when you go to a spa they explain what will happen, where you will go, give you a towel if you’re using the pool or sauna etc before, but we had to ask the man at reception for everything and it seemed like an effort and as if it wasn’t something that was usually provided. Their showers etc need a refresh too. We tried to enjoy the limited facilities and the swimming pool that was filled with kids as it seemed they host swimming lessons in the same relaxing spa area where they charge you extra each day to use them.

Then we get to the time our massage and facial are due and they put us in the same room though my facial lasts 30 minutes and my husbands massage is meant to be 45 and the beautician for me is no where to be seen.

I get told by my husbands masseuse to lie down flat on my back and then I explain my current situation and how I’d asked about treatments I could have that didn’t need me to lie down. She tells me there’s no other option and that my beautician will be 5 minutes and to lie down.
I opt for the chair in the room and sit down in hopes my beautician will have been the one who booked me in and have a different solution and thinking it could just be a language barrier.
15 minutes passes with no sign of my beautician and I collect my things and leave the room quietly to try and not disturb my husband.
I leave the room to see 2 males and a female who I think was meant to be my beautician speaking loudly/shouting in another language and the female crying.
I stand there awkwardly for another 10 minutes to discuss a refund and no one helps me.
Eventually one of the males who doesn’t appear to work there tries to help.
The beautician then crying but seeming annoyed asks me quite rudely if I want a facial now and goes to walk into the room with my husband there, which is annoying that someone having a treatment would keep getting disturbed too.
I’m not sure what’s happened but with the already atrocious service/treatment I explain no I want a refund. She then says sorry and walks off.
They carry on their conversation and I’m referred to another female who looks like she is related to the owner and is trying to help me but perhaps doesn’t actually work there.

I had to walk to different stations and tills and ask for a refund a number of times, and would really like to encourage people to stay away from this place.

The whole booking and service was poor even before the additional drama, but that just topped it off.

Don’t waste your time go to a winery or on a nice walk because they just don’t know what they’re doing unfortunately.
showerReviews.author: Danni Arthur

locations.title: Yawa Aquatic Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
Unfortunately not 5 stars.
My first swim not great when a senior staff member was rude when I tried to buy 10 visits by wanting my email and phone number.
When I refused and asked why I was abruptly told the system requires it and they are not there to argue. I said I'm not arguing im just asking a question.
Awkward !
Why would I trust my email and mobile number to go into that system and be safe ???
Yet paywave works fine for one swim.
With the pool surround
in sections is extremely sharp exposed agrigat,making walking barefoot an uncomfortable  experience.
Contractors should be called back to grind down to the correct code /texture,inspect and repair the cracks.
Take some notes from Hastings.
Staff poolside are fantastic  10/10.
Cleaners and actual cleaning  10/10.
Change rooms are small for the size of the establishment.
8 people and it's uncomfortable.
The lack of parking can be a nightmare.
Hastings by far is a much better set up re: change rooms, parking.
Both Yawa and Pelican actual  swimming pools are great though.
showerReviews.author: Russ Chaplin

locations.title: Rainbow Bay Swim School

showerReviews.reviewText: Brilliant customer service and swimming lesson experience! As a first time Mother, I researched swim schools to ensure my daughter would have the best experience with such an important skill to learn. I decided on Rainbow Bay Swim School, despite the 35 minute drive, due to the great reviews and now I understand why. The customer service I have received from the start is flawless and my daughter had an amazing first lesson with Liz. After waiting so long for the center to reopen and only to find they have made it less family friendly. I would have thought a council ran facility would have made smarter more inclusive discussions in the planning process.

showerReviews.reviewText:
As a new Mum with ADHD and Anxiety things can get
overwhelming very quickly. My toddler is a runner, and this can be triggering for me, especially when she is in areas that that can
pose extra safety risks like around pools where she can slip or
entry areas to places where she can run out to carparks. I worry
about her constantly in these environments. It’s exhausting.

My daughter has seizures of unknown cause so this is the icing on the cake at times as we don’t know when she will have one.
Going to Pelican Park Recreation Centre was a big adventure for
us, I looked up the visual story and access guide so I had a good
idea around what the venue looked like, where the doors were,
what the pool looked like and likely areas she might run and send
me into panic.

Being able to see all this before arriving to the venue halved my
anxiety because I had a visual already.
I let the staff at Pelican Park know via the Cérge app that I wanted to get my daughter into the family rooms quickly, and know where they were top get to and from the pool as easily as possible to avoid more opportunities for her to run, and be prepared in case of a seizure.

Being exposed to water and swimming is super
important for her…. And me!

Britt was excellent and showed me the family change/shower area where my daughter couldn’t escape which was a relief! So I could get changed without panicking I’d be chasing her half naked down the foyer. Haha

We had a fabulous time and without Cérge being there and being
able to express what I needed before arrival, well, we wouldn’t
have gone. Haha
Blunt, but true.

Thanks Cérge and thanks to Britt and her attentiveness and the
staff at Pelican park we will be back!!
showerReviews.author: Cérge Tech

locations.title: Core24 Mount Martha Health & Fitness Gym

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is without doubt the worst gym on the peninsula. The equipment is outdated and rarely, if ever, cleaned. The sauna constantly had an unpleasant smell and was never maintained properly I would see things like discarded plasters left on the floor for weeks. Despite repeatedly raising these issues with staff, nothing was ever done.

The changing room was filthy, and the so called renovations are an absolute joke. I’m genuinely glad I switched to Goodlife, where I’ve already noticed so many former Core24 members. Clearly, I’m not the only one who’s had enough. To top it off, I could never understand why both the staff and management carried themselves with such arrogance and rudeness.

locations.title: Mornington Hotel

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great Location and Comfort, but Be Aware of Maintenance and Odour Issues

The Mornington Hotel is well-located, making it easy to explore the surrounding area. The staff were friendly and helpful, creating a welcoming atmosphere throughout our stay. Our room was spacious and comfortable, with a newly renovated bathroom that felt clean and modern. The message bathtub was a pleasant surprise and added a nice touch of relaxation. It’s also worth noting that there’s a Pokey outlet within the hotel, which may appeal to some guests looking for entertainment options on-site.

There were a number of issues that took away from the overall experience. A strong sewage smell in the bathroom was difficult to ignore, and one of the tap levers was missing. We also found a bathroom accessory that had already been opened, which was concerning from a hygiene perspective. The wardrobe was missing a hanger, and a faulty light switch with poor contact made it inconvenient to use. Additionally, the corridor leading to the rooms had a strong smell of cigarette smoke, which lingered and affected the overall comfort. Addressing these issues would significantly improve the quality of the stay.
showerReviews.author: William Chung

showerReviews.reviewText:
A fantastic, well present sort of hotel/motel
We found the rooms very clean and tidy, the grounds and layout were really good.
The availability of the swimming pool, spa, and gym toped of the surrounding.
They had two Tesla car chargers available.

It seemed unusual that reception closed at 5.30pm.
So why the 4 star?
It's advertised as a hotel. I fully acknowledge that they also state that no restaurant is available at the hotel.
The rooms have a microwave, no pots pans or useful cooking utensils, just two sets of plates and cutlery.
While there was a coffee machine snd hot water jug, I think st the very hotel should be able to supply breakfast.

All that being said the staff were all friendly and the place was well kept and we would stay there again.
showerReviews.author: Keith Francis

showerReviews.reviewText:
Brooklands has potential, but honestly, the pool hours are a complete joke—and it’s enough to make me reconsider ever coming back.

Let’s get one thing straight: closing the pool at 8:00 PM is ridiculous. This is supposed to be a modern facility, yet it can’t manage to keep the pool open past early evening? People work full-time jobs, have families, responsibilities—and by the time we finally get a moment to ourselves, the pool is already shut. What’s the point of even offering it as an amenity if it’s basically inaccessible to anyone with a normal schedule?

It feels like the management hasn’t even considered how inconvenient this is. A 10:00 PM closing time should be the bare minimum. Other places understand this and accommodate their members—why can’t Brooklands? There’s nothing relaxing about rushing to squeeze in a quick swim before getting kicked out. And don’t even get me started on how crowded it gets during that tiny window of availability. It’s frustrating, unfair, and honestly, lazy planning.

It’s a shame because the rest of the facility isn’t bad. The gym is decent, the staff are nice, and the building is well-kept. But the pool issue completely overshadows the positives for me. I didn’t sign up to be on someone else’s schedule—I signed up to use the amenities I’m paying for.

Unless the pool hours are extended to something reasonable like 10 PM, I’ll be taking my business elsewhere—and I know I’m not the only one feeling this way.
showerReviews.author: Michael Chiselett

People work full-time jobs, have families, responsibilities—and by the time we finally get a moment to ourselves, the pool is already shut. What’s the point of even offering it as an amenity if it’s basically inaccessible to anyone with a normal schedule?

It feels like the management hasn’t even considered how inconvenient this is. A 10:00 PM closing time should be the bare minimum. Other places understand this and accommodate their members—why can’t Brooklands? There’s nothing relaxing about rushing to squeeze in a quick swim before getting kicked out. And don’t even get me started on how crowded it gets during that tiny window of availability. It’s frustrating, unfair, and honestly, lazy planning.

It’s a shame because the rest of the facility isn’t bad. The gym is decent, the staff are nice, and the building is well-kept. But the pool issue completely overshadows the positives for me. I didn’t sign up to be on someone else’s schedule—I signed up to use the amenities I’m paying for.

Unless the pool hours are extended to something reasonable like 10 PM, I’ll be taking my business elsewhere—and I know I’m not the only one feeling this way.
showerReviews.author: Michael Chiselett

locations.title: Somers Beach Holiday Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
Cannot understand how this place has such good reviews!

Our experience was disappointing and incredibly frustrating from the moment we arrived to check in.

Arrived tired after a 4 hour drive only to be told there was no record of our booking (despite us booking over the phone directly with them many weeks ago and receiving an email receipt confirming payment and the cabin number).

Needed to wait over half an hour while the caretaker got the cabin cleaned and beds made (raises some questions when one lot of guests leave a cabin and the place isn't automatically cleaned and ready to go in preparation for the next lot of guests...)

When we eventually got in to the cabin, there was an unpleasant musty cigarette-like smell in the air. Not overbearing but definitely noticable.

We were provided with 2 towels for 4 guests, one towel with a bloodstain on it. When I took the blood stained towel back to reception to ask for another one and for some additional towels for the other guests, the caretaker told me she had been washing some and kept "forgetting" to bring them across to us and would do that shortly. Over 1.5 hours later and still no towels. I called them up and again asked for fresh towels; eventually brought across over half an hour later, with a simple "here you go", no apology or acknowledgement whatsoever. One would think that if you have already inconvenienced your guests by losing their booking and then making them wait until you get it ready, you would try and redeem yourself by "remembering" to get them settled in and bring them some towels and would apologise for the inconveinienes.  At the very least.

Our frustrations only grew when we went to have a shower that night and realised there was no soap to use.

Also no milk supplied for the coffee and tea.

We are reasonable people. The lost record of our booking was likely human error and we all know mistakes happen. We would have easily put it down to a mistake and moved on, but when you consider being charged $230 a night and getting woeful customer service, dirty linen and lack of basics like soap and milk, I'm sure you can see why we're not impressed!

Perhaps the caretakers don't often receive guest holiday bookings so things get a bit chaotic for them when they do (looked to be quite a lot of permanent residences around the park - maybe they make up the majority).  Maybe the business has recently changed hands and is being run by new owners who are still finding their feet. Or maybe they actually just don't give a crap about their guests, which is definitely how it seemed to us.

The positives are that the accomodation is located in a nice quiet spot close to the beach and a short drive to Balnarring. Cabin was stocked with cutlery and plates,  had a ceiling fan in the main bedroom and split system in the living area - temperature was comfortable.
showerReviews.author: Ellie Cahill

showerReviews.reviewText: Rosebud Foreshore Camping 🏕️ is a pretty good camp ground. Staff is lovely, sites have reasonable sizes (you can check it online before you book), shores and toilets are clean and they offer free washing machines and dryer! The campground is very close to Rosebud's shops, walking distance. All the campgrounds down the peninsula have one disadvantage in common: they are all between the sea and the street. Even if your site is close to the sea, you will still hear the cars. But, at night, there are lesser cars. And: all the birds are pretty noisy too! I wished they had some unpowered tent sits closer to the sea, and not all right next to the street. If shops in walking distance doesn't matter for you, check out the campgrounds further down the peninsula, they seem to be a bit more in a natural environment and some have direkt sea view. Nevertheless, I would come back!
showerReviews.author: Tina Schmidt

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great little camp-site with a short walk to the beach. Facilities are limited and are getting old, but the staff do well to keep them clean. The big bins are emptied on Tuesdays and can get very full during peak times. Sites vary in size and the access roads can be tight. Some water taps on the map don't exist.
Edit: they have added a dump point near the toilet block and an outdoor shower on the beach access path. Toilets are closed for cleaning between 9:30 - 10:30am and 2:30 - 3:30pm.

First day and night was amazing.
Close to the beach, good site, good cafe near by, good showers...
Second night the smell of sulphur (rotten egg gas) coming from the Merricks creek running along side totally ruined everything.
This happened just as we were about to make dinner.
Smell went all night and into the next day making breathing it in very uncomfortable.
Southerly picked up and blew the smell north.
If they resolve the issue I will go back but the rotten egg gas smell is severe so take note.
Worst thing is, I googled and there is reports of this issue since 2015 and if I had known I would not of gone.
showerReviews.author: Neil odonnell

locations.title: Rye Foreshore West Campsite

showerReviews.reviewText:
West Rye Foreshore was surprisingly better than I thought. Depends on the site you're given, most have water and power, but ours only had power. Water was not too far away. We had no room to park our car either, so we had to park it on the street which wasn't an issue.  Easy access to the beach and amenities were in good condition and cleaned twice a day.

Downside*** road noise is bareable but can be super noisy early morning with trucks.
Some of the long term stayers are very moody, so make sure you adhere to the rules or they will complain to the park customer service staff.
Ie. Don't cross over onto their territory 😉

showerReviews.reviewText:
Don’t bother with this site if you’re in a tent:
you’re paying $50 to use a shower block and have the luxury of camping in a free for all carpark that isn’t managed. Ripoff campground.

1. $50 regardless of whether you’re a tent or a caravan. The park has chosen to maximise profit and so there were no unpowered sites to choose from despite our tent site being basically a small patch between two boat sheds and a fair walk from a powerbox we didnt need. Great way to incentivise any form of tourism outside vans and  the peak periods.
2. Heaven forbid you camp on a market weekend - we awoke to cars from market goers surrounding our tent and parking us in. We had to chase down market goers as they walked away from their car to explain that they were parked on camp sites.

3. Saw the ‘ranger’ drive around the site all through the above debacle, seemed unbothered by the fact his campground had just become a carpark. didn’t once check in with us or the parked cars. Didn’t even stop to chat during our dusk camp set up so i’m going to assume we could’ve avoided the $50 fee and he wouldn’t have cared. Shame.
4. No clear signs, i’ve been to free camp sites with better signage than the permanent marker written numbers scrawled on the power box.

It’s clear that the site is designed towards the summer peak season and caravan/campervans. Thats fine, but it is unacceptable to have your “peak season” rates extend for months, include weekdays and not provide cheaper “unpowered” options. There are those that just need a campsite for a tent in a council that otherwise chases away or fines car sleepers and carpark campers. Other councils have cheap or donation based camp options around parks, foreshore reserve, and sports centres. But the Peninsula council evidently can’t be bothered to do anything but half measures for maximum profit. Hey council if you wanna get in touch with me and justify the $50 I’d love to hear it. They must be expensive shower cleaners.
showerReviews.author: Lach

locations.title: Bay Park Scout Camp

showerReviews.reviewText:
I visited Bay Park Scout Camp in April 2024 when Melbourne Survivor booked it out to film the fifth season of their YouTube series. We had the camp from Friday through to Sunday, using the space to set up and film the game. Across the weekend, we had around 25–30 people coming and going to help organise everything, with most of our crew staying on site.

The accommodation included four rooms of bunk beds, with about four bunks per room (sleeping up to eight). The beds were typically hard, as you’d expect at camp, but we brought our own bedding to make them more comfortable as no bedding is provided just a mattress. The toilet and shower block at the end of the main building had lacklustre water pressure but at least stayed hot for quite a while.

The kitchen was a real highlight, large and well stocked with crockery, perfect for catering events or cooking up a feast. We catered for ourselves and stocked up supplies from the Woolworths just 15 minutes down the road. Adjoining the kitchen is a spacious mess hall with lino flooring, plus a large carpeted room we used for challenge equipment and a smaller office we turned into a data room to process footage. This setup worked brilliantly for us, especially with the multiple entrances and exits that helped with all the player and crew movements for the game. There’s also a cute courtyard at the front of the main building which was a lovely spot to hang out.

The lake next to the main building was great for water based challenges, although the water was quite murky (as you’d expect) and probably not the best for swimming. There’s so much to do on site, including an archery range, volleyball court, go-kart track, large stage, oval, and plenty of other areas that we made use of for challenges. The old machinery (including an old train) added a really cool vibe to the space. Each tribe was also able to light their own fires at designated fire pits and cook rice and lentils, just like in the show.

The owners and staff were lovely and accessible during the day at the small house near the entry. They keep the site in good condition, with plenty of activities available. Although the camp is mostly used by Scouts, it can be hired out when not in use. Being in Mount Martha, it’s a bit of a trek from Melbourne, but it’s a great spot to escape the city for a camp style weekend. The nearby town of Mount Martha is handy too, so you’re not far from civilisation if you need anything.

I really enjoyed filming here and loved the location, it truly helped us bring the game to life, and I can’t wait to see how it all comes together on the Melbourne Survivor YouTube channel. While a few areas of the main building could do with a bit of love and some upgrades, overall, the space was fantastic. I’d definitely recommend Bay Park Scout Camp to anyone looking to run outdoor activities with large groups, it’s a great place to book, and I hope more people take the chance to get out of the city and have a fun time at Mount Martha.
showerReviews.author: Ashlee Jayde

showerReviews.reviewText: First of I have to commend this park for sponsoring the kidney truck to which kidney patients can have dialysis while on holidays but I was not impressed with the accommodation that was surplied to be suitable for person in wheel chair we had to pay extra for a 3 room cabin because it had a ramp which was totally useless and inside the doorways would not allow a wheel chair through let alone a walker I had to go through side ways could not use the shower there was no hand rails no shower chair I had to get my wife to was me on the bed she had to get me of the toilet as well because there was no hand rails we had phoned ahead to make sure the cabin was suitable my wife end up damaging her knee so we had to leave 3 nights earlier to take her to doc and have extrays we ask for a refund but was told they don't do refunds just credit   so it wasn't an enjoyable stay and would not go back put a bad taste in my mouth arthur & maureen
showerReviews.author: Arthur mathews

locations.title: Coonawarra Units

showerReviews.reviewText:
The place has definitely seen better days. On the positive side the rooms were spacious and bed was clean and comfortable.
However, it was cold and not easy to heat, the windows were filthy, the ceilings full of cobwebs, the shower had not enough pressure to get shampoo out of your hair.
Breakfast was a joke (previously frozen plain white toast in a plastic bag), some stale biscuits, no place to sit, instant coffee and teabags...we had nothing (apart from the biscuit which was in original packaging but still managed to be stale). The fridge was mouldy inside etc etc
showerReviews.author: Daniela Sutcliffe

showerReviews.reviewText:
The basic breakfast was appreciated, but otherwise we wouldn't stay again.
The windows were filthy, spider webs throughout the ceiling.
No kettle in the room despite there being tea and coffee, no supplies to wash the dishes, and no daily housekeeping.

showerReviews.reviewText: We knew we were booking three star. And understand what that means...we are ok with a bit tired etc, having stayed here before. However, we will not be back. Our room was not clean or close to clean. Dirty dishes, scum on the shower, grubby carpet, filthy windows and dusty curtains. There wasn't even a teatowel in the room. Breakfast is provided in the 'breakfast room'. You go and collect your provisions. Good in theory but there was no bread or a tray to carry anything on. There are random items lying around the complex, torn flags, gardens a mess - it feels quite neglected. Maybe has been sold recently? Such a shame as we love the area....but no more visits from us.
showerReviews.author: Megan Stuart

showerReviews.reviewText: We knew we were booking three star. And understand what that means...we are ok with a bit tired etc, having stayed here before. However, we will not be back. showerReviews.reviewText:
I’ve stayed here three times in the past four years, and it’s clear that the business has changed hands recently.

The grounds are overgrown and not maintained, with grass creeping above your ankles. What was once a proud garden is a moribund and decrepit space.

The rooms are tired. We found grime in the sink and shower, and there isn’t even a space for the toilet paper; it just sits on top of the toilet itself. Windows filthy, spiderwebs everywhere, cold rooms. The breakfast option was simply packaged cereal, but without milk.

Seriously - stay elsewhere. This business is disgracefully neglected and embarrassing. They’re almost waiting for a Gordon Ramsay episode. Stay in Penola. Stay anywhere. This place is horrendous.
showerReviews.author: samuel steele

showerReviews.reviewText: I’ve been staying at this park for the past 4 years, and I must say, the transformation over the last two years under the direction of Matt and Ellie has been remarkable. They are incredibly friendly, attentive and always keep us informed of happenings and well planned activities in the area. The park is impeccably maintained, and the amenities are exceptionally clean, making it a truly enjoyable place to visit.
showerReviews.author: Maria Miranda

showerReviews.reviewText: I’ve been staying at this park for the past 4 years, and I must say, the transformation over the last two years under the direction of Matt and Ellie has been remarkable. showerReviews.reviewText: We bought a cabin 5 years ago and love it- love the cabin, love the park, the facilities and amenities it offers, the park management team and the people and family vibe it has. Importantly the management team, led by Ellie and Matt are the best the park has seen in a long time, and certainly the best in our 5 years. Nothing is too hard for them, always very responsive and lots of events organised for kids (and adults) during holiday periods. Location next to Aldi and the bakery and less than 1km to the Dromana shops and beach makes it more appealing. Love staying at the Peninsula Holiday Park.
showerReviews.author: Michael Dafnomilis

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had the pleasure of having to overstay and was looked after highly. We stayed for a month initially while the house getting finished built in the local area. We ended up a bit longer, the only place that accommodates dogs.

Is good, residents nice and generally all round cool place. Meet some awesome travellers.

Thanks for having us guys. Cute animals and great birds and wild life.

Hopefully, Captain Jacks that are recent does a unique ride down on a pushbike delivery to the park for life in residents.

Eggs were also on sale in the office.

Only negative, live in guys should have a work clothes washing machine separate for the oil and diesel/petrol stuff, had white tops wrecked.

And I think a female cleaners touch is needed or an update in the bathrooms. Wasn't dirty just different. Lol.
showerReviews.author: TWC TLC (ThaiTenille)

Price on website does not match actual price, we were charged an extra $18 for two days and one of those days there was no hot water as system had apparently burst a few days earlier. No offer of reduced price. Lots of potholes in park that are OK until it rains.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Spoke to Paul, booked over the phone, super friendly and helpful with a few queries we had, saw him around the grounds a couple of times, always friendly greetings. The Grounds for Caravans etc, is right next to the Amenities building, which was very handy. Toilets and showers were spotless. They have a Laundry, didn’t have to use it, and also washing lines. Also a room with Table tennis, etc, wasn’t there long enough to use it, but looked well equipped-also have a book exchange, so am definitely taking books to swap next time!
It’s definitely on our list of Sites we will return to. Lovely 20 min walk to the Town Centre, and a 19 min walk to the Waterfront Cafe that’s well worth a visit.
Highly recommend a stay.
showerReviews.author: Nell Bea

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed in a 4 person cabin here 3 weeks ago, for a music festival and I have to say, this place was perfect. Cabin had everything, 2 bedrooms, each with a double bed, shower, separate toilet, full kitchen and fridge, TV, etc. A lot of the cabins are permanent residences, but they have a few you can hire out, as well as camping/caravan sites. The few park locals we met were quite friendly, and it's nice and close to the town centre. Will definitely book again if we find ourselves back in Hastings!
showerReviews.author: Lawrence Of Suburbia

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really relaxing and Zen experience! The staff were super friendly and accommodating! The amenities were modern, clean and pleasant to use. I enjoyed the overall atmosphere and the calming vibe of the place!

Would definitely return!

locations.title: Aurora Spa & Bathhouse

showerReviews.reviewText: Superb bathhouse in Sorrento. Must do. Our first trip to the peninsula. We stayed at the Intercontinental- and Aurora Spa is attached to the Hotel. It is a great precinct with the Hotel and plenty of drink and food options. Mineral baths, hot baths, glacier room, sauna, cold plunge, steam room, salt room, waterfall shower, everything you want. Very well appointed, quiet and relaxing, and attentive staff. Would recommend at least one, if not two visits on your stay.
showerReviews.author: Reagan Wilson

showerReviews.reviewText:
My husband and I visited Aurora Spa & Bathhouse for a couples’ wellness day, and it was truly next-level.
From the moment we walked in, everything felt calm, welcoming, and beautifully thought out. The 11-step ritual experience is unlike anything we’ve done before — starting with a cleansing salt scrub, followed by drifting through mineral pools, steam rooms, icy plunges, snow mists (yes, real snow indoors!), guided halotherapy meditation, and more. Every step felt intentional and left us feeling lighter, calmer, and genuinely recharged.

The space itself is stunning — soft lighting, soothing scents, and so much attention to detail, from the Aspar body products in the change rooms to the heated loungers you can relax on between steps.
The team was friendly and made the whole experience effortless, letting us go at our own pace while still offering gentle guidance.

If you’re looking for something more meaningful than just a “spa day,” Aurora is pure wellness heaven. We left feeling like we had hit the reset button on life. Can’t wait to come back!
showerReviews.author: Katie Goldberg

locations.title: Peninsula Hot Springs

showerReviews.reviewText:
Received the Reset Package for Christmas Day (Bathing + Lunch in the Spa Dreaming Centre dining room, plus the Fire & Ice Amphitheatre experience) and it was the best gift ever — 10/10.

The staff were fantastic, food was marvellous, and the atmosphere was calm and luxurious. The no-children policy in the Spa Dreaming Centre and restaurant made it ideal — much quieter and more relaxing. Stunning gardens, spotlessly clean, and beautifully run despite how busy it was on Christmas Day.

The Fire & Ice guided sauna was the perfect finale. Our guide Hayley was marvellous and very knowledgeable — all three of us left completely relaxed. Even the towels and robes felt indulgent and high quality.

If I could give more stars, I would. An outstanding Mornington Peninsula experience.
showerReviews.author: Bri

showerReviews.author: Bri

showerReviews.reviewText:
It was well worth the long drive coming here. The Peninsula Hot Springs is a great location for a family getaway and relaxation is guaranteed.

There's plenty of parking and the facilities for changing and showering are very clean. There are lockers and towels available for a fee as well, should you need those. You're given a robe to use and I'm glad I brought thongs for my feet as it made moving around much easier.

It's much larger than I had imagined. There were so many pools to choose from at various locations. I tried the 30° pool as well as the 40° pool and both were excellent. There's a sauna and even a hammam. It was a cold night so I wasn't brave enough to try the ice cave or the ice pool. There's also spa and wellness packages but I will try that next time.

The location is gorgeous and with opening and closing times so accommodating, you can watch the sun set, as we did, while you're enjoying the view of the trees and listening to natural wildlife sounds. Tickets for us were $55 dollars each so it's not overly expensive but it's still something a family might want to plan for.

It was definitely a fantastic experience and I do recommend this place for families looking for some rest and relaxation.
showerReviews.author: Evasive Envy

locations.title: Massive Massage

showerReviews.reviewText: I've been seeing Nour for deep tissue massage and can't recommend her enough. She genuinely cares about her clients and takes the time to understand and treat the root of any aches or pain. Nour is calm, professional, and always checks in to make sure you're comfortable during the session. Her treatment room is spotless, with fresh towelling and a peaceful atmosphere. She also uses cupping and hot towels, which make a big difference in relieving tension. Nour is hardworking and truly focused on helping you feel better—an excellent therapist all around!
